original: shes pa gzhan gyis rig na ni //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rig na ni //
translated: If it is cognized by another cognition,

original: ring sogs pa 'dzin pa mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: ring sogs pa 'dzin pa mi 'gyur te //
translated: it cannot apprehend length, etc.,

original: yi phyi mang po gnas med phyir //üîΩyul shes pa de shes pa'i khyad par nyid las rang rig pa grub pa ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yi phyi mang po gnas med phyir // yul shes pa de shes pa'i khyad par nyid las rang rig pa grub pa ni ma zad kyi /
translated: because many moments do not exist.

original: dran pa las kyang de grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa las kyang de grub pa yin no //
translated: Not only is reflexive awareness established by the distinctive feature of the cognition of an object, it is also established by memory.

original: gal te dran pa las ni myong ba tsam grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dran pa las ni myong ba tsam grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it just the experience that is established by memory, not reflexive awareness?

original: rang rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not reflexive awareness,

original: gzhan gyis myong ba las yang dran pa 'thad pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba las yang dran pa 'thad pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: because it is only tenable that memory arises from the experience of another?‚Äù

original: de ni lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni lan du mi rung ste /
translated: That is not a response.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is cognized by another cognition,

original: ring po la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: it cannot apprehend length, etc.,

original: phyi mo mang po mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi mo mang po mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: because many moments do not exist.

original: dper na thung du gnyis pa med par sbyor ba na de mi gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na thung du gnyis pa med par sbyor ba na de mi gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when two short vowels are combined, they do not exist.

original: mi gnas pa ni gnas pa dang lhan cig tu rtogs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni gnas pa dang lhan cig tu rtogs pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that that which does not exist does not occur together with that which does exist.

original: ring po dang cher bsrings pa la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ring po dang cher bsrings pa la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: It does not apprehend long, or extended, etc.

original: phyi mo re res 'dzin na ni ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi mo re res 'dzin na ni ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: If it apprehends each moment, it does not apprehend long, etc.

original: chod pa yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chod pa yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not apprehend what is obstructed.

original: snga phyi gcig tu bsdoms nas rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: snga phyi gcig tu bsdoms nas rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it apprehends the sum of the moments, one after another,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de yang rtogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩring po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam zhe nam /
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro // ring po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam zhe nam /
translated: Because that is also an object of knowledge.üîΩBut is not the object of the characteristic of long, etc., known?

original: rtogs mod kyi 'on kyang ring po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don rtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩdes na thung du gnyis bzhin du 'di ni phyi mo gnyis zhes rtogs pa 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rtogs mod kyi 'on kyang ring po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don rtogs pa ni ma yin no // des na thung du gnyis bzhin du 'di ni phyi mo gnyis zhes rtogs pa 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is known, but it is not known by the characteristic of long, etc.

original: ring po gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te rang gi blo rang rig pa yin pa de'i ltar na /
analyzed: ring po gzhan ni ma yin no // gal te rang gi blo rang rig pa yin pa de'i ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is known as two moments, like short, etc., but not as another long, etc.

original: ji ltar ring po la sogs pa 'dzin /
analyzed: ji ltar ring po la sogs pa 'dzin /
translated: If one‚Äôs own mind is reflexive awareness, how does it apprehend long, etc.?

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa na ring po rig par snang bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa na ring po rig par snang bar gzhag go //
translated: When one awareness having that aspect is aware of itself, it is posited as the appearance of the awareness of long, etc.

original: 'o na ni rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa yod pa de nyid de /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa yod pa de nyid de /
translated: But according to those who maintain that there is no self-awareness, the cognition that has the aspect of that object exists, and it is that which is aware of itself.

original: 'on kyang blo gzhan gyis yin pa 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo gzhan gyis yin pa 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But in any case, it is exhausted in being that which is aware of another cognition.

original: gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / rig bya nyid phyir rig bya ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no // 'di ltar / rig bya nyid phyir rig bya ni //
translated: There is no difference between these two positions.üîΩThus:

original: gzhan gyis rig yin phyi rol bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig yin phyi rol bzhin //
translated: Because it is an object of awareness, it is cognized by another, like an external object.

original: des ni blo yang rig bya'i phyir //
analyzed: des ni blo yang rig bya'i phyir //
translated: Since that also is an object of awareness,

original: rig par byed pa gzhan yod 'gyur //
analyzed: rig par byed pa gzhan yod 'gyur //
translated: there would be an infinite regress of cognizers.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yang 'gyur ro //üîΩgsal bya nyid phyir gsal bya ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yang 'gyur ro // gsal bya nyid phyir gsal bya ni //
translated: Because it would also follow that:

original: gzhan gyis gsal yin bum pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal yin bum pa bzhin //
translated: Because it is an object of illumination, it is illuminated by another, like a pot.

original: des nad ni mar me yang //
analyzed: des nad ni mar me yang //
translated: Since that also is an object of illumination,

original: gzhan gyis gsal @111b ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal @111b ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: the light of a lamp would be illuminated by another.

original: 'di la ni cung zhig bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la ni cung zhig bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained a little.

original: gal te blo snga ma blo gzhan gyis rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te blo snga ma blo gzhan gyis rig pa yin na /
translated: If the earlier cognition is cognized by another cognition,

original: de'i tshe ni de'i rnam pa can gyi blo rig pa med pa'i phyir dang / yul yang de'i tshe med pa'i phyir rig pa med pa nyid las nyams su myong ba ma lus pa 'jig par 'gyur to zhes bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de'i rnam pa can gyi blo rig pa med pa'i phyir dang / yul yang de'i tshe med pa'i phyir rig pa med pa nyid las nyams su myong ba ma lus pa 'jig par 'gyur to zhes bstan pa yin no ;
translated: At that time, there is no cognition that has the aspect of that, and at that time the object does not exist, so all experience is destroyed because of the absence of cognition.

original: /'on te yang phyi mo rnams mi gnas pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: /'on te yang phyi mo rnams mi gnas pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: But if the earlier moments do not endure,

original: ring po la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not the case that long and so on are not apprehended.

original: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
translated: That also is not correct, because:

original: gnas na go rims med pas ni //
analyzed: gnas na go rims med pas ni //
translated: If they endure, they are not apprehended

original: blo la cig car snang ba'i phyir //üîΩyi ge rim med ring mi 'gyur //
analyzed: blo la cig car snang ba'i phyir // yi ge rim med ring mi 'gyur //
translated: in a single moment in the mind,üîΩbecause there is no order.

original: gnas pa go rims med par rtogs pa ni ring po la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa go rims med par rtogs pa ni ring po la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If they endure, they are not apprehended as long and so on, because they are apprehended without order.

original: dus rig gyis rtogs pa las ring po zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus rig gyis rtogs pa las ring po zhes rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term long is posited from the perspective of the cognition of time.

original: phyi mo rnams rim pa yang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: phyi mo rnams rim pa yang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But the earlier moments do have order.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mtha'i gnas skabs su 'di ring ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha'i gnas skabs su 'di ring ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the end, it is cognized as ‚Äútoday‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe ni rig pa rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni rig pa rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, there is no cognition of the letters.

original: blo de ni snga ma las gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: blo de ni snga ma las gzhan nyid do //
translated: That cognition is different from the previous one.

original: 'on te 'di ni snod dang phyi ma 'dzin pa cig nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni snod dang phyi ma 'dzin pa cig nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition of the pot and the cognition of the letters are the same,

original: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: phan tshun 'dres pa med pa yis //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres pa med pa yis //
translated: Because they are not mutually inclusive,

original: yig cha rim ldan ji ltar na //
analyzed: yig cha rim ldan ji ltar na //
translated: how could the sequential letters

original: rim med pa la phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: rim med pa la phan 'dogs byed //
translated: assist the cognition of the nonsequential?

original: phan tshun gnas pa med pa nyid kyis ma 'brel par yi ge'i cha snga ma dang phyi ma dag ji ltar blo gcig grub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: phan tshun gnas pa med pa nyid kyis ma 'brel par yi ge'i cha snga ma dang phyi ma dag ji ltar blo gcig grub par byed pa yin /
translated: Because they do not mutually coexist, the earlier and later parts of the letters are not related. How could they establish a single cognition?

original: blo ni yul 'dzin par byed pa yin pas yul tha dad na blo yang tha dad pa yin pas ji ltar rim pa dang ldan par rtogs /
analyzed: blo ni yul 'dzin par byed pa yin pas yul tha dad na blo yang tha dad pa yin pas ji ltar rim pa dang ldan par rtogs /
translated: Because cognition is that which apprehends objects, if the objects are different, the cognitions are also different. How could they be cognized sequentially?

original: de skad du yang don 'ga' yang ma shes na ni blo dmigs pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: de skad du yang don 'ga' yang ma shes na ni blo dmigs pa ma yin te ;
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúIf one does not understand any object, cognition is not observed.

original: don shes na ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: don shes na ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs so zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: If the meaning is understood, it is understood through inference.üîΩJust as the meaning is understood through the understanding of the word, so the word is understood through the understanding of the meaning.

original: ji ltar de don shes pa las don gyi rjes su 'brang nas rtogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de don shes pa las don gyi rjes su 'brang nas rtogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the word is understood through the understanding of the meaning, so the meaning is understood through the understanding of the word.

original: de tha dad pa las tha dad pa can du yang yin no //üîΩ'di ltar de ltar kho bo'i blo skyes so zhes 'jig rten dag tha snyad du byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: de tha dad pa las tha dad pa can du yang yin no // 'di ltar de ltar kho bo'i blo skyes so zhes 'jig rten dag tha snyad du byed pa yin no ;
translated: In this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.

original: /'on te 'di ni don gyi bdag nyid gcig nyid ring po la sogs par rtogs pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / dang po nyid ring po la sogs pa gcig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: /'on te 'di ni don gyi bdag nyid gcig nyid ring po la sogs par rtogs pa yin te / 'di ltar / dang po nyid ring po la sogs pa gcig skye ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.

original: de'i phyir ring po gcig nyid rtogs pas ring po'i blo yang gcig nyid yin no //üîΩzhe na de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ring po gcig nyid rtogs pas ring po'i blo yang gcig nyid yin no // zhe na de yang mi bden te /
translated: In this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.

original: 'di ltar / snga ma mtha' @112a * //üîΩyi bar gnas na //üîΩ'og tu sgra ni 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snga ma mtha' @112a * // yi bar gnas na // 'og tu sgra ni 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: In this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.

original: rim min 'dzin phyir tha mar ni //üîΩrim ldan blo yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rim min 'dzin phyir tha mar ni //üîΩrim ldan blo yang med par 'gyur //
translated: In this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.üîΩIn this way, the word and the meaning are mutually dependent.

original: gal te 'di'i yi ge'i bdag nyid yin na de'i blo dang po nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir dus la sdod par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i yi ge'i bdag nyid yin na de'i blo dang po nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir dus la sdod par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is the nature of the letters, then the cognition of it would not be delayed, because the cognition of it would be the first.

original: snga ma'i cha la mthong bar yang blo thams ring po la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i cha la mthong bar yang blo thams ring po la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cognition of the first part would be the cognition of long, etc.

original: de ste gzhan rtogs par ring po la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ste gzhan rtogs par ring po la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If the cognition of the other is long, etc., then

original: ring po gcig nyid do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te snga ma yang phyi ma'i rjes su 'jug la /
analyzed: ring po gcig nyid do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro // 'on te snga ma yang phyi ma'i rjes su 'jug la /
translated: it would not be a single long.üîΩBut if the former is engaged in the latter,

original: phyi ma gnang yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma gnang yang rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the latter is also engaged in the former,

original: de lta yin na sgra 'phel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na sgra 'phel par 'gyur te /
translated: then sound would be extended,

original: snga ma rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / phyir ma yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / phyir ma yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former is engaged in the latter, and the latter is also engaged in the former.

original: 'di ring po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa yang tha ma'i gnas skabs su yin na de'i tshe ni rim pa med par bzung pas na rim pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i blor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ring po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa yang tha ma'i gnas skabs su yin na de'i tshe ni rim pa med par bzung pas na rim pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i blor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the cognition of long, etc. is in the final state, then at that time, since it is grasped without order, the cognition of that which has order would not occur.

original: snga ma la ltos te rim par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma la ltos te rim par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is a transformation in sequence in dependence on the former, that is not so,

original: blo snga phyi dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo snga phyi dag tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former and latter cognitions are different.

original: 'on te dang po'i skyes ba'i blo gcig po nyid gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dang po'i skyes ba'i blo gcig po nyid gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the one cognition of the first moment of birth endures,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: de 'og yul ni gnas med phyir //
analyzed: de 'og yul ni gnas med phyir //
translated: Because the object does not endure after that,

original: blo ni rang nyid gnas ma yin //
analyzed: blo ni rang nyid gnas ma yin //
translated: the cognition itself does not endure.

original: ma 'phel pa'i sgra ni 'phel pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'phel pa'i sgra ni 'phel pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The sound of non-increase does not exist at the time of increase.

original: de lta na ni 'phel ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir na mi gnas pa nyid do //üîΩ'on te mi gnas kyang rang nyid gnas so zhe nam de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'phel ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir na mi gnas pa nyid do // 'on te mi gnas kyang rang nyid gnas so zhe nam de'i tshe yang /
translated: If that were so, because increase is different, it would not endure.üîΩBut if you say that although it does not endure, it endures by itself,

original: rang nyid gnas na phyi nas ni //
analyzed: rang nyid gnas na phyi nas ni //
translated: then at that time,

original: mi 'dzin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the later and earlier, it would not be apprehended.

original: gal te yul med kyang de 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yul med kyang de 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi blo gnas pa yin na /
translated: If the cognition that apprehends it endures by itself even though the object does not exist,

original: nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur bas shin tu ring bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur bas shin tu ring bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would never disintegrate, so it would be utterly permanent.

original: 'on te yul med pa'i yul 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yul med pa'i yul 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the apprehension of an object that does not exist is not possible,üîΩthen

original: de'i tshe ring por 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ring por 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it would not be apprehended as long,

original: cha tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: cha tsam 'dzin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it would be apprehended as a part.

original: 'on te yi ge'i bdag nyid gcig kho na rim ma yin par skyes pa dus gzhan dus gzhan du sdod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yi ge'i bdag nyid gcig kho na rim ma yin par skyes pa dus gzhan dus gzhan du sdod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is a single entity of a letter, which is not produced in sequence, and it exists at another time and another time,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: yi ge rim med cig can ni //
analyzed: yi ge rim med cig can ni //
translated: The letter is not produced in sequence,

original: skyes pa la yang skyon 'di yin //
analyzed: skyes pa la yang skyon 'di yin //
translated: and there is this error even if it is produced.

original: gal te cig car skyes pas dus cung zad tsam yang sdod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te cig car skyes pas dus cung zad tsam yang sdod pa yin na /
translated: If it is produced all at once and exists for a short time,

original: gtan du gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan du gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: it would exist forever,

original: phyis kyang khyad par me dpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang khyad par me dpa'i phyir ro //
translated: because later it would not be different.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / lan cig btsal phyir rtsol ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lan cig btsal phyir rtsol ba //
translated: because it is sought once, there is no effort.

original: phyi ma phyi ma @112b sdod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma @112b sdod mi 'gyur //
translated: The later part would not exist.

original: rtsol ba gang gis dang po'i rang bzhin bsgrubs pa de nyid kyis phyi ma'i cha yang yin te /
analyzed: rtsol ba gang gis dang po'i rang bzhin bsgrubs pa de nyid kyis phyi ma'i cha yang yin te /
translated: By the effort by which the nature of the first is established, the later part also exists,

original: de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from that.

original: de'i cho gzhan don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i cho gzhan don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Its procedure would be meaningless.

original: yi ge rnams ni gsal ba yang //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni gsal ba yang //
translated: The letters are also manifest.

original: skyon 'di rjes su gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: skyon 'di rjes su gnas pa nyid //
translated: This fault is the same for you.

original: lan cig brtsal bas thams cad gsal ba'i phyir rtsol ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: lan cig brtsal bas thams cad gsal ba'i phyir rtsol ba gzhan med de /
translated: Since all is illuminated by the one who seeks, there is no other effort.

original: de'i phyir blo gcig gi cha shas rnams ring por 'dzin pa ma yin pas khas blangs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gcig gi cha shas rnams ring por 'dzin pa ma yin pas khas blangs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the parts of one cognition do not apprehend length, this must be accepted.

original: de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang /
translated: And at that time,

original: du ma yis ni de 'dzin na //
analyzed: du ma yis ni de 'dzin na //
translated: if many apprehend that,

original: tha ma'i blo gang de myong la //
analyzed: tha ma'i blo gang de myong la //
translated: then the final cognition would experience that,

original: de yang ring por 'dzin min na //
analyzed: de yang ring por 'dzin min na //
translated: but that does not apprehend length.

original: des na ring blo dran mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na ring blo dran mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore the cognition of length would not be remembered.

original: gang gi tshe blo du mas cha shas rnams ring por 'dzin na na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe blo du mas cha shas rnams ring por 'dzin na na de'i tshe /
translated: When many cognitions apprehend the parts as long,

original: tha ma'i blo blo gzhan gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: tha ma'i blo blo gzhan gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: then the final cognition would be experienced by another cognition.

original: de yang ring por 'dzin pa ma yin pa des na ji ltar ring po'i blo dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang ring por 'dzin pa ma yin pa des na ji ltar ring po'i blo dran par 'gyur /
translated: But that does not apprehend length. Therefore how could the cognition of length be remembered?

original: nyams su ma myong ba'i dran pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba'i dran pa yin no //
translated: It would be the memory of what was not experienced.

original: nyams su myong yang blo tha ma blo gzhan gyis myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong yang blo tha ma blo gzhan gyis myong ba yin gyi /
translated: Even if it were experienced, the final cognition would be experienced by another cognition.

original: blo snga ma dag ni tshod pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: blo snga ma dag ni tshod pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
translated: The former cognitions are destroyed, so they are not experienced.

original: tha ma yang ring por 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha ma yang ring por 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The final one does not apprehend the long.

original: de'i phyir ring po la sogs pa'i blo dran par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ring po la sogs pa'i blo dran par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of long and so on would not be remembered.

original: 'on te blo rnams blo gzhan gyis so sor 'dzin pa de'i phyir thams cad dran pas ring ba'i blo dran pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te blo rnams blo gzhan gyis so sor 'dzin pa de'i phyir thams cad dran pas ring ba'i blo dran pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the cognitions are individually apprehended by other cognitions, then all are remembered by memory, and the cognition of long is remembered.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / blo rnams so so tha dad du //
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo rnams so so tha dad du //
translated: If the cognitions are experienced individually,

original: myong na de sgra thos pa ni //
analyzed: myong na de sgra thos pa ni //
translated: then the sound that is heard

original: chod pa med par snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chod pa med par snang mi 'gyur //
translated: would not appear without interruption.

original: sbyor ba byed pa'ang gsal ba yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba byed pa'ang gsal ba yin //
translated: The application is also clear.

original: blo 'dzin pa'i blo rnams kyis sgra'i cha'i blo rnam par bcad pa'i phyir rnam par ma bcad pas mi snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo 'dzin pa'i blo rnams kyis sgra'i cha'i blo rnam par bcad pa'i phyir rnam par ma bcad pas mi snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognitions that apprehend the cognitions do not eliminate the cognitions of the aspects of sound, so they do not appear without being eliminated.

original: rnam par bcad pa ni rnam par ma cad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa ni rnam par ma cad par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is eliminated cannot be understood without being eliminated.

original: mtshams sbyar bas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyar bas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is understood through connection,üîΩthen that is also illogical.

original: de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is as follows:

original: sbyor bar byed pa'ang gsal ba ni //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa'ang gsal ba ni //
translated: The one who is applying himself to the clear

original: de ni gzhan la'ang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la'ang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: That is also the same for others.

original: yi ge 'ang cig car thos par 'gyur //
analyzed: yi ge 'ang cig car thos par 'gyur //
translated: And the letters are heard simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so//
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so//
translated: And so on.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te chad pa mthong yang ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te chad pa mthong yang ni //
translated: If, even though one sees the break,

original: rnam chad med par 'khrul 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam chad med par 'khrul 'gyur na /
translated: there is confusion without a break,

original: thung du gnyis na brjod par yang //
analyzed: thung du gnyis na brjod par yang //
translated: then, when two short ones are uttered,

original: rnam chad med par 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam chad med par 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: there would be confusion without a break.

original: thung du gnyis ni bar med par brjod pa ma yin pas rnam par chad pa ma yin pas na rnam par chad pa'i phyir gcig pa'i blo med pa yin no//
analyzed: thung du gnyis ni bar med par brjod pa ma yin pas rnam par chad pa ma yin pas na rnam par chad pa'i phyir gcig pa'i blo med pa yin no//
translated: Since two short ones are not uttered without a break, there is no break. Therefore, there is no cognition of oneness because of the break.

original: @113a * // gal te phyi ma la yang rnam par chad pa de yod pa nyid yin la de lta na yang rnam par chad pa me dpas rlom pa yin no //üîΩ'o na ni thung du gnyis brjod pa la yang rigs pa /
analyzed: @113a * // gal te phyi ma la yang rnam par chad pa de yod pa nyid yin la de lta na yang rnam par chad pa me dpas rlom pa yin no // 'o na ni thung du gnyis brjod pa la yang rigs pa /
translated: If there is that very break in the latter case, and even though it is so, there is no break, then one would be conceited about the break.

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir na ci ste ma mthong /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir na ci ste ma mthong /
translated: But then, since the reasoning is the same, why is it not seen in the utterance of two short ones?

original: 'di ni rnam par chad pa rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par ma chad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par chad pa rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par ma chad pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is not the understanding of a divided object, but rather the understanding of an undivided object.

original: 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di nyid bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di nyid bzod pa yin no //
translated: This position is acceptable to us, that there is no error.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / dbang po rnam chad mthong ba yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbang po rnam chad mthong ba yang //
translated: Even though the seeing is divided,

original: dbang po las chad mi sgro 'dogs //üîΩmi rung dbang po'i blo thams cad //
analyzed: dbang po las chad mi sgro 'dogs // mi rung dbang po'i blo thams cad //
translated: the mind does not superimpose the division on the object.

original: phyin ci log tu thal phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu thal phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that all cognitions of the senses would be erroneous.

original: gal te rnam par chad pa med par rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par chad pa med par rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it were the case that the error lay in the understanding of the object as undivided,

original: de'i tshe dbang po la 'am yid las byung ba yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po la 'am yid las byung ba yin /
translated: then would it arise from the senses or from the mind?

original: gal te yid las byung ba ma yin na ni dbang po'i blo thams cad phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yid las byung ba ma yin na ni dbang po'i blo thams cad phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not arise from the mind, then all cognitions of the senses would be erroneous.

original: 'di ltar yi ge'i bdag nyid kun mtha' yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge'i bdag nyid kun mtha' yang //
translated: Because the nature of all letters is such that

original: mi 'dzums tshad du gnas pa yin //üîΩde yang rim gyis rdul phran ni //
analyzed: mi 'dzums tshad du gnas pa yin // de yang rim gyis rdul phran ni //
translated: they are all present in the space of the unblinking eye.üîΩMoreover, they are complete in the gradual arrangement

original: du ma dag dang 'brel par rdzogs //
analyzed: du ma dag dang 'brel par rdzogs //
translated: of many minute particles.

original: rtul gcig mnga' dus chung ba yi //
analyzed: rtul gcig mnga' dus chung ba yi //
translated: When one particle is present, the others are not,üîΩand when one is absent, the others are not present either.

original: mthar thug dus kyang skad cig 'dod //
analyzed: mthar thug dus kyang skad cig 'dod //
translated: And the final moment is also asserted to be a moment.

original: blo yang skad cig de nyid 'dod //
analyzed: blo yang skad cig de nyid 'dod //
translated: And the cognition is also asserted to be that very moment.

original: yi ge rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: yi ge rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: The letters are understood in sequence.

original: de phyir ye he gzugs sogs la //
analyzed: de phyir ye he gzugs sogs la //
translated: Therefore, in regard to form, etc.,

original: blo gzhan gyis ni chod na yang //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis ni chod na yang //
translated: even when interrupted by other cognitions,

original: chod pa med par snang ba can //
analyzed: chod pa med par snang ba can //
translated: if they appear without interruption,

original: thams cad log pa'i don can 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad log pa'i don can 'gyur //
translated: all would have a non-interrupted object.

original: yi ge thams cad ni rim gyis rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge thams cad ni rim gyis rtogs pa yin te /
translated: All letters are understood in sequence,

original: skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan rgyun dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyis yi ge 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan rgyun dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyis yi ge 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the continuum of other moments holds the letters.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang rim gyis skye ba la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la yang rim gyis skye ba la brten pa yin no //
translated: And in regard to form, etc., it is based on arising in sequence.

original: des na de yang dbang pos mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du rtog pa 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: des na de yang dbang pos mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du rtog pa 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, that also, like a whirling firebrand, generates the error of conception.

original: 'gar yang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gar yang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is never an error.

original: 'on te yid las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yid las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is an error arising from the mind,

original: de'i tshe nyes pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: then another fault would arise.

original: 'di ltar / dbang po'i 'khrul pa las gzhan du//
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbang po'i 'khrul pa las gzhan du//
translated: Apart from the error of the sense faculty,

original: dngos po rnam ni sbyor byed pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnam ni sbyor byed pa //
translated: the object is not connected.

original: tha dad mtshon byed 'khrul pa gang //
analyzed: tha dad mtshon byed 'khrul pa gang //
translated: The error that is the indicator of difference

original: dran yin de ni rnam rtog can //
analyzed: dran yin de ni rnam rtog can //
translated: is memory, and that is conceptual.üîΩHow can there be clear appearance from that,

original: brjod dang 'brel pa de las ni //
analyzed: brjod dang 'brel pa de las ni //
translated: which is related to expression?

original: gsal bar snang nyid ga la zhig / yid kyis bslad pa ni gsal ba nyid las 'das sam /
analyzed: gsal bar snang nyid ga la zhig / yid kyis bslad pa ni gsal ba nyid las 'das sam /
translated: Is the corruption of the mind beyond clear appearance?

original: 'jug pa nyid gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa nyid gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rung ste /
translated: Or is engagement itself clear appearance? This is not tenable.

original: @113b yi ge la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa ni gsal ba'i rnam par 'dod pas de ji lta na yid las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yin zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: @113b yi ge la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa ni gsal ba'i rnam par 'dod pas de ji lta na yid las byung ba'i 'khrul pa yin zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: Because consciousness that has the aspect of letters and so on is asserted to be clear appearance, how could it be tenable to say that it is a corruption arising from the mind?

original: brjod pa dang 'brel pa nyid la ni gsal bar snang ba srid pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam rtog rjes su 'grel pa ni //üîΩdon gsal snang ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'brel pa nyid la ni gsal bar snang ba srid pa ma yin te / rnam rtog rjes su 'grel pa ni // don gsal snang ba nyid ma yin //
translated: It is not possible for clear appearance to exist in that which is related to expression.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained:üîΩThe conceptual does not have the clear appearance of the object.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: dbang pos gzugs gsal sgra sbyor ba //
analyzed: dbang pos gzugs gsal sgra sbyor ba //
translated: The sense faculty connects with clear form and sound.

original: yod pa min zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yod pa min zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it does not exist.

original: 'on te / dbang pos chod pa mthong ba yang //
analyzed: 'on te / dbang pos chod pa mthong ba yang //
translated: But if you say that you see something obstructed by a sense faculty,

original: gal te rtogs pas sbyor byed na //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pas sbyor byed na //
translated: and if you apply the idea of a single cognition,üîΩthen the appearance of a disconnected object

original: rgyu min chad par snang ba dag / rigs dam gnod pa can med pa //üîΩchod pa zhes bya de gang las //
analyzed: rgyu min chad par snang ba dag / rigs dam gnod pa can med pa // chod pa zhes bya de gang las //
translated: would be without a cause.

original: rnam par chad pa med par snang ba ni rnam par chad par bya ba yin no zhes brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa med par snang ba ni rnam par chad par bya ba yin no zhes brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that a disconnected appearance is something that is connected.

original: mngon sum ni gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni gzhan du brtag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception cannot be analyzed in any other way.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir rtogs pa nyid med pa yin par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir rtogs pa nyid med pa yin par brtags pa yin no //
translated: Since it is undermined by direct perception, it is not tenable to analyze the absence of a single cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore this is not tenable.

original: 'on te rang rig pa med pa'i phyir blo gzhan gyis rig par khas len pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang rig pa med pa'i phyir blo gzhan gyis rig par khas len pa yin na /
translated: But if you accept that the mind is cognized by another mind because there is no reflexive awareness,

original: blo gcig par 'byung ba yang ma yin ste /
analyzed: blo gcig par 'byung ba yang ma yin ste /
translated: then the mind does not arise as a single entity.

original: des na blo gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir rnam par chad par mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na blo gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir rnam par chad par mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is obstructed by another mind, it is seen as disconnected.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: gal te blo nus nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te blo nus nges pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that the mind is limited because of its object,

original: zhe na de ni ga las 'dod //
analyzed: zhe na de ni ga las 'dod //
translated: why do you think that?

original: gcig par blo ni mthong med phyir //
analyzed: gcig par blo ni mthong med phyir //
translated: Because the mind does not see a unity.

original: de nyid 'di ltar dpyad bya yin //
analyzed: de nyid 'di ltar dpyad bya yin //
translated: This is what we must investigate.

original: blo rnams nus pa nges pas na //
analyzed: blo rnams nus pa nges pas na //
translated: If the mind is limited because of the limitation of its object,

original: gcig par mi 'gyur pa yin na //
analyzed: gcig par mi 'gyur pa yin na //
translated: why is the mind not limited to a unity?

original: nus pa nges pa nyid gang las nges par bya /
analyzed: nus pa nges pa nyid gang las nges par bya /
translated: From what is the limitation of the object determined?

original: 'on te gcig par ma mthong ba'i phyir nus pa nges pa yin na 'o na ni rnam par chad pa mthong ba med de /
analyzed: 'on te gcig par ma mthong ba'i phyir nus pa nges pa yin na 'o na ni rnam par chad pa mthong ba med de /
translated: If the mind is limited because of the non-perception of a unity, then the perception of a multiplicity is not perceived,

original: ma mthong na ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong na ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived in the unity.

original: 'on te der ma mthong ba tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te der ma mthong ba tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the non-perception of a multiplicity in a unity is valid,

original: 'o na cig car ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir rnam par chad pa mthong ba rtog ce na /
analyzed: 'o na cig car ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir rnam par chad pa mthong ba rtog ce na /
translated: then why do you imagine that the perception of a multiplicity is valid because of the perception of a non-unity?

original: 'di rnam par dpyad dgos so //
analyzed: 'di rnam par dpyad dgos so //
translated: This must be investigated.

original: gal te blo gcig par mthong ba med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te blo gcig par mthong ba med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the mind does not see a unity?

original: don rtogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: don rtogs pa yin yang /
translated: But it does understand the object.

original: byung ba dang byung ba'i rang bzhin mthong bar gcig par dmigs pa ni med de /
analyzed: byung ba dang byung ba'i rang bzhin mthong bar gcig par dmigs pa ni med de /
translated: The perception of a unity is not the perception of a multiplicity and its nature.

original: rim pa kho nas snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa kho nas snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear in a certain order.

original: khyed la lung yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed la lung yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: You have no scriptural authority,üîΩbecause it is said,

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni gnas pa ma yin zhi /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni gnas pa ma yin zhi /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not a place to stay,

original: go skabs med de /
analyzed: go skabs med de /
translated: there is no opportunity for you here.

original: sems gnyis snga skyed pa la ltos nas pa nges yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems gnyis snga skyed pa la ltos nas pa nges yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äù The mind is determined in relation to the prior generation of a mind of the same type, not in relation to a universal.

original: 'di na / de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di na / de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is also not tenable,

original: de rnams @114a * //
analyzed: de rnams @114a * //
translated: because those

original: rigs mthun pa yin la //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa yin la //
translated: are of a homogeneous type.

original: nus pa des par 'gyur pa yin //üîΩ'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams //
analyzed: nus pa des par 'gyur pa yin // 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams //
translated: The capacity is certain.üîΩThus, it is correctly understood

original: rim gyis 'byung bar yang dag rtogs //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung bar yang dag rtogs //
translated: that conceptual thoughts occur in a certain order.

original: blo rnams ni rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la ltos nas pa nges yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo rnams ni rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa la ltos nas pa nges yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind is determined in relation to the generation of a consciousness of a homogeneous type, not in relation to a universal.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang dag par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang dag par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is correctly understood that conceptual thoughts occur in a certain order.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni rigs mthun pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid skyed par mi byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni rigs mthun pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid skyed par mi byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Eye consciousness and so on do not generate eye consciousness and so on of a homogeneous type, but all do not.

original: de la gal te rigs mi mthun pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis skyed pa las 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: de la gal te rigs mi mthun pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis skyed pa las 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: But if it is argued that there is no contradiction in the production of two things of different types, the apprehended and apprehender,

original: nge shes pa zhes bya'i rtog pa rnam par rtog pa yin yang gsal bar snang ba pha rol po dag 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nge shes pa zhes bya'i rtog pa rnam par rtog pa yin yang gsal bar snang ba pha rol po dag 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is it not the case that the thought called ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is a conceptual thought, but it is asserted by others to appear clearly?

original: 'dod pa ni ma yin na de lta na ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / 'di ni gang zhig mthong don la //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ma yin na de lta na ni ma yin no // 'di ltar / 'di ni gang zhig mthong don la //
translated: If it is not asserted, then it is not so.üîΩIn this way:üîΩThe thought that recognizesüîΩThe object seen is not a direct perception

original: ngo shes byed pa'i rtogs pa dag / gsal bar snang bas mngon sum du //
analyzed: ngo shes byed pa'i rtogs pa dag / gsal bar snang bas mngon sum du //
translated: Because it appears clearly.

original: rtogs pa de yang bsal ba yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang bsal ba yin //
translated: That thought is also excluded.

original: dbang po'i rnam pa la snga phyi 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam pa la snga phyi 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aspect of the sense faculty does not have the capacity to apprehend earlier and later,üîΩthe thought itself that appears clearly is direct perception.

original: gsal bar snang pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid mngon sum yin no zhes mngon sum nyid du sems pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no ;
analyzed: gsal bar snang pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid mngon sum yin no zhes mngon sum nyid du sems pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no ;
translated: That thought is also excluded.üîΩIn this way:

original: /'di ltar / rtogs pa gsal bar snang min pas //
analyzed: /'di ltar / rtogs pa gsal bar snang min pas //
translated: Because the thought does not appear clearly,

original: de ni ji ltar mngon sum nyid //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar mngon sum nyid //
translated: how can it be direct perception?

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid yin yang //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid yin yang //
translated: Even though they appear clearly,

original: 'khrul phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin //üîΩ'di ltar / skra dang sgong dang mar me sogs //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin // 'di ltar / skra dang sgong dang mar me sogs //
translated: they are not valid cognitions because of being mistaken.üîΩThus,üîΩEven though there is clear appearanceüîΩin the cognition of separate hairs,

original: tha dad rtogs pa dag la yang //üîΩgsal snang yod min de 'dra'i blo//
analyzed: tha dad rtogs pa dag la yang // gsal snang yod min de 'dra'i blo//
translated: eggs, lamps, and so on,

original: ji ltar mngon sum yin par 'gyur //üîΩ'on te der ni gnod pa yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum yin par 'gyur // 'on te der ni gnod pa yod pa'i phyir //
translated: how can such a cognition be a perception?üîΩBut if it is not a perception because it is impaired,

original: mngon sum nyid ma yin na gang gis gnod //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ma yin na gang gis gnod //
translated: by what is it impaired?

original: bar du chod pas so //
analyzed: bar du chod pas so //
translated: By the obstruction.

original: 'di la yang snga phyi'i rang bzhin snang ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par chad pa yod pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir do shes pa las ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang snga phyi'i rang bzhin snang ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par chad pa yod pa nyid do // de'i phyir do shes pa las ni /
translated: Here too, there is a discontinuity in the nature of the appearance of the earlier and later [moments].üîΩTherefore,

original: yig sogs gcig tu nges pa med //
analyzed: yig sogs gcig tu nges pa med //
translated: in the cognition of a letter, there is no ascertainment of a single [entity].

original: tshad mas ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad mas ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not a valid cognition.

original: yig rnams phyi mo tha dad kyang //üîΩngo shes pa yis gcig nyid du //
analyzed: yig rnams phyi mo tha dad kyang // ngo shes pa yis gcig nyid du //
translated: Even though the letters are different,üîΩthe recognition of them as the same

original: rtogs pa de ni ring po sogs //
analyzed: rtogs pa de ni ring po sogs //
translated: occurs in the cognition of a word.

original: ci nas 'dzin par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ci nas 'dzin par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: But how can that be apprehended as a single entity?

original: shes gang smas pa de yang tshig tsam du zad de /
analyzed: shes gang smas pa de yang tshig tsam du zad de /
translated: The cognition of a word is also just words.

original: ngo shes pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes bstan @114b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes bstan @114b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The point of this is to show that recognition is a valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang ngo shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa dang mngon sum du ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa dang mngon sum du ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, recognition is not produced by the sense faculties and is not direct perception.

original: 'di ltar / sngon myong dran las de yi chos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngon myong dran las de yi chos //
translated: Because it remembers what was experienced before,

original: sgro 'dogs med par de nyid ni //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs med par de nyid ni //
translated: it is not a direct perception of that thing.

original: 'di zhes bya bar shes pa med //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bar shes pa med //
translated: It does not know that thing as ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: de yang ltar dbang skyes yin //
analyzed: de yang ltar dbang skyes yin //
translated: And it is not produced by the sense faculties.

original: sngon myong ba med par ni mi dran la /
analyzed: sngon myong ba med par ni mi dran la /
translated: One does not remember without having experienced something before.

original: dran pa med na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa med na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And without memory, one cannot know that thing as it is, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa ni da ltar myong ba la ngon myong bar gyur pa dang gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni da ltar myong ba la ngon myong bar gyur pa dang gcig tu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Recognition is by nature the apprehension of what is currently experienced as being the same as what was experienced before.

original: dran pa med pa yang sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa med pa yang sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: And without memory, one does not apprehend the object of memory as having the nature of the past.

original: dran pa'i yul gyi don ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa'i yul gyi don ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
translated: The object of memory is not the object of direct perception.

original: gzhan du na sngon myong ba thams cad mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bas na nga ltar gyi dbang po byed pas ci bya /
analyzed: gzhan du na sngon myong ba thams cad mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bas na nga ltar gyi dbang po byed pas ci bya /
translated: Otherwise, all past experiences would be direct perception. What use is there in the activity of the sense faculties of the present?

original: 'on te rgyan zhig la sngon mthong ba mi dran par yang 'gyur ba des na da ltar gyi dbang po'i byed pa la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyan zhig la sngon mthong ba mi dran par yang 'gyur ba des na da ltar gyi dbang po'i byed pa la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that even though one does not remember seeing something in the past, it is still dependent on the activity of the present sense faculties,

original: gal te lta na dbang po'i byed pa de nyid du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te lta na dbang po'i byed pa de nyid du 'gyur mod /
translated: then it would be the activity of the sense faculties of the present.

original: yul du song bas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yul du song bas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of the object having gone to the sense faculties?

original: yul rung ba nyid med pas dbang pos mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: yul rung ba nyid med pas dbang pos mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is not suitable because it does not exist, the sense faculties cannot engage it,

original: gal te de lha na yul gzhan du mthong ba las ngo shes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te de lha na yul gzhan du mthong ba las ngo shes pa med do //
translated: then if it exists, it is not recognized as the object seen in the past.

original: yul gzhan dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the object that is related to another object does not exist in a suitable object.

original: yul gnyi ga dang 'brel pa can nyid rung ba'i yul na gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gnyi ga dang 'brel pa can nyid rung ba'i yul na gnas pa yin te /
translated: If the object that is related to both objects exists in a suitable object,

original: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: then this fault does not exist.

original: dran pa med pa nyid du ci ste mi rtogs /
analyzed: dran pa med pa nyid du ci ste mi rtogs /
translated: Why do you not think that it is simply a memory?

original: 'o na dran pa yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na dran pa yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how can memory be of that very object?

original: 'brel pa yang dran pa'i phyir snga ma dag nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang dran pa'i phyir snga ma dag nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: The past masters say that there is no fault, because there is a connection between the memory and the object.

original: do shes pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: do shes pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But that is not a valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa med pa yin gyi 'brel pa can ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa yin gyi 'brel pa can ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the memory is not connected with the object, but is connected with something else that is connected with the object,

original: 'o na ni de la sngon gyi yul dang dus dang 'brel pa med pas da ltar ba kho na'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir snga ma phyi ma dag tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni de la sngon gyi yul dang dus dang 'brel pa med pas da ltar ba kho na'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir snga ma phyi ma dag tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: then the object of the memory is not the object of the past, because it is not connected with the past. Therefore, the object of the memory is the present object, and the past and present objects are different.

original: 'on te de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin na ni de nyid gang gis rtogs zhes de nyid dpyod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin na ni de nyid gang gis rtogs zhes de nyid dpyod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if you say that the object of the memory is not different from the object of the past, because it is recognized as being that very object, then why do you ask, ‚ÄúBy what is that very object known?‚ÄùüîΩYou are just analyzing that very object.

original: rtogs pa tsam tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Mere recognition is not a valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gal gyi ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum nyid sgrub par byed pa'i gal gyi ci zhig bya /
translated: If it were, then what would be the point of proving that perception is a valid cognition?

original: gal te sngon gyi dus la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs pa yang /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi dus la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs pa yang /
translated: If you think that the object of the memory is recognized as being the same as the object of the past,

original: rtag pa nyid yin par brjod na don thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin par brjod na don thams cad rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is permanent, then all things would be permanent.

original: de'i tshe skyes pa yang ngo //üîΩda lta @115a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes pa yang ngo // da lta @115a * //
translated: If you say that it is impermanent, then it would not be the self.

original: ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na yang rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa na yang rtag pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that it is both permanent and impermanent, then it would be both of those faults.üîΩIf you say that it is neither permanent nor impermanent, then it would be neither of those two.

original: gal te skad cig de la skyes na ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te skad cig de la skyes na ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin /
translated: If you say that it is produced in that moment, then how could it be impermanent?

original: gal te yang sngar ma skyes pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yang sngar ma skyes pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that it is not produced before, then it would exist.

original: ma skyes pa ji ltar yod zhig pa yang ji ltar yod ces rtsod pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ji ltar yod zhig pa yang ji ltar yod ces rtsod pa mtshungs so //
translated: How could the unproduced exist? How could the destroyed exist? The dispute is the same.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa dag la ni khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between that which did not exist before and that which exists after destruction.

original: khyad par ni 'di yod de zhig pa ni dran pa yin no //üîΩsnga ma byung ba yang srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yod de zhig pa ni dran pa yin no // snga ma byung ba yang srid pa'i rjes su dpag pas rtogs so //
translated: This is the difference: the destroyed is remembered.üîΩThe past is understood through inference of existence.

original: 'byung ba nyid du rtogs kyi snga ma nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid du rtogs kyi snga ma nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is understood as an element, not as past.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i mngon na sum du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i mngon na sum du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Would it not be the case that the cognition would be of the arising of that which is non-existent?

original: des na de'i tshe med pa phyis 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: des na de'i tshe med pa phyis 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that, then it would be the case that what was non-existent previously would arise later.

original: 'di yang mngon sum du gyur to shes sngon du byung ba nyid du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang mngon sum du gyur to shes sngon du byung ba nyid du rtogs kyi /
translated: But this is not the case, for the cognition is of the existence of that which has already occurred.

original: da ltar yod do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar yod do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not of the existence of that which is present.

original: 'gyur mod ji ltar da ltar yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur mod ji ltar da ltar yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But how can it be that it exists in the present?

original: da ltar yang yod pa'i phyir da ltar yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar yang yod pa'i phyir da ltar yang yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists in the present because it exists in the present,

original: 'o na dbus su ji ltar yod ces bya //
analyzed: 'o na dbus su ji ltar yod ces bya //
translated: then how can it exist in the middle?

original: da lta mngon par nyid las te //
analyzed: da lta mngon par nyid las te //
translated: It is present because it is present in the present.

original: sngar med pa ni da ltar dmigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sngar med pa ni da ltar dmigs pa ma yin na /
translated: If what did not exist previously is not perceived in the present,

original: 'o na 'di mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: 'o na 'di mngon sum yin no //
translated: then how can it be direct perception?

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference either,

original: de sngon yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation of invariable concomitance has not been apprehended previously.

original: bar chad med par mthong ba la 'brel pa 'dzin to zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med par mthong ba la 'brel pa 'dzin to zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is related to the perception that is not interrupted, that is not so.

original: bar chad med par mthong ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med par mthong ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition in the perception that is not interrupted.

original: bar chad me dpar ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba yang dran pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar chad me dpar ngas mthong ngo zhes bya ba yang dran pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: And the statement ‚ÄúI see the perception that is not interrupted‚Äù is not a valid cognition other than memory.

original: de nyid ngo she spa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ngo she spa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is just that, it is not so.

original: tshad ma nyid gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the valid cognition itself that is being clarified.

original: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is valid cognition because it is nondeceptive,

original: de'i phyir mi slu ba 'di don med pa tsam la yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slu ba 'di don med pa tsam la yin te /
translated: then this nondeceptiveness is only in regard to a mere object that is not nonexistent.

original: don bya ba med pa yin gyi de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba med pa yin gyi de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not in regard to the object itself, because that does not exist.

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin de nyid don //
analyzed: de lta ma yin de nyid don //
translated: If it were not so, it would be that itself.

original: bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is related to the object.

original: de nyid kyi tshe don bya ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe don bya ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the object would be experienced.

original: don bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because there is no object,

original: de ni ji ltar bya ba dang 'brel pa gzhan dag tha mi dang phyis de nyid la don bya ba myong ba yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad de gang gi phyir de la yang don bya ba gzhan mi slu ba khas blang bar bya ba yin
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bya ba dang 'brel pa gzhan dag tha mi dang phyis de nyid la don bya ba myong ba yin no zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad de gang gi phyir de la yang don bya ba gzhan mi slu ba khas blang bar bya ba yin
translated: It is not tenable to say that the object is experienced later, because the object is not different from the experience.

original: la / de la yang gzhan yin las mthar thug pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la / de la yang gzhan yin las mthar thug pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is not tenable to say that the object is experienced later, because it is related to another action.

original: de'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes @115b bya ba 'di ni gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes @115b bya ba 'di ni gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that recognition is a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir phyi mo 'dzin par 'bad pa'i phyir bar mchod pa med par ring po la sogs par 'dzin par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi mo 'dzin par 'bad pa'i phyir bar mchod pa med par ring po la sogs par 'dzin par 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of apprehending the prior, the apprehension of long and so on is not without an intermediate step.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa gcig par skye bar 'dod na de yang mi 'thad do 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa gcig par skye bar 'dod na de yang mi 'thad do 'di ltar /
translated: But if you assert that it arises as a single consciousness, that is also untenable.

original: don dang shes pa myong ba dag / gcig par 'byung bar 'dod min zhing //
analyzed: don dang shes pa myong ba dag / gcig par 'byung bar 'dod min zhing //
translated: It is not asserted that the experience of objects and consciousnessesüîΩArises as a single entity.

original: don dang shes pa'i bdag nyid dag / so sor rtogs pa'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: don dang shes pa'i bdag nyid dag / so sor rtogs pa'ang yod ma yin //
translated: And it is not the case that the nature of objects and consciousnessesüîΩIs individually realized.

original: shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags yin pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa cig car mi skye ba ni yid kyi rtags yin pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fact that consciousness does not arise simultaneously is a sign of the intellect.

original: don snang ba'i shes pa dang don yang gar ba rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don snang ba'i shes pa dang don yang gar ba rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness that appears as an object and the object are not realized as different.

original: rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa nyid snang bar rtogs kyi /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa nyid snang bar rtogs kyi /
translated: The nature of reflexive awareness is the realization that external blue, etc., appear.

original: de la gzhan yang rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan yang rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the realization of something else.

original: 'on te de gnyis ka rnam pa gcig nyid kyis ma 'phrigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de gnyis ka rnam pa gcig nyid kyis ma 'phrigs pa yin te /
translated: If both are not realized as having the same aspect,

original: dper na bde ba dang de rig pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na bde ba dang de rig pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like pleasure and the awareness of pleasure,

original: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste 'di ltar /
translated: that is also unacceptable.üîΩThe consciousness that appears as an object

original: don du snang ba'i rnam shes dang // phyir rol gyi don 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: don du snang ba'i rnam shes dang // phyir rol gyi don 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: and an external object alone

original: rnam pa gcig phyir gzung min te //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig phyir gzung min te //
translated: are not apprehended as having the same aspect

original: tha dad med par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad med par thal phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they are not different.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa dag dang de'i blo yang rnam pa gcig nyid yin na de'i tshe de la tha dad pa med pa nyid do //

translated: The experience of the experience of the object, blue, and so on, is not a different experience from the experience of the object.üîΩOr, the aspect of blue, and so on, and the experience of pleasure are one cognition, and there is no other apprehender of the experience of pleasure, and so on.

translated: Conceptual thoughts of the past, etc., are not connected with the sense faculties.

original: des na ji ltar nyams su myong ba nyid du nges //
analyzed: des na ji ltar nyams su myong ba nyid du nges //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that it is just the experience itself.

original: de'i phyir don la sems par mi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir don la sems par mi 'gyur gyi //
translated: Thus, it is not the object that is reflected upon,

original: sems pa la sogs pa sems pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa sems pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: but the reflection itself, and so on, ad infinitum.

original: 'on te der yang yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyi don yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyi don yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the object that exists in another place and time is the object,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe thams cad du gegs byed par 'gyur ba yin la de lta yin dang 'pho bar mi 'pho bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe thams cad du gegs byed par 'gyur ba yin la de lta yin dang 'pho bar mi 'pho bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: then at that time, it would be an obstruction everywhere, and thus it would not move or it would move everywhere,

original: de nyid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be blocked by that.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la ni don nye bar gnas pa nyid gegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la ni don nye bar gnas pa nyid gegs byed pa yin te /
translated: In the case of a sense consciousness, the presence of an object is an obstruction,

original: des na blo dang des rig pa dag rgyun rnam par 'chad par 'gyur la res 'ga' ba ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na blo dang des rig pa dag rgyun rnam par 'chad par 'gyur la res 'ga' ba ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and thus the continuum of the mind and what it knows would be interrupted. But it is not so in the case of the occasional.

original: dpyod pa'i rgyun la ni don chad pa yang yul yin pa'i phyir gtan du gegs byed pa yod pas na /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i rgyun la ni don chad pa yang yul yin pa'i phyir gtan du gegs byed pa yod pas na /
translated: But in the case of the continuum of analysis, the object is interrupted, and thus there is a permanent obstruction,üîΩbecause the object is not present.

original: der don nyid rig par 'gyur gyi rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rig pa dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der don nyid rig par 'gyur gyi rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir rig pa dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not cognition, because it is the object itself that is cognized, not cognition.

original: 'on te gegs byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gegs byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not an obstruction,

original: de lta yin na sems pa sems pa la sogs @117b pa'i rgyun rig pa nyid du 'gyur bas don la sems pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na sems pa sems pa la sogs @117b pa'i rgyun rig pa nyid du 'gyur bas don la sems pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the continuum of the mind, such as intention and so on, would be cognition itself, and it would be impossible for the mind to be directed to an object.

original: 'on te yang gang gis bdag la shes pa skyed par byed pa nus pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la de rim gyis zad par gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gang gis bdag la shes pa skyed par byed pa nus pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la de rim gyis zad par gyur pas na /
translated: But if you say that the self has some potential to generate cognition, and that potential gradually diminishes,

original: yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: and that is why the mind is directed to another object,

original: de yang mi rigs te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te 'di ltar /
translated: that also is illogical.

original: gal te bdag la shes skyed pa'i //
analyzed: gal te bdag la shes skyed pa'i //
translated: If the potential to generate cognition

original: nus pa rim gyis zad pa na //
analyzed: nus pa rim gyis zad pa na //
translated: gradually diminishes,

original: yul gzhan la ni 'pho 'gyur na //
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni 'pho 'gyur na //
translated: and the mind is directed to another object,

original: don blo de nyid gang las yin //
analyzed: don blo de nyid gang las yin //
translated: then what is the mind that cognizes the object?

original: gal te blo snga ma blo 'dzin pa la nus pa med pa yin na nus pa dang bral bas na yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'dod pa'i don gyi blo de nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te blo snga ma blo 'dzin pa la nus pa med pa yin na nus pa dang bral bas na yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'dod pa'i don gyi blo de nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the former cognition is powerless to retain the object, then because it is powerless, the cognition of the object that is desired to be transferred to another object will not exist.

original: nus pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the producer of potency, not the powerless one.

original: de'i phyir / sngar gyi blo ni nus zad na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sngar gyi blo ni nus zad na //
translated: Therefore, the former cognition is exhausted in potency,

original: don la 'pho bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: don la 'pho bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: it does not transfer to the object.

original: 'di ltar / blo sngon med par blo ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo sngon med par blo ma yin //
translated: In this way, a cognition is not a cognition without a former cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gzhan chags zhes nus nyams na //
analyzed: don gzhan chags zhes nus nyams na //
translated: If the potency of attachment to another object is exhausted,

original: shes pa skyo ba ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: shes pa skyo ba ma rtogs phyir //
translated: cognition is not understood to be exhausted.

original: gal te blo snga ma rgyu nyid ma yin no don gzhan la chags pas nus pa nyams kyang blo gnas skyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te blo snga ma rgyu nyid ma yin no don gzhan la chags pas nus pa nyams kyang blo gnas skyes par 'gyur te /
translated: If the former cognition is not the cause, then even if the potency of attachment to another object is exhausted, the cognition would arise.

original: rgyu ma yin na mi mthun pa'am mi mthun pa ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin na mi mthun pa'am mi mthun pa ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: If it is not the cause, then whether it is incompatible or not,

original: gzhan thob pa'am cig shos kyang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan thob pa'am cig shos kyang med pa ma yin no //
translated: the acquisition of another or the non-existence of the other is not the case.

original: des na blo snga ma rgyu nyid yin pas de nus pa med pa'i phyir don gyi blor mi 'gyur bas na yul gzhan la 'pho ba shin tu yang med par gsal lo //üîΩ'o na ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad skyed par byed pa yin na de'i ltar na rnam pa shes pa snga ma rgyu ma yin pa nyid de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nyid las cig car 'jug pa'i
