analyzed: des na blo snga ma rgyu nyid yin pas de nus pa med pa'i phyir don gyi blor mi 'gyur bas na yul gzhan la 'pho ba shin tu yang med par gsal lo // 'o na ni gang zhig rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad skyed par byed pa yin na de'i ltar na rnam pa shes pa snga ma rgyu ma yin pa nyid de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nyid las cig car 'jug pa'i
translated: Therefore, since the former cognition is the cause, it is not the object-cognition because it lacks the potency of the object. Thus, it is clear that there is no transference to another object.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the former cognition is not the cause of the latter, then all consciousnesses would arise from the alaya-vijnana, because the former consciousness is not the cause of the latter.

original: des na nged la yang rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nged la yang rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the former consciousness is not the cause.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rgyu yin na ni 'bras bu de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rgyu yin na ni 'bras bu de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the former active consciousness is the cause, then the alaya-vijnana would not be the cause, because the existence and non-existence of the result would follow the arising and ceasing of the active consciousness.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: To explain this, it is said:

original: cig car rigs mi mthun skye yang //
analyzed: cig car rigs mi mthun skye yang //
translated: Even though dissimilar types arise simultaneously,

original: shin tu gsal ba'i sems gcig gis //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i sems gcig gis //
translated: With a single, very clear mind,üîΩ

original: nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir //
translated: because it would impair the potency of a single, very clear mind.

original: kun gzhi las gzhan 'byung ba yin //üîΩgang zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu ma yin pa de'i ltar na /
analyzed: kun gzhi las gzhan 'byung ba yin // gang zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu ma yin pa de'i ltar na /
translated: It arises from something other than the foundation consciousness.üîΩIf the foundation consciousness is not the cause of the other consciousnesses, then the other consciousnesses would not arise from the foundation consciousness.

original: gang las res 'ga' cig car rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skye yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa don gzhan @118a * //
analyzed: gang las res 'ga' cig car rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa skye yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa don gzhan @118a * //
translated: From what other place do the different kinds of consciousness arise simultaneously?

original: la chags pas mi mthun par gyur pa shin tu gsal ba gcig gis mi mthun par bya ba'i phyir yang kun gzhi las gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: la chags pas mi mthun par gyur pa shin tu gsal ba gcig gis mi mthun par bya ba'i phyir yang kun gzhi las gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are not similar, a single clear consciousness does not arise from the foundation consciousness, because it would impair the potency of a single, very clear mind.

original: des na der yang nyid mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: des na der yang nyid mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that case, the immediately preceding condition is the same.

original: 'o na de nyid las mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid las mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If a consciousness similar to the foundation consciousness does not arise from the foundation consciousness, then what is the use of the foundation consciousness?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsam pa 'di zhog cig / yang na de'i bag chags kyi gzhi kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsam pa 'di zhog cig / yang na de'i bag chags kyi gzhi kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Or else, the storehouse consciousness is a hypothetical entity, and so there is no fault in our position.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa snga ma rgyur mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe /üîΩde lta min na yid 'jug ni //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa snga ma rgyur mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe / de lta min na yid 'jug ni //
translated: If you do not accept that the prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness,üîΩthen you must accept that the prior consciousness is not the cause of the subsequent consciousness.

original: mtshungs la yid gzhan ltos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshungs la yid gzhan ltos mi 'gyur //
translated: If you do not accept that, then the subsequent mental consciousness would not depend on the prior mental consciousness.

original: gal te rgyu yin na snga ma'i yid 'jug par mtshungs pa la ni yid phyi ma ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yin na snga ma'i yid 'jug par mtshungs pa la ni yid phyi ma ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: If the prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness, then the subsequent consciousness would depend on the prior consciousness.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni ltos par bya ba nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni ltos par bya ba nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not tenable that something that is not a cause is a basis of dependence.

original: des na ltos pa'i phyir 'di ni rgyu nyid do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ltos pa'i phyir 'di ni rgyu nyid do zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is dependent, the prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness. This is a reasonable conclusion.

original: gzhan yang / yid shes rim bzhin skye bas kyang //üîΩltos pa rab tu grub pa yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yid shes rim bzhin skye bas kyang // ltos pa rab tu grub pa yin //
translated: Moreover,üîΩthe prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness because the subsequent consciousness arises in the same sequence.

original: yid kyi rnam pa shes pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen tsam nyid rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam pa shes pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen tsam nyid rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of mental consciousness is simply the immediately prior condition.

original: de yang rgyu ma yin na ni rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyu ma yin na ni rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not a cause, it would arise without a cause.

original: de'i phyir shes pa phyi ma ni shes pa snga ma'i rgyu can nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa phyi ma ni shes pa snga ma'i rgyu can nyid yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, because the later consciousness is caused by the earlier consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i nus pa med na 'ga' yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma'i nus pa med na 'ga' yang med par 'gyur //
translated: if the potential of the earlier consciousness did not exist, nothing would exist.

original: yid gcig yin phyir gzhan la ni //
analyzed: yid gcig yin phyir gzhan la ni //
translated: If you say that the mind is one,

original: chags pa gzhan las mi 'gro phyir //
analyzed: chags pa gzhan las mi 'gro phyir //
translated: and that attachment to one does not go to another,

original: shes gzhan mi skye zhe na min //
analyzed: shes gzhan mi skye zhe na min //
translated: and that another consciousness does not arise, that is not so,

original: la lar cig car 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar cig car 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes they arise simultaneously.

original: gal te yid ni gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yid ni gcig nyid do //
translated: If the mind is one,

original: de la yang gzhan du song bas gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i phyir rnams par shes pa snga ma ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan du song bas gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i phyir rnams par shes pa snga ma ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: and it does not go to another because it has already gone to another, then the earlier consciousness is not a cause.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar yid de yang rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid de yang rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid yin te /
translated: Because that mind is the earlier consciousness.

original: de las gzhan tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not established as a valid cognition different from that.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa cig car mi skye bas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa cig car mi skye bas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: It is to be established because its consciousness does not arise simultaneously.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa snga mas gzhan la chags pas mi mthun par 'gyur ba nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa snga mas gzhan la chags pas mi mthun par 'gyur ba nyid las yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is because the former consciousness is attached to another that there is a difference.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang res 'ga' dmigs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang res 'ga' dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes, the innate is also perceived.

original: 'jug pa mtshungs la'ang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jug pa mtshungs la'ang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: When there is a similarity of operation, there is similarity.

original: thams cad tshe gzhan rtogs mi 'gyur //üîΩgang @118b zhig yid gcig pas byas pas //
analyzed: thams cad tshe gzhan rtogs mi 'gyur // gang @118b zhig yid gcig pas byas pas //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no perception at any time.üîΩWhen one mental consciousness is produced, another mental consciousness is not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan mi skye ba de'i ltar na mtshungs par 'jug pa dang gzhan du rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan mi skye ba de'i ltar na mtshungs par 'jug pa dang gzhan du rung ste /
translated: In this way, there is a similarity of operation and a difference.

original: thams cad kyi tshe mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no production at any time.

original: nged kyi ltar na ni mnyam par 'jug pa la ni skyel /
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni mnyam par 'jug pa la ni skyel /
translated: According to us, there is production in the case of a similarity of operation,

original: gzhan du ni mi skye ba'i phyir cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mi skye ba'i phyir cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: but not in the case of a difference. Thus, there is no contradiction at all.

original: yid med par rim par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na rnam par shes pa mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yid med par rim par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na rnam par shes pa mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: How is it that there is no mental consciousness in the absence of a mental organ? It has already been explained that there is a difference in the consciousnesses.

original: bdag yid ldan pa tsam las ni //
analyzed: bdag yid ldan pa tsam las ni //
translated: From the mere presence of the self and the mental organ,

original: skye ba gcig kyang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba gcig kyang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: a single consciousness is produced.

original: gang la rim gyis 'gyur ba de la ni yul gzhan rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la rim gyis 'gyur ba de la ni yul gzhan rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it changes gradually, then it does not cognize other objects.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo ni bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo ni bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The wheel of pleasure, etc. is produced from the mere contact of the self and the mind.

original: 'on te yid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir na blo'i bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te yid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir na blo'i bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur na /
translated: But if the mind is one, then the activity of the mind would be one.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / gcig las bya ba gcig yin na'ang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig las bya ba gcig yin na'ang //
translated: Even if the activity is one,

original: ji ltar mar me du mas mthong //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me du mas mthong //
translated: How is it that many see the lamp?

original: ji ltar mar me gcig gis kyang mthong ba du ma skyed pa de bzhin du yid kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me gcig gis kyang mthong ba du ma skyed pa de bzhin du yid kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one lamp produces many sights, so it is with the mind.

original: 'on te lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lta ba po du ma'i dbang gis so zhe na /
translated: But if it is by the power of many viewers,

original: 'di la yang bzung ba du ma'i dbang gis yin par mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di la yang bzung ba du ma'i dbang gis yin par mtshungs so //
translated: then it is the same here, by the power of many grasped objects.

original: yid ni rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ni rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not the cause,

original: bag chags las nges pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags las nges pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: because consciousness is of that nature, determined by the latent impressions.

original: yid ni rtag pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yid ni rtag pa'i phyir ;
translated: The mind is permanent,

original: rim gyis kyang nus med 'gyur te //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang nus med 'gyur te //
translated: Even gradually, it is not possible,

original: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro //
translated: because later on there is no difference.

original: rtag pa ni 'gags kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni 'gags kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is permanent, it does not change even when it is obstructed,

original: khyad par de nyid dang gzhan mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par de nyid dang gzhan mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is different from itself.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: de bdag khyad par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de bdag khyad par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: it is not different from itself.

original: gal te gzhan na de ci yin //
analyzed: gal te gzhan na de ci yin //
translated: If it is different, what is it?

original: de dang 'brel na'ang 'di de yin ;
analyzed: de dang 'brel na'ang 'di de yin ;
translated: If it is related to that, it is not that.

original: / mi 'gyur rang bzhin gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: / mi 'gyur rang bzhin gcig pa nyid //
translated: It is not different, because of the sameness of nature.

original: 'di lus skyes bu bshad pa yin //
analyzed: 'di lus skyes bu bshad pa yin //
translated: This is the explanation of the body and the person.üîΩThose who think that because the body and the person are one, there is only one action,

original: gang dag lus dang skyes bu dag gcig yin pa'i phyir bya ba gcig kho na'o snyam du sems pa de yang /
analyzed: gang dag lus dang skyes bu dag gcig yin pa'i phyir bya ba gcig kho na'o snyam du sems pa de yang /
translated: they also understand this by the following:

original: ci'i phyir mar me du ma yod //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mar me du ma yod //
translated: Why is the lamp not many?

original: rim gyis kyang ni med 'gyur te //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang ni med 'gyur te //
translated: Even gradually, it is not possible,

original: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyis kyang bye brag med phyir ro // zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: because later on there is no difference.

original: 'on te de khyad par yod pa yin na //
analyzed: 'on te de khyad par yod pa yin na //
translated: But if it has a difference,

original: de'i tshe nus pa khyad par can dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid de'i rim pa'i phyir lus dang skyes bu dag rgyu dag nyid du khas len pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe nus pa khyad par can dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid de'i rim pa'i phyir lus dang skyes bu dag rgyu dag nyid du khas len pa ni med do //
translated: At that time, consciousness endowed with special power is the cause of body and person, because it is the antecedent of those two.

original: gal te 'du byed las nges na //üîΩde phyis gang las blo nyid las //
analyzed: gal te 'du byed las nges na // de phyis gang las blo nyid las //
translated: If it is from formations,üîΩthen later, from what is the mind?

original: zhe na yin @119a * //üîΩmod 'dod pa nyid //
analyzed: zhe na yin @119a * // mod 'dod pa nyid //
translated: It is just as you maintain.üîΩIt is just as you maintain.

original: 'du byed kyang gnas pa nyid pas de las nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyang gnas pa nyid pas de las nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But since formations also endure, they are not determined to be the cause of that.

original: 'on te phyis skye na de las shes pa las skyes pa'i rgyu 'du byed yin pa'i phyir blo nyid las 'du byed yin no //
analyzed: 'on te phyis skye na de las shes pa las skyes pa'i rgyu 'du byed yin pa'i phyir blo nyid las 'du byed yin no //
translated: But if they arise later, then from mind, because the cause of the arising of consciousness is formations, formations are from mind.

original: gal te de ltar na 'di bdag cag gi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'di bdag cag gi 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: If that is so, it is just as we maintain.

original: blos skyes pa'i 'du byed ni bag chags zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs can yin te /
analyzed: blos skyes pa'i 'du byed ni bag chags zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs can yin te /
translated: Formations that arise from mind are synonyms for imprints.

original: des na nges pa'i blo snga ma nyid las te /
analyzed: des na nges pa'i blo snga ma nyid las te /
translated: Therefore, they are from the prior mind that determines them.

original: gzhan yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because there is no valid knowledge,

original: blo las ma gtogs pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: blo las ma gtogs pa'i bag chags zhes bya ba'i bag chags zhes bya ba ni yin no //
translated: The so-called residual impression that is other than cognition is not a residual impression.

original: 'on te yang shes pa gzhan ni skyed byed tsam du zad kyi gzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang shes pa gzhan ni skyed byed tsam du zad kyi gzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, if another cognition is merely a producer but not an object,

original: des na blo snga ma skyed par byed pa yin yang gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na blo snga ma skyed par byed pa yin yang gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: then the prior cognition is a producer but not an object.

original: de'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is the transference to another object.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gzung la gzung nyid skyed byed pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzung la gzung nyid skyed byed pas //
translated: Because the object of apprehension is the producer of the apprehension,

original: gzhan min skyed byed nyid mtshan nyid //
analyzed: gzhan min skyed byed nyid mtshan nyid //
translated: it is not other, and the producer is the definition of the object of apprehension.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po la ni shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po la ni shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of the object of apprehension is the production of consciousness.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / snang ba gzung yin ma yin min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / snang ba gzung yin ma yin min //
translated: The appearance is the object of apprehension, not the nonobject.

original: cha med pa la'ang phra sogs med //
analyzed: cha med pa la'ang phra sogs med //
translated: Even the partless has no subtle part.

original: snang ba ni nam yang gzung ba ma yin par rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa mi srid do //
analyzed: snang ba ni nam yang gzung ba ma yin par rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa mi srid do //
translated: The appearance is never the nonobject, for it is impossible that it not produce consciousness.

original: thams cad kyang gzung bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzung bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: Everything is the object of apprehension.

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba yin no ;
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba yin no ;
translated: It is seen in just this way.

original: /'on te snang ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: /'on te snang ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But because the appearance has parts,

original: pha rol gyi cha la sogs pa skyed byed yin yang gzung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha la sogs pa skyed byed yin yang gzung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: even though it generates the other parts, it is not apprehended.

original: cha med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cha med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the partless consciousness is not like that,

original: cha med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: cha med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is partless.

original: snang ba ni cha dang bcas pa'i phyir ro de ltar 'thad do //
analyzed: snang ba ni cha dang bcas pa'i phyir ro de ltar 'thad do //
translated: The appearance has parts, so that is reasonable.

original: gzung ba'i nus pa nyams 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i nus pa nyams 'gyur gyi ;
translated: The capacity to apprehend would be impaired,

original: / skyed byed bdag nyid gzhan min na //
analyzed: / skyed byed bdag nyid gzhan min na //
translated: and the producer would not be different from itself.

original: de ni mi rigs te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'di ltar /
translated: That is unreasonable, because

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid can la ni //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid can la ni //
translated: the characteristic of the apprehended

original: gzung las skyed byed gzhan med de //üîΩgzungs sogs de ltar min par ni //
analyzed: gzung las skyed byed gzhan med de // gzungs sogs de ltar min par ni //
translated: is not different from the producer of the apprehended.

original: blo la dngos su phan 'dogs med //
analyzed: blo la dngos su phan 'dogs med //
translated: The mind is not directly benefited by the appearance, etc.

original: gzung ba ni brgyud pas ni gzung ba ma yin par blo la 'dogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba ni brgyud pas ni gzung ba ma yin par blo la 'dogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The apprehended is imputed to the mind indirectly, not directly.

original: dngos su ni ma yin par phan 'dogs pa mi srid pas skyed par byed pa'i blo ni gzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin par phan 'dogs pa mi srid pas skyed par byed pa'i blo ni gzung ba nyid do //
translated: But it is not actually so, since it is impossible to benefit without a basis. Therefore, the mind that produces the appearance is the object.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid las 'di yis //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid las 'di yis //
translated: From the characteristic of the object,

original: de dngos nges pa gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: de dngos nges pa gzhan ci yod //
translated: what other nature of that is there?

original: blo la'ang de yod de yi phyir //
analyzed: blo la'ang de yod de yi phyir //
translated: The mind also has that, therefore,

original: de yang de nyid du rnam gnas //
analyzed: de yang de nyid du rnam gnas //
translated: it also remains just as it is.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su @119b bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su @119b bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: de'i phyir blo ni gzung ba ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ni gzung ba ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not non-object.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:üîΩThe object of the apprehender, the appropriated,

original: 'dzin pa yi ni nyer len dang // myong ba sems kyi gzung mtshan nyid //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yi ni nyer len dang // myong ba sems kyi gzung mtshan nyid //
translated: and experience are the characteristics of the mind‚Äôs object.

original: sems kyi gzung ba nyid ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i dngos po dang / myong ba nyid yin na ni 'dir gzhan phra ba nyid la sogs pas gzung ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi gzung ba nyid ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i dngos po dang / myong ba nyid yin na ni 'dir gzhan phra ba nyid la sogs pas gzung ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the mind‚Äôs object is the appropriated thing of the apprehending consciousness and is experience, then it is not non-object due to subtlety, etc.

original: gal te nye bar len pa'i dngos po nyid gzung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa'i dngos po nyid gzung ba yin na /
translated: If the appropriated thing itself is the object,

original: nye bar len pa'i dngos po de yang rang gi blo nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i dngos po de yang rang gi blo nyid yin no //
translated: And that appropriated object is one‚Äôs own mind.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi blo yang rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi blo yang rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that one would perceive the minds of others.

original: gzhan gyi sems mi 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems mi 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the mind of another is not the appropriated object of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rgyang ring ba dang phra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos mi 'dzin pa la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i yul rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rgyang ring ba dang phra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos mi 'dzin pa la dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i yul rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: Form and so on are not the appropriated objects of the sense consciousnesses because they are not perceived when they are distant, obscured, and so on.

original: gal te blo yang gzung ba ma yin na de yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du gzung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te blo yang gzung ba ma yin na de yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du gzung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If the mind is not apprehended, then it is not apprehended, just like the eyes and so on.

original: 'on te blo ni don go bas rtogs pa des na dran pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te blo ni don go bas rtogs pa des na dran pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind is known through the understanding of the object, then it is remembered.

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: thams cad du don gyis go ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du don gyis go ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding of the object in all cases.

original: gang tshe ka ba bum pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: gang tshe ka ba bum pa la sogs pa //
translated: When a pillar, a pot, and so on,

original: brtad dang bcas pas 'grang byed pa //
analyzed: brtad dang bcas pas 'grang byed pa //
translated: And the meaning is not understood.

original: de tshe spros ni rab mang bas //üîΩdon gyis bo ba skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe spros ni rab mang bas // don gyis bo ba skye mi 'gyur //
translated: At that time, there is much elaboration.üîΩThe meaning is not understood.

original: ring ba dang bcas pas 'brang ba de la ni don gyis go ba skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ring ba dang bcas pas 'brang ba de la ni don gyis go ba skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is not understood for one who follows with hesitation.

original: 'on te der yang don gyis go bar 'jug pa yin no //üîΩzhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te der yang don gyis go bar 'jug pa yin no // zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the meaning is understood there,üîΩno.

original: 'jug pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding of the engagement.

original: don go yod pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: don go yod pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: The thing that has the understanding of the meaning

original: tha dad pa yi rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad pa yi rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Is understood as different.

original: 'di ni don dam don rig gam //
analyzed: 'di ni don dam don rig gam //
translated: Is it the understanding of the ultimate meaning,

original: 'on te gnyi ga las skyes 'grang //
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga las skyes 'grang //
translated: Or is it understood from both?

original: re zhig don las min don las //
analyzed: re zhig don las min don las //
translated: First, it is not from the meaning,

original: blo rnams thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩdon rtogs las kyang nga yi zhes //
analyzed: blo rnams thams cad rtogs par 'gyur // don rtogs las kyang nga yi zhes //
translated: Because all cognitions would understand the meaning.üîΩAnd from the understanding of the meaning,

original: de ltar don blo rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar don blo rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: The meaning is not understood as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de nyid gnyi ga ni /
analyzed: de nyid gnyi ga ni /
translated: That itself is not

original: las kyang rtogs pa 'grub ma yin //üîΩde yi phyir na rang rig pa //
analyzed: las kyang rtogs pa 'grub ma yin // de yi phyir na rang rig pa //
translated: Established from both.üîΩTherefore, self-awareness

original: nyid phyir bdag nyid rig par gnas ;
analyzed: nyid phyir bdag nyid rig par gnas ;
translated: Rests in itself.

original: / gal te don nyid las rang rig pa rtogs pa yin na rig tsam rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / gal te don nyid las rang rig pa rtogs pa yin na rig tsam rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is the object itself that is cognized by reflexive awareness, then mere awareness is cognized,

original: bdag gi rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the self-awareness.

original: 'on te don rig pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don rig pa las yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the awareness of the object that is cognized,

original: don rig pa de nyid don gyis go bas rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don rig pa de nyid don gyis go bas rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it the case that the awareness of the object is cognized by the awareness of the object?

original: de nyid las don gyis go bar ji ltar 'gyur te /üîΩphan tshun rten pa'i @120a * //
analyzed: de nyid las don gyis go bar ji ltar 'gyur te / phan tshun rten pa'i @120a * //
translated: How could it be that the awareness of the object is cognized by the awareness of the object itself?üîΩBecause the error of mutual dependence

original: nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: would follow.

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba yin na /
translated: Because the awareness of an unseen object is the awareness of the object,

original: don myong ba yang mthong ba ba ma yin pa des na gang las don gyis go bar 'gyur /
analyzed: don myong ba yang mthong ba ba ma yin pa des na gang las don gyis go bar 'gyur /
translated: the experience of the object is not seeing. Therefore, how could the awareness of the object be cognized by the awareness of the object?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga mthong ba med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga mthong ba med de /
translated: For this very reason, neither is seen.

original: gcig mthong na ni gnyi ga mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig mthong na ni gnyi ga mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: If one is seen, the other is not seen.

original: de'i rig pa ni rang rig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i rig pa ni rang rig pa kho na ste /
translated: Its awareness is reflexive awareness,

original: de lta ma yin na mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were not so, it would not be established.

original: des na gzhan gyi mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyi blo gzhan gyi rig pa yin na zhes khas blangs pa de la sngar gyis blo thams cad 'dzin pas yul gzhan la pho bar mi 'gyur ro /üîΩgal te nye bar len pa nyid kyis blo rig pa yin la /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi mngon sum gyi bdag nyid kyi blo gzhan gyi rig pa yin na zhes khas blangs pa de la sngar gyis blo thams cad 'dzin pas yul gzhan la pho bar mi 'gyur ro / gal te nye bar len pa nyid kyis blo rig pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, if the mind that directly perceives the nature of another is the cognition of another, then all minds would apprehend all objects, since the mind of one person would apprehend the mind of another.

original: phra ba la sogs pa ma yin pas gzugs la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi blo dang gzugs la sogs pa rig pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa ma yin pas gzugs la sogs pa yin na de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gzhan gyi blo dang gzugs la sogs pa rig pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If the mind is cognized by the appropriated aggregates, but not by subtle and so on, then how do yogis cognize the minds of others and forms and so on?

original: 'di ni skyon med de 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon med de 'di ltar /
translated: This is not a fault, because:

original: gzungs sogs dang ni sems de ltar //
analyzed: gzungs sogs dang ni sems de ltar //
translated: Yogis cognize retention and so on and the mind in that way.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa 'di //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa 'di //
translated: This analysis of the characteristics of the apprehended

original: ma dag blo can ma yin gyi //
analyzed: ma dag blo can ma yin gyi //
translated: is not for those with impure minds,

original: rnal 'byor rtogs pa bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rtogs pa bsam mi khyab //
translated: but for yogis whose realizations are inconceivable.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ring po dang thung du dang phra mo dang / gzhan gyi sems rig pa ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar bsam par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ring po dang thung du dang phra mo dang / gzhan gyi sems rig pa ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar bsam par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This question, How do yogis cognize long and short, subtle and so on and the minds of others? is not something to be contemplated.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ni bdag cag gis tshu rol mthong ba rnams la bltas te bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ni bdag cag gis tshu rol mthong ba rnams la bltas te bshad pa yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the apprehended are explained in terms of what is seen by us who have limited vision.

original: blo'i rgyud yongs su dag pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams la ji ltar zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: blo'i rgyud yongs su dag pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams la ji ltar zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of this speculation about how things are for yogins whose mental continuum is completely pure?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is something to be set aside.

original: 'di ji ltar yin pa de ltar yang cha tsam zhig bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin pa de ltar yang cha tsam zhig bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this point in part.

original: gal te bdag gi blo 'dzin na rtag tu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi blo 'dzin na rtag tu bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: If the mind apprehends itself, it would be permanent.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni yul gzhan la 'pho ba nyid las rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ni yul gzhan la 'pho ba nyid las rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it does not apprehend itself, it is understood that it does not apprehend objects.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is also unreasonable.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de la phra sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de la phra sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: If the object is apprehended by the nature of subtle particles,

original: gzung ba gzung min nyid 'gyur na //üîΩgzugs sogs blo la sngar med gang //
analyzed: gzung ba gzung min nyid 'gyur na // gzugs sogs blo la sngar med gang //
translated: it would not be apprehended.üîΩWhat is the form that does not exist for the mind

original: phyis skyes pa ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: phyis skyes pa ni ci zhig yod //
translated: that arises later?

original: de la gang sngon med pa phra mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang sngon med pa phra mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the subtle, etc., which did not exist previously, does not exist.

original: gal te yul ni khyad med kyang //
analyzed: gal te yul ni khyad med kyang //
translated: If the object is not differentiated,

original: 'dzin pa bye brag yod 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa bye brag yod 'gyur na //
translated: but the apprehension is differentiated,

original: 'on te de rgyu can min pa //
analyzed: 'on te de rgyu can min pa //
translated: then it is not caused by that,

original: de na rnam dbyer ldan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de na rnam dbyer ldan mi 'gyur //
translated: and it would not be associated with it.

original: de phyir rang blo 'dzin 'gyur na //
analyzed: de phyir rang blo 'dzin 'gyur na //
translated: Therefore, if it apprehends itself,

original: @120b de ma thag pa'i rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: @120b de ma thag pa'i rgyu yis ni //
translated: then it is the immediately preceding condition.

original: gang yin de nyid 'dzin 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang yin de nyid 'dzin 'gyur ba //
translated: It is that which apprehends it,

original: des na don gzhan rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: des na don gzhan rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: and it does not cognize another object.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: gal te rgyu nyid gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu nyid gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is the cause that is apprehended, is that not illogical?

original: dngos po rnams ni nus pa du ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni nus pa du ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things have many potencies.

original: des na gang zhig yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i dus med pa'i gzung ba'i nus pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: des na gang zhig yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i dus med pa'i gzung ba'i nus pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the potency to apprehend is different from that which moves to another object.

original: gang gi mthus don gyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba skyed par byed pa tsam gyis nus pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gang gi mthus don gyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba skyed par byed pa tsam gyis nus pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The potency that generates the subsequent consciousness of the object is also different.

original: dngos po rnams nus pa du ma dang ldan pa nyid kyang 'bras bu du ma skye ba nyid las nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams nus pa du ma dang ldan pa nyid kyang 'bras bu du ma skye ba nyid las nges pa yin te /
translated: The fact that things possess multiple potencies is ascertained from the production of multiple effects.

original: gzhan du ma 'bras bu sna tshogs skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ma 'bras bu sna tshogs skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, the production of various effects would not occur.üîΩThis is not so.

original: de yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: de yang gyi na ste /
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / nus pa du ma gcig byed kyang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nus pa du ma gcig byed kyang //
translated: Even though multiple potencies produce one thing,

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid kyi 'bras //
translated: the nature of things is to produce effects.

original: gcig dang du ma byed ces brjod /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma byed ces brjod /
translated: It is said that they produce one or many.

original: 'di ni rang gi rgyu la rag las pa skye ba'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi rgyu la rag las pa skye ba'i dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things that arise in dependence on their own causes.

original: 'di ji ltar zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar zhes brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not appropriate to question how this is.

original: rang gi rgyu la so sor nges pa skye bar 'gyur pa de sus dgag tu yod /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la so sor nges pa skye bar 'gyur pa de sus dgag tu yod /
translated: Who can stop the arising of things that are individually determined by their own causes?

original: de lta ma yin na nus pa ni 'dra ba yang ga las shes de yang brgal zhing brtag pa la mi grol lo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nus pa ni 'dra ba yang ga las shes de yang brgal zhing brtag pa la mi grol lo //
translated: If it were not so, then how could one know that the potency is similar? And this is not resolved by the objection and examination.

original: rang gi rgyu las she na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las she na /
translated: If it is from its own cause,

original: da ni 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: da ni 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: then what does this do now?

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis chog mod dngos po gzhan brtag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis chog mod dngos po gzhan brtag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: It is sufficient by its very nature; what is the use of postulating another entity?

original: gal te nus pa nges pa rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yin ni zhes 'jig rten na grags pa ma yin nam grags pa 'di ni yod na nus pa gzhan du grags pa ni med do //
analyzed: gal te nus pa nges pa rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yin ni zhes 'jig rten na grags pa ma yin nam grags pa 'di ni yod na nus pa gzhan du grags pa ni med do //
translated: If the determination of the potency is related to its own cause, is this not known in the world? This is known, but if it exists, the potency is known as different.

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos tha dad bar sgro btags pa tsam gyis de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i chos tha dad bar sgro btags pa tsam gyis de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood in that way by the mere superimposition of a different quality that becomes its own nature.

original: 'di ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: nus pa la yang nus pa'i blo gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa la yang nus pa'i blo gzhan mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of potency is seen as different from the potency.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po nus pa dang ldan phyir 'bras bu rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po nus pa dang ldan phyir 'bras bu rgyu yin na /
translated: Thus, if an entity is a cause of an effect because it possesses potency,

original: nus pa'i nus pa'ang ga las shes //
analyzed: nus pa'i nus pa'ang ga las shes //
translated: how is the potency of potency known?

original: ci'i phyir na rtogs mi 'dod //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na rtogs mi 'dod //
translated: Why is it not accepted that it is understood?

original: de'i phyir nus pa ni rtogs pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa ni rtogs pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Therefore, potency is exhausted as mere understanding,

original: gzhan gsal bas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gsal bas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by the manifestation of something else.

original: gal te nus pa med na gcig las du mar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: gal te nus pa med na gcig las du mar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ji ltar 'byung /
translated: If potency does not exist, how could a multiplicity arise from a single thing?

original: nus pa tha dad pa yod pas ni 'byung ba zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa yod pas ni 'byung ba zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to say that it arises due to the existence of different potencies.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te gcig las du ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te gcig las du ma yin //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf a multiplicity arises from a single thing,

original: ma yin 'ga' zhig gcig las gcig /'bras @121a * //
analyzed: ma yin 'ga' zhig gcig las gcig /'bras @121a * //
translated: then a multiplicity would arise from a single thing.

original: bu tshogs pa dag las 'byung //
analyzed: bu tshogs pa dag las 'byung //
translated: But a multiplicity arises from a collection of causes.

original: gcig kyang tshogs pa gnyis 'gyur phyir //üîΩde ni du ma byed ces brjod //
analyzed: gcig kyang tshogs pa gnyis 'gyur phyir // de ni du ma byed ces brjod //
translated: Because a single thing would become a collection of two.üîΩIt is said that a single thing produces a multiplicity.

original: 'bras bu 'byung ba phal cher tshogs pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung ba phal cher tshogs pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: For the most part, the arising of effects occurs from a collection.

original: 'ga' zhig ni gcig las gcig skye'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni gcig las gcig skye'o //
translated: Sometimes a single thing arises from a single thing.

original: de ltar du ma las du ma dang / gcig las kyang du ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar du ma las du ma dang / gcig las kyang du ma yin te /
translated: In that way, a multiplicity arises from a multiplicity and a multiplicity arises from a single thing.

original: gang gi tshogs pa ci 'dra ba de nyid las gcig gam du ma der 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshogs pa ci 'dra ba de nyid las gcig gam du ma der 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: From whatever kind of collection, a single thing or a multiplicity arises.

original: phal cher ni tshul de lta bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: phal cher ni tshul de lta bu nyid yin no //
translated: This is the case for the most part.

original: 'di ltar gang gis 'bras bu gcig gam du ma skyes par byed gcig gam du ma de lta bur gyur pa de ni rgyu nyid las gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis 'bras bu gcig gam du ma skyes par byed gcig gam du ma de lta bur gyur pa de ni rgyu nyid las gyur pa yin no //
translated: In fact, the fact that a single effect or many effects arise is due to the cause itself being one or many.

original: 'ga' zhig tu nus pa'i dbye ba yang dogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu nus pa'i dbye ba yang dogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it possible that the division of potency is suspected?

original: nus pa yang de la phan pa'i rten pas na de dag de'i zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang de la phan pa'i rten pas na de dag de'i zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Potency is also called that because it is the basis of benefit for it.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de'i tshe de dag don gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag don gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they would become different objects.

original: don gzhan nyid yin yang de ltar mthong bar thal ba yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin yang de ltar mthong bar thal ba yin no //
translated: Even if they are different objects, it would follow that they are seen in that way.

original: yang na las gcig byung ba gang yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: yang na las gcig byung ba gang yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Or, there is no single action that occurs at all.

original: tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu du ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu du ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: The effect arises from many in the assembly.

original: 'o na ji ltar gcig gis du ma byung zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gcig gis du ma byung zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Then how can it be said that many arise from one?

original: gcig tshogs pa gnyis kyi nang du chud pas 'bras bu du ma skyed par byed pa'i phyir na de skad brjod de /
analyzed: gcig tshogs pa gnyis kyi nang du chud pas 'bras bu du ma skyed par byed pa'i phyir na de skad brjod de /
translated: Because one cause is included in two collections, it produces many effects.

original: dper na mar me gcig nyid skyes bu du ma la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i tshogs pa du ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir mthong ba du ma bskyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig nyid skyes bu du ma la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i tshogs pa du ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir mthong ba du ma bskyed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as one lamp produces many simultaneous appearances because it is related to many simultaneous collections of conditions, such as the people present.

original: ji ltar yang gcig nyid nus pa du ma dang ldan pa de bzhin du 'bras bu du ma dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang gcig nyid nus pa du ma dang ldan pa de bzhin du 'bras bu du ma dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one cause has many powers, in the same way it has many effects.

original: de'i phyir nus pa du ma med kyang 'bras bu du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa du ma med kyang 'bras bu du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, although there are not many powers, there are many effects.

original: de ltar na 'o na ji ltar gcig 'bras bu du ma dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ji ltar gcig 'bras bu du ma dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
translated: If that is so, then just as one cause has many effects,

original: blo gcig kyang rang gi yul gyi blo gzhan dang don gyi yul can yang skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gcig kyang rang gi yul gyi blo gzhan dang don gyi yul can yang skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, one mind would also produce other minds that are its own effects and also objects that are its effects.

original: de la res 'ga' ni blo'i yul can gyi blo yin la /
analyzed: de la res 'ga' ni blo'i yul can gyi blo yin la /
translated: Sometimes it would be a mind that has a mind as its object.

original: res 'ga' ni don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Sometimes, because the object is a meaning-generality, it would be transferred to another object.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe gnyi ga skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe gnyi ga skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not so, because there is no difference, both would be produced at all times.

original: skye ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is produced only when there is a prior object,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te blo gzhan don dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te blo gzhan don dang ni //
translated: If the mind apprehends a prior object

original: rnam shes snga ma 'dzin 'gyur na //
analyzed: rnam shes snga ma 'dzin 'gyur na //
translated: and a prior consciousness,

original: de'i tshe dpyod sogs don gcig la //
analyzed: de'i tshe dpyod sogs don gcig la //
translated: then at that time, when the object is the same,

original: rtag tu rim gyis mthong ba yi //
analyzed: rtag tu rim gyis mthong ba yi //
translated: it would be seen gradually.

original: brjod gnyis rim min nyid 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: brjod gnyis rim min nyid 'gyur zhing //
translated: The two statements would not be in sequence,

original: bdag dang de rig @121b snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang de rig @121b snang ba'i phyir //
translated: because the self and its consciousness would appear.

original: gcig kyang gnyis nyid snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig kyang gnyis nyid snang bar 'gyur //
translated: Even one would appear as two.

original: gal te sngar gyi blo dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa'i blo gnyis skye ba yin na de'i tshe blo snga ma'i don dang phyi ma'i don snang ba'i phyir rim gyis dmigs pa'i gnyis gang yin pa de rim pa ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi blo dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don 'dzin pa'i blo gnyis skye ba yin na de'i tshe blo snga ma'i don dang phyi ma'i don snang ba'i phyir rim gyis dmigs pa'i gnyis gang yin pa de rim pa ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the two minds arise, the prior mind apprehending form and so on and the later mind apprehending the prior mind, then at that time, because the object of the prior mind and the object of the later mind appear, the two objects that are observed gradually would appear in a nonsequential order.

original: don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pa blo snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pa blo snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the apprehension of the object is not the appearance of the cognition,

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is its nature.

original: don 'dzin par snang na yang don de de nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i brjod pa gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'dzin par snang na yang don de de nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i brjod pa gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the object appears as the apprehension of the object, then the object itself would appear, and so the two appearances of the former and latter would appear.

original: de bzhin du gcig nyid gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig nyid gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, one would appear as two,

original: don bdag nyid dang de'i blo snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bdag nyid dang de'i blo snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object itself and the appearance of the cognition of that would appear.

original: sngar ni re zhig rang nyid snang ba yin la phyis ni de'i blo snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar ni re zhig rang nyid snang ba yin la phyis ni de'i blo snang ba yin te /
translated: First, it would be the appearance of itself, and later, the appearance of the cognition of that.

original: des na gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, two would appear.

original: 'on te don snang ba'i de ma thag pa'i blo 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te don snang ba'i de ma thag pa'i blo 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if the cognition that immediately follows the appearance of the object is not the apprehension of the object,

original: blo ni mngon sum du rang gi ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo ni mngon sum du rang gi ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the cognition is not apprehended by the nature of the direct perception.

original: 'o na gal te don gyis go bas rtogs kyang de'i tshe bdag dang de'i blo snang ba'i phyir thal ba med do //
analyzed: 'o na gal te don gyis go bas rtogs kyang de'i tshe bdag dang de'i blo snang ba'i phyir thal ba med do //
translated: But if it is understood through the understanding of the object, then at that time, the self and the appearance of the cognition of that would not be entailed.

original: dus gzhan du don gyis go ba yin te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du don gyis go ba yin te /
translated: The meaning is understood at another time.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par don du rim gyis 'dzin pa'i dbus ni don gyis go ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par don du rim gyis 'dzin pa'i dbus ni don gyis go ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But there is no understanding of the meaning in the middle of the gradual apprehension of the meaning without interruption.

original: zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te don gyis rtogs na ni //
analyzed: gal te don gyis rtogs na ni //
translated: If the meaning were understood,

original: gtan 'gyur gzhan gyi tshe na min //
analyzed: gtan 'gyur gzhan gyi tshe na min //
translated: it would be permanent, not at another time.

original: des na don kyis go bar ni //
analyzed: des na don kyis go bar ni //
translated: Therefore, the meaning would be understood

original: me la lan brgya snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: me la lan brgya snang bar 'gyur //
translated: even if the fire were a hundred times extinguished.

original: 'on te rang gi blo sdom par byed pa'i dus gzhan du na de'i tshe gzhan kyis skye ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi blo sdom par byed pa'i dus gzhan du na de'i tshe gzhan kyis skye ba yin na /
translated: But if the understanding of the meaning arises at another time when the mind is concentrated,

original: de'i tshe yang gang las don gor 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang gang las don gor 'gyur //
translated: then at that time, from what would the meaning be understood?

original: mthong 'ga' de tshe yod min te //
analyzed: mthong 'ga' de tshe yod min te //
translated: The seeing of the meaning does not exist at that time,

original: de yi tshe na don gyis ni //
analyzed: de yi tshe na don gyis ni //
translated: because at that time the understanding of the meaning

original: go bar byed pa 'das phyir ro //
analyzed: go bar byed pa 'das phyir ro //
translated: has already passed away.

original: don mthong bas 'das pa ni ji ltar de las don gyis go ba 'byung /
analyzed: don mthong bas 'das pa ni ji ltar de las don gyis go ba 'byung /
translated: How could the meaning that has been seen and has passed away give rise to the understanding of the meaning from itself?

original: dran par gyur pa las don gzhan du yang don gyis go ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran par gyur pa las don gzhan du yang don gyis go ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the understanding of the meaning is from memory, which is different from the meaning,

original: dran ba nyid don gyis go bas rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dran ba nyid don gyis go bas rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the understanding of the meaning would be from memory itself.

original: myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not an experience.

original: der yang brjod pa gnyis dang gnyis su snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang brjod pa gnyis dang gnyis su snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the expression ‚Äútwo‚Äù and the appearance of ‚Äútwo‚Äù there.

original: 'on te ma myong ba ni mi dran te /
analyzed: 'on te ma myong ba ni mi dran te /
translated: But if one says that one does not remember what one has not experienced,

original: des na myong ba dran no zhe na /
analyzed: des na myong ba dran no zhe na /
translated: and therefore one remembers what one has experienced,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: bdag gis nyams su myong 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: bdag gis nyams su myong 'gyur zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúI experienced it‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dran pa 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa 'jug pa ni //
translated: in this way, memory engages.

original: nga yi blo ni yod 'gyur ces //
analyzed: nga yi blo ni yod 'gyur ces //
translated: ‚ÄúI had the cognition‚Äù

original: de ltar don gyis go mi srid //
analyzed: de ltar don gyis go mi srid //
translated: in this way, it is not possible to understand the meaning.

original: gang gi tshe sngon myong ba dran no zhes dran pa nyid dang po blo la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon myong ba dran no zhes dran pa nyid dang po blo la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: When memory first engages the mind with the thought ‚ÄúI remember what I previously experienced,‚Äù

original: @122a * // sngar don gyis go ba med la /
analyzed: @122a * // sngar don gyis go ba med la /
translated: at that time there is no understanding of the meaning.

original: phyis kyang ma yin pas dran pa gal srid /üîΩgang gi tshe don dran pa de'i tshe yang dran pa dang myong ba la yang rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis kyang ma yin pas dran pa gal srid / gang gi tshe don dran pa de'i tshe yang dran pa dang myong ba la yang rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
translated: And later on, it is not so either.üîΩWhen memory remembers the meaning, at that time also, because memory infers the experience,

original: dran pa dang myong bar yang don gyi rnam par cig car snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang myong bar yang don gyi rnam par cig car snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that memory and experience would appear simultaneously in the aspect of the object.

original: de lta yin dang dran pa'i dus su yang don gsal ba'i rnam par rig par thal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dran pa'i dus su yang don gsal ba'i rnam par rig par thal lo //
translated: If that were so, then even at the time of memory, it would follow that the object would be cognized in a clear aspect.

original: 'on te gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis rig go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis rig go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that both the clear aspect and the object are cognized,

original: de yang mthong ba nyid yin pa lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mthong ba nyid yin pa lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not reasonable to reply that it is just seeing.

original: 'on te gang zhig 'dod pa de'i tshe de don gyis go ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig 'dod pa de'i tshe de don gyis go ba yin te /
translated: But if you say that the object is understood by the desire,

original: gang gi phyir dran pa de'i phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa de'i phyir nyams su myong bar 'gyur pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: then at that time, because of the memory, there would be experience.

original: gang gi phyir dran pas na nyams su myong ba yin no zhes so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pas na nyams su myong ba yin no zhes so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because of the memory, there is experience,

original: de lta na ni gang gi phyir myong ba de'i phyir myong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir dran pa des na dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul du 'gyur bas tshad ma la cher mkhas so //
analyzed: de lta na ni gang gi phyir myong ba de'i phyir myong ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang gi phyir dran pa des na dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul du 'gyur bas tshad ma la cher mkhas so //
translated: then the method of expression would be ‚Äúbecause of experience, there is experience,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of memory, there is memory,‚Äù and you would be a great expert on logic.

original: 'dod pa yang myong bar 'gyur ba'i don la skye ba yin na myong ba ni nam yang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na ji ltar 'dod pas don gyis go bar skyed /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang myong bar 'gyur ba'i don la skye ba yin na myong ba ni nam yang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na ji ltar 'dod pas don gyis go bar skyed /
translated: If the object of the experience of desire is the object of the arising of consciousness, then the experience is never experienced. Therefore, how could the object of desire generate understanding?

original: de'i phyir blo gzhan gyis blo rig pa mi rung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gzhan gyis blo rig pa mi rung ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for one consciousness to be aware of another consciousness.

original: ci ste gal te yul gzhan la 'pho ba na //
analyzed: ci ste gal te yul gzhan la 'pho ba na //
translated: If you say that when it moves to another object,

original: tha ma nyams su myong min na //
analyzed: tha ma nyams su myong min na //
translated: The final moment is not experienced,

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bzhin //
translated: Then, like the experience of another,

original: thams cad myong med thal bar 'gyur //üîΩgal te yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi tha ma /
analyzed: thams cad myong med thal bar 'gyur // gal te yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi tha ma /
translated: It follows that nothing is experienced.üîΩIf, when the continuum of consciousness moves to another object,

original: yul gzhan la 'pho pa'i dus kyi sngon rol gyi shes pa de nyams su myong bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: yul gzhan la 'pho pa'i dus kyi sngon rol gyi shes pa de nyams su myong bar ma gyur na /
translated: the final moment of consciousness, the consciousness that is prior to the time of moving to another object, is not experienced,

original: de'i tshe gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it would not be experienced by another.

original: nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i myong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i myong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the experience of the experience of the object is not experienced, it would be like the experience of another.

original: des na tha ma nyams su myong ba'i phyir ji srid dngos po myong bar gyur pa'i bar gyi de'i sngar myong bar gyur pa dag kyang ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tha ma nyams su myong ba'i phyir ji srid dngos po myong bar gyur pa'i bar gyi de'i sngar myong bar gyur pa dag kyang ma myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the final experience is experienced, the prior experiences would not be experienced, until the experience of the thing.

original: dper na gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yang de nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yang de nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because the experience of another is not experienced,üîΩthe experience of another is not established.

original: gzhan gyis myong ba de bzhin du rang gis nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba de bzhin du rang gis nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the experience of oneself would not be established.

original: don gyi rang bzhin de ni gzhan la ltos nas kyang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar myong ba yin /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin de ni gzhan la ltos nas kyang de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar myong ba yin /
translated: Because the nature of the object is just that, it is not dependent on another.

original: gal te ji ltar gzhan nyams su myong ba na rang nyid nyams su myong pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi myong ba yin par rnam par gzhag @122b pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin pas rang gis myong ba yin no zhes rnam parüîΩgzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar gzhan nyams su myong ba na rang nyid nyams su myong pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi myong ba yin par rnam par gzhag @122b pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin pas rang gis myong ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúJust as the experience of another is not established because the experience of oneself is not experienced when the experience of another is experienced, in the same way, because the experience of another is not experienced, the experience of oneself is established,‚Äù

original: da ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: da ni mi rung ste /
translated: then that is not tenable.

original: gal te tshad ma yod na rnam par zhog shig / ji ltar gzhan gyis myong bar byas pa bdag gi mngon sum ma yin la /üîΩgzhan gyis yin no zhes kyang rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yod na rnam par zhog shig / ji ltar gzhan gyis myong bar byas pa bdag gi mngon sum ma yin la / gzhan gyis yin no zhes kyang rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as what is experienced by another is not one‚Äôs own direct perception,üîΩand it is not possible to posit it as being that of another,

original: bdag gi mngon sum du 'dod pa yang dag gam gzhan gyis zhes rnam par gzhag par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi mngon sum du 'dod pa yang dag gam gzhan gyis zhes rnam par gzhag par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, it is not appropriate to posit what is asserted to be one‚Äôs own direct perception as being that of a real self or that of another.

original: gang de don rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang de don rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the object appears by virtue of its own nature?

original: de ji ltar mngon sum nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de ji ltar mngon sum nyid ma yin //
translated: How could it not be direct perception?

original: gzhan ma rtogs pas gzhan ma rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ma rtogs pas gzhan ma rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that because one does not understand another, one does not understand the other.

original: de yang rang nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: That is also understood by itself.

original: des na rang rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te bdag ni byed pa po nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag ni byed pa po nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self is understood to be the agent,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: lus las ma gtogs pa ni bdag med pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus las ma gtogs pa ni bdag med pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is not separate from the body, it is not tenable.

original: lus nyid byed pa po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lus nyid byed pa po yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body itself is the agent,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: lus kyang las yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lus kyang las yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the body is also karma.

original: / gang gi phyir lus la sogs pa ni rang rig pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: / gang gi phyir lus la sogs pa ni rang rig pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because the body and so on are not reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa nyid yin na yang rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid yin na yang rtsod pa med do //
translated: If they were reflexive awareness, there would be no dispute.

original: blo myong ba med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo myong ba med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If cognition is not experienced,

original: bdag rang rig pa yin pa des don myong na de tsam gyis mchog pa med pa'i phyir blo don med do //
analyzed: bdag rang rig pa yin pa des don myong na de tsam gyis mchog pa med pa'i phyir blo don med do //
translated: then if the self is reflexive awareness, since it is not sufficient for it to experience objects, cognition is pointless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gal te bdag myong mngon sum yin //
analyzed: gal te bdag myong mngon sum yin //
translated: If the self is not experienced,

original: gzhan gyis myong 'gyur ma yin na //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong 'gyur ma yin na //
translated: then it is not experienced by another.

original: gang gis de skad brjod 'gyur ba //üîΩbdag gi myong de ga las grub //
analyzed: gang gis de skad brjod 'gyur ba // bdag gi myong de ga las grub //
translated: How could it be saidüîΩthat the self is experienced?

original: bdag gis myong bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: bdag gis myong bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: How could it be said that it is not experienced by the self?

original: gzhan gyis myong bar gyur pa yin na 'di gzhan gyi bdag ma yin zhes bya ba yang ga las yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong bar gyur pa yin na 'di gzhan gyi bdag ma yin zhes bya ba yang ga las yin /
translated: If it is experienced by another, how could it be said that the self is not another?

original: rang rig pas myong ba yin na ni rang rig pa grub pa yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pas myong ba yin na ni rang rig pa grub pa yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is experienced by reflexive awareness, then reflexive awareness is established, and there is no dispute.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin na thams cad nyams su myong bar gyur pa ma yin par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin na thams cad nyams su myong bar gyur pa ma yin par thal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if there is no self-awareness, it follows that nothing would be experienced.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa myong ba med kyang mig la sogs pa med par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa myong ba med kyang mig la sogs pa med par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: If you say that even though the eye, etc. are not experienced, the convention ‚Äúthe eye, etc. exist‚Äù is used,

original: bdag nyid rig pa nyams su myong ba ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa nyams su myong ba ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
translated: why not accept that self-awareness is experienced?

original: 'di la bshad pa /üîΩgsal rgyu ma grub par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa / gsal rgyu ma grub par 'gyur gyi //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:üîΩThe cause of clarity would not be established,

original: gsal bar 'dod pa'i gsal ba min //
analyzed: gsal bar 'dod pa'i gsal ba min //
translated: but it is not that clarity is not accepted.

original: gal te gsal ba ma grub kyang //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba ma grub kyang //
translated: If clarity is not established,

original: gsal na 'gro 'di gsal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal na 'gro 'di gsal bar 'gyur //
translated: then this world would not be clear.

original: gsal ba'i rgyu mig la @123a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu mig la @123a * //
translated: The cause of clarity is the eye, etc.

original: sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma grub kyang /üîΩdon gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma grub kyang / don gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though the nature of the eye, etc. is not established,

original: gsal ba gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the object is clear because clarity is clear.

original: nga'i mig gis gsal ba zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: nga'i mig gis gsal ba zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How do you say, ‚ÄúI see with my eye‚Äù?

original: nga'i rang rig pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir nga'i mig gi gsal ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'i rang rig pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir nga'i mig gi gsal ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it produces my self-awareness, I say, ‚ÄúI see with my eye.‚Äù

original: rig pa yang rig pa nyid las nga'i yin no //
analyzed: rig pa yang rig pa nyid las nga'i yin no //
translated: And awareness is mine because it is awareness itself.

original: rig pa de yang rang rig pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: rig pa de yang rang rig pa ma yin na ni /
translated: And if that awareness is not reflexive awareness,

original: 'ga' yang bdag dang 'brel par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: 'ga' yang bdag dang 'brel par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: then it would not be cognized as connected to a self.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis gsal bar 'gro ba mtha' dag gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis gsal bar 'gro ba mtha' dag gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it would illuminate the entire world by its mere nature,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that it would be excessive.

original: gal te gang las gsal ba bskyed pa de gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar /
analyzed: gal te gang las gsal ba bskyed pa de gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar /
translated: If you say that it is not excessive because that which produces the illumination is the illuminator,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then how could it be excessive?

original: gal te gsal ba skyes tsam gyis //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba skyes tsam gyis //
translated: If the mere arising of the illuminator

original: gsal na de tshe mtha' dag 'gyur //üîΩgang gis gsal ba zhes bya ba //
analyzed: gsal na de tshe mtha' dag 'gyur // gang gis gsal ba zhes bya ba //
translated: illuminates, then everything would be illuminated.üîΩIf you say that it is not without a connection

original: 'di ni 'brel pa med pa min //üîΩde la rang gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni 'brel pa med pa min // de la rang gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: because it is called ‚Äúilluminator,‚ÄùüîΩthen it would illuminate everything

original: tsam gyis thams cad gsal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tsam gyis thams cad gsal bar 'gyur //
translated: by its mere nature.

original: ci sto don de'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: ci sto don de'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: If it is the nature of the object,

original: yin na rang nyid rig par brjod //
analyzed: yin na rang nyid rig par brjod //
translated: then it is called reflexive awareness.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
