analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: In the Commentary on Valid Knowledge it says:

original: mthong don rab gsal byed //
analyzed: mthong don rab gsal byed //
translated: It illuminates the object that is seen.

original: rang gis mthong ba ni rgol ba dang dpag pa'i de ma thag tu gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa brjod de /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba ni rgol ba dang dpag pa'i de ma thag tu gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa brjod de /
translated: As soon as he sees an opponent, he immediately expresses an inference for the sake of others.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inference for the sake of others is stated immediately after the inference for one‚Äôs own sake, because the inference for the sake of others is preceded by the inference for one‚Äôs own sake.üîΩIn this regard,

original: de la / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: de la / gzhan don rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: the inference for the sake of others

original: rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
analyzed: rang gis mthong don rab gsal byed //
translated: makes one‚Äôs own seen meaning clear.

original: rang gis mthong ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba rang gis mthong pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba rang gis mthong pa ste /
translated: One‚Äôs own seen meaning is the seen meaning of the proponent and opponent.

original: bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa dag rang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa dag rang gis mthong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning to be taught and the teacher are called ‚Äúone‚Äôs own seen meaning.‚Äù

original: gal te nyan par byed pa yod na ni de dag rnams kyang yin te de dag kyang dbang du bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te nyan par byed pa yod na ni de dag rnams kyang yin te de dag kyang dbang du bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is a listener, then those two are also [seen by the listener].

original: log par rtogs pa gsal ba ni shugs nyid las 'grub cing /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa gsal ba ni shugs nyid las 'grub cing /
translated: The clarification of wrong understanding is established by implication.

original: rang gis rtogs pa'i don 'dis gzhan la gsal bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa'i don 'dis gzhan la gsal bar byed pa yin la /
translated: This meaning that one understands oneself is made clear to others.

original: de yang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the informative action of body and speech.

original: de la rang gis mthong ba'i don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de la rang gis mthong ba'i don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
translated: The meaning that is seen by oneself is the reason of the trimodal mark.

original: gal te rang gis mthong ba smos pa ni rang gis mthong ba'i don tsam ston pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gis mthong ba smos pa ni rang gis mthong ba'i don tsam ston pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that the meaning that is seen by oneself is merely the teaching of the meaning that is seen by oneself,

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba gang las yin /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba gang las yin /
translated: then what is the reason for the expression ‚Äúthe reason of the trimodal mark‚Äù?

original: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag par bya ba mtha' dag gi gzhan la gsal bar byed pa gzhan gyi don @123b rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag par bya ba mtha' dag gi gzhan la gsal bar byed pa gzhan gyi don @123b rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the expression of the meaning for another, which is the clarification for another of all the inferred meanings that are hidden, would be the inference for the sake of another.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, we reply:

original: tshul gsum rtags las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from the reason of the trimodal mark,

original: gsal byed gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: gsal byed gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: there is no other means of clarification.

original: de ni gzhan gyis rtogs bya bar //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis rtogs bya bar //
translated: Because it is not possible to make known to anotherüîΩthat which is not known to oneself,

original: mi nus phyir na gsal ma yin /
analyzed: mi nus phyir na gsal ma yin /
translated: it is not a clarification.

original: gang la gzhan yid ches pa de ni gsal par brjod do //
analyzed: gang la gzhan yid ches pa de ni gsal par brjod do //
translated: That which is believed by another is said to be a clarification.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i brjod pa rab kyi tshig smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i brjod pa rab kyi tshig smos so //
translated: For that very reason, the expression of the superior meaning is called the best.

original: gzhan yid ches pa yang tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yid ches pa yang tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the other's conviction is not a realization by means of a validating cognition.

original: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba yang tshad mas rtogs na ni de'i tshe rtsod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag par bya ba yang tshad mas rtogs na ni de'i tshe rtsod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: If what is to be inferred is realized by means of a validating cognition, then there is no dispute.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pa'i sgo nas yin na ni //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags gsal bar byed pa'i sgo nas yin na ni //
translated: If it is by means of the clarity of the reason having the three modes,

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir tshig don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa'i phyir tshig don med pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the case that the words are meaningless, because the object of the words is the realization of what is to be inferred, which is the basis of the dispute.

original: di las rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i phyir de yang nye bar brtags nas rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: di las rjes su dpag pa skye ba'i phyir de yang nye bar brtags nas rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: And that is an inference by imputation, because an inference arises from it.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshig rjes su dpag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshig rjes su dpag pa yin na /
translated: If a word is an inference because it generates an inference,

original: mngon sum skyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi mngon du yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum skyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi mngon du yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then because it generates a direct perception, it would also be a direct perception for the sake of another.

original: de ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: ji ltar tshig las mthong ba yi //
analyzed: ji ltar tshig las mthong ba yi //
translated: Just as from a word,

original: 'brel pa dran par gyur pa na //
analyzed: 'brel pa dran par gyur pa na //
translated: the connection is remembered,

original: rjes dpag skye ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: rjes dpag skye ba de bzhin du //
translated: and then the inference arises,

original: 'gar yang mngon sum skye ma yin //
analyzed: 'gar yang mngon sum skye ma yin //
translated: It is never produced by direct perception.

original: tshul gsum rtags ni dran pa na //
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags ni dran pa na //
translated: When the trimodal mark is recalled,

original: nges par rjes dpag skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par rjes dpag skye bar 'gyur //
translated: inferential knowledge is definitely produced.

original: rang rig rtogs pa'i don tsam ni //üîΩbrjod pas mngon sum rig ma yin //
analyzed: rang rig rtogs pa'i don tsam ni // brjod pas mngon sum rig ma yin //
translated: The mere object realized by reflexive awarenessüîΩis not directly perceived by verbalization.

original: tshig tsam las ni gzhan la mngon sum skye ba med do //
analyzed: tshig tsam las ni gzhan la mngon sum skye ba med do //
translated: Direct perception is not produced from mere words.

original: gal te ri dvags rgyug pa la ltos zhes bya ba las mthong ba skye bar mthong ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ri dvags rgyug pa la ltos zhes bya ba las mthong ba skye bar mthong ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If it is said that direct perception is produced from ‚Äúlook at the running deer,‚Äù is it not seen?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: der yang rjes su dpag pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang rjes su dpag pa de ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is inference immediately after that.

original: 'di ltar / de ltar ltos zhes bya bas de //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ltar ltos zhes bya bas de //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that way, look.‚Äù

original: don de mngon phyogs la sbyor zhing //
analyzed: don de mngon phyogs la sbyor zhing //
translated: That is applied to the object that is directly perceived.

original: nga yi de ltar rtogs pa yang //
analyzed: nga yi de ltar rtogs pa yang //
translated: And my realization of that

original: don gyis bstan par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don gyis bstan par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: is taught by implication.

original: 'di ni ri dvags lta ba la mngon du phyogs par gyis shig ces nges par sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ri dvags lta ba la mngon du phyogs par gyis shig ces nges par sbyor ba yin te /
translated: That is the application of ‚Äúlook at the running deer.‚Äù

original: mngon du phyogs pa ni da ji lta bar khyod kyang de bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa ni da ji lta bar khyod kyang de bzhin no zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúLook directly‚Äù means ‚Äúyou are just like that.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar mngon du phyogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na de ltar mngon du phyogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, when it is directed in that way,üîΩthe function of the sense faculties engages.

original: dbang po rnams kyi byed pa 'jug go zhes dran pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid do //üîΩdes na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum srid par bltas te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi byed pa 'jug go zhes dran pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid do // des na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum srid par bltas te /
translated: Thus, it is inference itself because it is remembered.

original: 'jug pa yin no //üîΩde lta na 'o na mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul la srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug na rang bzhin gyi @124a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa yin no // de lta na 'o na mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul la srid pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug na rang bzhin gyi @124a * //
translated: Therefore, inference is seen to be possible in regard to perception.

original: gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Thus, if inference in regard to a non-perceived object is engaged, it is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: tshig gi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a reason based on the relation of words.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / du ba la 'dir me yod ches //
analyzed: 'di ltar / du ba la 'dir me yod ches //
translated: Because there is smoke here, there is fire.

original: tshig gis 'brel pa tsam zhig ni //
analyzed: tshig gis 'brel pa tsam zhig ni //
translated: The mere relation of words

original: bstan par 'gyur gyi du ba ni //
analyzed: bstan par 'gyur gyi du ba ni //
translated: is taught.üîΩBut smoke

original: mngon sum nyid kyis bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis bstan pa yin //
translated: is taught by perception itself.üîΩTherefore, the inference for the sake of others teaches the reason having the three modes.

original: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa'o zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa dang 'gal lo zhe na de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa'o zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa dang 'gal lo zhe na de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: This contradicts the Tattva·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: That is not correct because

original: tshig kun dran pa'i don yin te //
analyzed: tshig kun dran pa'i don yin te //
translated: All words are for the sake of reminding one of the meaning.

original: des na de la tshad brjod kyi //
analyzed: des na de la tshad brjod kyi //
translated: Therefore, the measure of that is stated.

original: mngon sum gyi ni rtogs pa la //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ni rtogs pa la //
translated: In the case of direct perception,

original: rtag tu tshig ni don med do //
analyzed: rtag tu tshig ni don med do //
translated: the word is always meaningless.

original: mkhas pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la ni /
translated: For the wise,

original: gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad //
translated: only the reason is stated.

original: ces 'di ni bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces 'di ni bshad pa nyid do //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de bzhin du 'brel pa 'ba' zhig kyang ngo zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel pa 'ba' zhig kyang ngo zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, only the connection should be seen.

original: yang na der yang 'khrul pa bsal pa'i phyir 'di ni du ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig la ltos par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na der yang 'khrul pa bsal pa'i phyir 'di ni du ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig la ltos par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Or, in that case, in order to remove confusion, it should be dependent on the words this is smoke.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / 'di des phyir na de la ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di des phyir na de la ni //
translated: Because of that, in that case,

original: 'di la du bar rtogs pa byung //
analyzed: 'di la du bar rtogs pa byung //
translated: the understanding of this as smoke arises.

original: 'dir yang ci'i phyir khyod 'khrul ces //
analyzed: 'dir yang ci'i phyir khyod 'khrul ces //
translated: Here, why are you confused?

original: de ltar gzhan gyis rtogs par byed //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis rtogs par byed //
translated: In that way, it is understood by another.

original: tshig gi don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of the words is this:

original: de la mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i don ni gzhan la tshig gis ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i don ni gzhan la tshig gis ston pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning seen by direct perception is not taught to another by words.

original: 'on kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
translated: But because it is the cause of that, it is inference for the sake of another.

original: 'di ni du ba nyid de gzhan du ni blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni du ba nyid de gzhan du ni blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: This is smoke, not something else.

original: 'di ni sngar dmigs pa gang yin de las rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar dmigs pa gang yin de las rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a different aspect from what was previously perceived,

original: de ni mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di don gyis brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di don gyis brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because that is its characteristic. This is what is meant.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i tshul nyid sgras ston par byed kyi ;
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i tshul nyid sgras ston par byed kyi ;
translated: Therefore, the method of inference is indicated by the word.

original: mngon sum la ni nam yang sgras byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni nam yang sgras byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But direct perception is never indicated by words.

original: shin tu goms pa las ni rjes su dpag pa spros pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten las gzhan du mngon no //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las ni rjes su dpag pa spros pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten las gzhan du mngon no //
translated: But from very familiarization, inference is manifested in the world as non-elaborate.

original: de'i phyir tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid bdag gir byed pas 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid bdag gir byed pas 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word is established as the cause of inference, and that is accepted.

original: tshig ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin rjes su dpog pa nyid yin gyi 'di na du ba yod do zhes bya ba rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin rjes su dpog pa nyid yin gyi 'di na du ba yod do zhes bya ba rgyu rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the words are the cause of that, it is the nature itself that is inferred, not the cause, as in ‚ÄúSmoke exists here.‚Äù

original: tshig gi rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because it is an inference of the nature of the words.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang don rjes dpag du ba la'ang //üîΩbar du rang bzhin gtan tshigs 'jug / der yang dpyod po rang bzhin @124b rtags ;
analyzed: rang don rjes dpag du ba la'ang // bar du rang bzhin gtan tshigs 'jug / der yang dpyod po rang bzhin @124b rtags ;
translated: In an inference for one‚Äôs own sake,üîΩthe nature of the reason is applied to the effect.

original: / med par 'khrul pa dang mi 'bral //
analyzed: / med par 'khrul pa dang mi 'bral //
translated: Even there, the analyzer is not free from the error of the absence of the nature.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩ'di la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'di la 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni //
translated: Here someone might say,üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the contradiction in this?

original: mi nyams 'gal ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: mi nyams 'gal ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the fault in a reason that is an effect?

original: de ni bar du chod na yang //
analyzed: de ni bar du chod na yang //
translated: Even if there is an obstruction,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs spong ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs spong ma yin //
translated: the reason of the effect is not refuted.‚Äù

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni //
translated: In an inference for one‚Äôs own sake,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa nyid do zhes de tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa la bar chod bstan pa gang du nye bar mkho //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa nyid do zhes de tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa la bar chod bstan pa gang du nye bar mkho //
translated: the reason of the effect is the mere statement, ‚ÄúIt exists.‚Äù What need is there to teach an obstruction to that?

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'dra di pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'dra di pa nyid do //
translated: The inference for the sake of another is the inference based on the effect, the like that.

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la dngos su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la dngos su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause smoke exists‚Äù are actually the inference based on the nature.

original: des na me rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na me rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no inference for the sake of another apart from the inference of fire.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩji ltar srid pa la brten nas //üîΩbstan bcos mdzad pas gzhan don gyi //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / ji ltar srid pa la brten nas // bstan bcos mdzad pas gzhan don gyi //
translated: That is not so.üîΩThe treatise master, relying on what is possible,

original: rjes su dpag nyed bshad la de //
analyzed: rjes su dpag nyed bshad la de //
translated: has explained the inference for the sake of another.üîΩWhat is the point of denying

original: med mod chad pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: med mod chad pa ci zhig yod //
translated: that which does not exist?

original: yang na gang du 'khrul pa med pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa der 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs chod pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na gang du 'khrul pa med pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa der 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs chod pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Or, where there is no error in the inference for one‚Äôs own sake, there is no doubt in the inference based on the effect.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang tshul de nyid yin pas sgra las dngos kho nar rjes su dpag pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par yang tshul de nyid yin pas sgra las dngos kho nar rjes su dpag pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the method in the inference for the sake of another, the inference of fire is generated from the words.

original: 'khrul pa med na brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med na brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If there is no error, what is the use of expression?

original: 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Since it is taught for the sake of connection, there is no fault.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod pa ston pa ni ci ltar srid pa bzhin no zhes da ltar kho na brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod pa ston pa ni ci ltar srid pa bzhin no zhes da ltar kho na brjod pa yin no //
translated: The existence of a reason having the three modes is taught as it is possible, and it is said to be just now.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / rjes su dpag pa med par ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rjes su dpag pa med par ni //
translated: Without inference,

original: tshig la tshad ma nyid med pa //
analyzed: tshig la tshad ma nyid med pa //
translated: There is no validity in words.

original: de tsam nyid gcig mngon 'dod kyi //
analyzed: de tsam nyid gcig mngon 'dod kyi //
translated: One desires just that much,

original: tshig rnams thams cad de lta min //
analyzed: tshig rnams thams cad de lta min //
translated: But not all words are like that.

original: ji skad du ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad ma yin te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHow is it that direct perception and inference are valid cognitions?

original: tshig kyang tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig kyang tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because words are the cause of conventions.üîΩWithout words, the complete conventions of the world would not exist.‚Äù

original: tshig med par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de la bshad pa /üîΩmngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dang // tshig med par ni 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: tshig med par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de la bshad pa / mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dang // tshig med par ni 'jig rten gyi //
translated: To that, it is explained:üîΩWithout direct perception, inference,üîΩAnd words,

original: tha snyad med par 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: tha snyad med par 'gyur ram ci //
translated: Would the conventions of the world not exist?

original: ci ga de yang tshad nyid dam //
analyzed: ci ga de yang tshad nyid dam //
translated: Or are they also valid cognitions?

original: mngon sum la sogs pa med pa sngon mthong ba'i don dran nas kyang 'jug pa med dam ci /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa med pa sngon mthong ba'i don dran nas kyang 'jug pa med dam ci /
translated: But is it not the case that one engages in the object of former seeing by remembering the object that was seen, even though perception does not exist?

original: ci ga da ni dran pa yang tshad ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci ga da ni dran pa yang tshad ma yin nam /
translated: Is memory a valid cognition or not?

original: 'on te tshad ma yin pa nyid na /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma yin pa nyid na /
translated: If it is a valid cognition,

original: de lta bu'i don can gyi tshig kyang tshad ma ma yin par mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don can gyi tshig kyang tshad ma ma yin par mtshungs so //
translated: then a statement that has such an object is also similar in being a valid cognition.

original: gang du tshad ma yin pa der ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yin gyi @125a * //
analyzed: gang du tshad ma yin pa der ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yin gyi @125a * //
translated: Where it is a valid cognition, it is so by virtue of being the cause of inference,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: 'dir ni 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, this much is asserted:

original: tshig thams cad rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig thams cad rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not that all statements are the cause of all inferences.

original: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid de rang rgyud nyid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid de rang rgyud nyid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: A statement is an inference, but it is not a valid cognition by itself.

original: thams cad rjes su dpag par bstan pa ni nye bar mkho ba med do //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su dpag par bstan pa ni nye bar mkho ba med do //
translated: It is not necessary to teach that everything is an inference.

original: de'i phyir tshul gsum pa ston pa'i tshig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul gsum pa ston pa'i tshig nyid do //
translated: Therefore, a statement that teaches the trimodal conditions is a valid cognition.

original: 'o na ni rig byed kyi tshig ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rig byed kyi tshig ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But how can the words of the Vedas be a means of valid knowledge?

original: der yang zla ba bcu gnyis ni lo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don ston pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang zla ba bcu gnyis ni lo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don ston pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin te /
translated: They are a means of valid knowledge because they teach the meaning of perception and inference, such as that a year consists of twelve months.

original: gzhan du ni tshad ma ma yin pa ste ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni tshad ma ma yin pa ste ;
translated: They are not a means of valid knowledge in other cases,

original: dper na skyes bu'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: like the words of a person.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that they are a means of valid knowledge because they are not made by a person, that is not so.

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not credible.

original: tshig tsam gyis ni su yang yid mi ches so //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis ni su yang yid mi ches so //
translated: No one believes them just because of the words.

original: gal te mngon sum ltar rig byed yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ltar rig byed yin na /
translated: If the Vedas are a means of valid knowledge like perception,

original: ci ste thams cad kyis mi rtogs la /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad kyis mi rtogs la /
translated: why do not all people understand them?

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i bzhin du /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i bzhin du /
translated: And like momentariness, etc.,

original: rjes su dpag pa las kyang thams cad rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las kyang thams cad rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: why are they not understood through inference?

original: 'khrul pa yin na 'dir yang 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na 'dir yang 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are mistaken, then this is also mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yid ches pa'i gnas de'i rigs can gyi rjes su dpag pas bzlog la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yid ches pa'i gnas de'i rigs can gyi rjes su dpag pas bzlog la /
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.

original: rig byed la ni de'i rigs can gyi tshig gis ma yin pas 'di ni mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: rig byed la ni de'i rigs can gyi tshig gis ma yin pas 'di ni mi mtshungs so //
translated: But the words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.

original: rjes su 'gro dang ni 'brel pas na //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ni 'brel pas na //
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin //üîΩrig byed la ni rjes 'gro dag //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin // rig byed la ni rjes 'gro dag //
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.

original: mthong bas med ces sngar dpyad do //
analyzed: mthong bas med ces sngar dpyad do //
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.üîΩThe inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.

original: yang na don 'di yin te tshul gsum pa ston pa'i tshig nyid gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi rig byed kyi tshig ni ma yin te /üîΩde la tshul gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na don 'di yin te tshul gsum pa ston pa'i tshig nyid gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yin gyi rig byed kyi tshig ni ma yin te / de la tshul gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.üîΩThe inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.üîΩThe inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.üîΩThe inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.

original: de la ni bden pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba med pa dang phyogs kyi chos kyang mthong ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ni bden pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba med pa dang phyogs kyi chos kyang mthong ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.üîΩThe words of the Vedas are not of the same type as the words of an inference. Therefore, this is not similar to that.

original: 'di ltar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyang mi bden pa nyid kyis ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyang mi bden pa nyid kyis ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: The inference that is of the same type as the one that is the basis of the belief in inference refutes it.

original: bden pa nyid dang ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bden pa nyid dang ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: The words of the Vedas are not of the

original: ci ste zla ba bcu gnyis lo yin no zhes bya bas rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zla ba bcu gnyis lo yin no zhes bya bas rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the year is twelve months, then the year would be the same as the months.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: me la sbyin sreg la sogs dag / rig byed nyid du nges pa med //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg la sogs dag / rig byed nyid du nges pa med //
translated: The fire sacrifice and so on are not necessarily Vedic.

original: 'ga' zhig gis ni byas pas 'di //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ni byas pas 'di //
translated: Since some are composed by humans,

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid du rtogs //
translated: they are recognized as humanly created.

original: 'di ni brgya la skyes bus ma byas pa'i nang du 'ga' zhig gis bcug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni brgya la skyes bus ma byas pa'i nang du 'ga' zhig gis bcug pa yin te /
translated: Some human being has inserted this into the Vedas, which are otherwise not humanly created.

original: 'ga' @125b zhig tu yan lag gzhan byas par thos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' @125b zhig tu yan lag gzhan byas par thos pa yin no //
translated: We have heard that some have even added other limbs.

original: de lta bu'i tha snyad de ni dran na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha snyad de ni dran na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that such conventions are remembered,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no confidence in that.

original: gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows that it would be the same for others.

original: 'di thams cad ni sngar bstan zin pas 'dir mi spro ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni sngar bstan zin pas 'dir mi spro ste /
translated: Since all of this has already been explained, I will not elaborate on it here.

original: gzhag go // gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid rang gis mthong ba'i sgras brjod na /
analyzed: gzhag go // gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid rang gis mthong ba'i sgras brjod na /
translated: If the reason of the trimodal logical mark is stated by the word ‚Äúseeing‚Äù in the context of one‚Äôs own observation,

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'i //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston pa gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes brjod par bya'i //
translated: One should say, The inference for the sake of others is the demonstration of the trimodal logical reason,

original: rang gis mthong ba smos pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba smos pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: but what is the use of mentioning the perception of oneself?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: don gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of another.

original: 'di ltar / gzhan la bstan par bya nyid phyir //üîΩbdag mthong min yang gzhan dag gi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan la bstan par bya nyid phyir // bdag mthong min yang gzhan dag gi //
translated: Thus,üîΩOne should say, Although I do not perceive it, I establish the perception of others,üîΩbecause it is to be taught to others.

original: mthong ba sgrub byed ces kha cig / de spongs phyir bdag mthong ba'i tshig / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni rang gis rtogs pa'i dbang du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba sgrub byed ces kha cig / de spongs phyir bdag mthong ba'i tshig / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par ni rang gis rtogs pa'i dbang du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: In an inference for the sake of others, one does not speak from one's own perspective,

original: gzhan nyid rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of making another understand.

original: gal te rtags te gzhan gyis rtogs na gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te rtags te gzhan gyis rtogs na gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If the logical reason is understood by the other, then the other will understand.

original: rgol bas ma rtogs pa ji ltar gzhan rtogs zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rgol bas ma rtogs pa ji ltar gzhan rtogs zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say, If the proponent does not understand, how can the other understand?

original: rgol bas rtogs kyang gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: rgol bas rtogs kyang gzhan dag ni //
translated: Even if the proponent understands,

original: rang rtogs med par rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: rang rtogs med par rtogs ma yin //
translated: others do not understand without understanding themselves.

original: gal te de yod de nyid 'dir //
analyzed: gal te de yod de nyid 'dir //
translated: If it exists, then it is this reality.

original: 'gyur byed gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: 'gyur byed gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of another agent of change?

original: de tsam gyis ni 'di rgol bas rtogs so zhes yid ches pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni 'di rgol bas rtogs so zhes yid ches pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The opponent is not convinced by the mere statement, ‚ÄúI understand this.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang 'dis shes nas bstan nam /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dis shes nas bstan nam /
translated: But is it taught by one who understands?

original: de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
translated: Or is it not so?

original: ngas ni ji ltar rtogs so zhes rang nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngas ni ji ltar rtogs so zhes rang nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúI understand it as it is,‚Äù because of understanding it oneself.

original: spros pa bla lhag gi rnam par dpyad pa 'dir ci zhig bya zhes /
analyzed: spros pa bla lhag gi rnam par dpyad pa 'dir ci zhig bya zhes /
translated: What is the use of this excessive analysis?

original: bsam pa 'dis rang gis ma rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa rtags su 'dod pas /
analyzed: bsam pa 'dis rang gis ma rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs pa rtags su 'dod pas /
translated: With this thought, one asserts that even though one does not understand it oneself, others understand it.

original: bsam pa de dgag pa'i phyir rang gis mthong ba smos so //
analyzed: bsam pa de dgag pa'i phyir rang gis mthong ba smos so //
translated: In order to refute this thought, ‚ÄúI see‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te de lta na rang kho nas mthong ba yin par 'gyur bas gzhan gyis mthong ba rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /üîΩdon med pa gzhan thog tu bab po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rang kho nas mthong ba yin par 'gyur bas gzhan gyis mthong ba rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /üîΩdon med pa gzhan thog tu bab po zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be seen by oneself alone. Therefore, it is pointless to analyze whether it is seen by another.üîΩIf you say this,

original: ma yin te gnyi gas mthong ba bstan pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid ji ltar gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin te gnyi gas mthong ba bstan pa'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid ji ltar gnas pa nyid do //
translated: No, because it is for the purpose of showing that both see. This is just how the characteristic exists.

original: des ni log par rtogs pa yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni log par rtogs pa yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: And this also removes a wrong conception.

original: ci ste de'i don nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: ci ste de'i don nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: But if it is the meaning of that, then the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be used.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: gang gi don du 'di tsam pa de ni yang gi sgras bsdu ba yin no zhes mi rigs so //üîΩrang gis ma rtogs par ni gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes brjod @126a * //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'di tsam pa de ni yang gi sgras bsdu ba yin no zhes mi rigs so // rang gis ma rtogs par ni gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes brjod @126a * //
translated: because it is not correct to include that which is the meaning of this much with the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: par mi nus so //
analyzed: par mi nus so //
translated: And it cannot be said that one understands what is not understood by oneself.

original: gal te de gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is understood by another, it is understood.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes yongs su shes pa ni mkho ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes yongs su shes pa ni mkho ba med de /
translated: But it is not necessary to know that it is understood by another,

original: rang rtogs pa tsam gyis gzhan la chog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang rtogs pa tsam gyis gzhan la chog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is sufficient for the other to understand it by himself.

original: 'o na ji ltar rang gis ma shes pa gzhan la nye bar 'god /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rang gis ma shes pa gzhan la nye bar 'god /
translated: But how can one who does not understand by himself make it known to another?

original: gzhan la grub pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la grub pas so zhe na /
translated: Because it is established for another.

original: 'o na gzhan la grub po zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la grub po zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it is just that which is established for another.

original: des na rang nyid ma rtogs par der ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rang nyid ma rtogs par der ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that without understanding it, one would understand it?

original: tshu rol mthong bas gzhan gyis rtogs pas mngon sum du ni mi byed do //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas gzhan gyis rtogs pas mngon sum du ni mi byed do //
translated: Since it is seen only partially, it is not directly perceived by others.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gis rtogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gis rtogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Inference also depends on one‚Äôs own understanding.

original: des na gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes nges pa ni rang gis kyang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes nges pa ni rang gis kyang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment that ‚Äúit is understood by others‚Äù is also understood by oneself.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi lung las rtogs la rang gis kyang de rtogs pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi lung las rtogs la rang gis kyang de rtogs pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: But if it is understood from the scriptures of others, and it is indeed understood by oneself,

original: rgol bas lung de khas ma blangs pas ma rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: rgol bas lung de khas ma blangs pas ma rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed do //
translated: then the opponent does not accept that scripture, and so one says, ‚ÄúIt is not understood.‚Äù

original: des na lung las gzhan gyis rtogs kyi rang nyid kyis ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang ;
analyzed: des na lung las gzhan gyis rtogs kyi rang nyid kyis ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang ;
translated: Therefore, that which is understood by others through scripture but not by oneselfüîΩis also a proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhe na 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhe na 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: yongs rtags yongs su len pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yongs rtags yongs su len pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the sign is accepted by both,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig / tshad ma nyid du 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig / tshad ma nyid du 'dod ma yin //
translated: the words are not asserted to be a valid cognition with respect to the object of inference.

original: der ni rjes dpag 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni rjes dpag 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: Inference does not operate there.

original: lung tshad ma'ang tshad ma ma yin //
analyzed: lung tshad ma'ang tshad ma ma yin //
translated: Scripture is not a means of valid cognition.

original: gal te tshad ma yin na ni gnyi ga la grub pa nyid de tshad mas mthong ba gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na ni gnyi ga la grub pa nyid de tshad mas mthong ba gzhan bzhin no //
translated: If it were a means of valid cognition, it would be established for both parties, like the perception of another.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na 'ga' la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid na 'ga' la yang ma yin no //
translated: If it is not a means of valid cognition, then it is not a means of valid cognition for anyone.

original: khas blangs pa'i phyir pha rol po nyid la grub po zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i phyir pha rol po nyid la grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established for the opponent because of acceptance,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la khas blangs pas lung tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la khas blangs pas lung tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: then scripture is not a means of valid cognition with regard to the object of inference,

original: yongs su brtags pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted as a mere imputation.

original: de ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa la tshad ma yin gyi de'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin pa la tshad ma yin gyi de'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a means of valid cognition with regard to that which is not the object of perception or inference, but it is not a means of valid cognition with regard to that.

original: thams cad du yang ma yin na rjes su dpag pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad du yang ma yin na rjes su dpag pas ci bya ste /
translated: If it is not a means of valid cognition in all cases, then what is the use of inference?

original: tshig tsam gyis don grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis don grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is established by mere words.

original: 'di ltar grangs can gyis /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa sems med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar grangs can gyis / bde ba la sogs pa sems med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya says,

original: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba can nam mi rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúPleasure and so on are not mental because they are produced or impermanent,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: like form and so on.‚Äù

original: gzhan la rab tu grub par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la rab tu grub par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is asserted that it is established for others.üîΩ

original: grangs can rang nyid la ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: grangs can rang nyid la ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa nyid ma grub po //
translated: But for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya themselves, impermanence or that which is produced is not established.

original: der gal te tshig tshang ma yin pa'i phyir rab tu grub na /
analyzed: der gal te tshig tshang ma yin pa'i phyir rab tu grub na /
translated: If it is established for the other, because the words are complete,

original: grangs can kyi tshig kyang tshad ma nyid yin pas blo dang bde ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis sems @126b pa med par grub pas rjes su dpag pas ci bya /
analyzed: grangs can kyi tshig kyang tshad ma nyid yin pas blo dang bde ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis sems @126b pa med par grub pas rjes su dpag pas ci bya /
translated: then since the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs words are valid cognition, consciousness, pleasure, and so on are established to be without mind by that alone. So what is the use of inference?

original: 'on te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i tshig gis grub pa de'i tshe blo la sogs pa sems pa can du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas phyin ci log tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i tshig gis grub pa de'i tshe blo la sogs pa sems pa can du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas phyin ci log tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: But if impermanence and so on are established by the Buddhist‚Äôs words, then since consciousness and so on are established to be conscious, it is not the case that inference establishes the opposite. Therefore inference is pointless.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pas de las bzlog pa yang 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pas de las bzlog pa yang 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But if inference is valid cognition, then the opposite is also established.

original: de ltar yin na ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If that were so, then it would not be valid cognition. This is explained in the following:

original: lung la gnod phyir gzhan la ni //
analyzed: lung la gnod phyir gzhan la ni //
translated: Because scripture is invalidated by the other,üîΩbecause it states a proof,

original: sgrub byed brjod phyir de yi tshe //
analyzed: sgrub byed brjod phyir de yi tshe //
translated: at that time,

original: de ni tshad min de bas na //
analyzed: de ni tshad min de bas na //
translated: it is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: des grub ma lus grub ma yin //
analyzed: des grub ma lus grub ma yin //
translated: Therefore, everything established by it is not established.

original: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas phyin ci log tu bsgrub par rtsom pa de nyid kyi tshe brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir tshig de tshad ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pas phyin ci log tu bsgrub par rtsom pa de nyid kyi tshe brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir tshig de tshad ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: When one begins to prove something incorrectly by means of inference, at that very time, because it cannot withstand analysis, that statement is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: khas blangs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted out of desire.

original: lung ni khas blangs pas tshad ma'i dngos por byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: lung ni khas blangs pas tshad ma'i dngos por byas pa yin pas /
translated: Scripture is made into a valid means of knowledge by acceptance.

original: de dor na de'i tshad ma nyid kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dor na de'i tshad ma nyid kyang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is rejected, its validity also becomes like that.

original: des na der rab tu grub ba'i gtan tshigs grub pa nyams pa'i phyir bsgrub bya grub pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na der rab tu grub ba'i gtan tshigs grub pa nyams pa'i phyir bsgrub bya grub pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the proof of the reason established in that [scripture] is lost, the establishment of the probandum is also lost.

original: de las rag las pa'i bdag nyid thams cad ni de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las rag las pa'i bdag nyid thams cad ni de'i rjes su mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Everything that depends on that does not fail to follow it,

original: de la rag las pa nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag las pa nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is not dependent on that.

original: gtan tshigs grub pa la tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub pa la tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
translated: The reason is that it is valid knowledge.üîΩ

original: sems pa nyid la ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa nyid la ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: The reason is established by a valid cognition, not by mere thought.

original: 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa mthong bas thams cad la yid brtan du med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa mthong bas thams cad la yid brtan du med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say this, it follows that because one sees some who are deceived, no one is to be trusted.

original: 'on te mi slu ba can gyi tshig de ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mi slu ba can gyi tshig de ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the nondeceptive words are valid cognition,

original: phyogs gcig ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not the one-sided,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs de rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka la grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs de rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyis ka la grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the reason would be established for both the proponent and the opponent.

original: 'on te tshad mas 'grub kyang grangs can pa'i gtsug lag mi shes pa'i phyir pha rol la rab tu grub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tshad mas 'grub kyang grangs can pa'i gtsug lag mi shes pa'i phyir pha rol la rab tu grub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that although it is established by valid cognition, it is established for the opponent because the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not know the scriptures,

original: de yang mi 'thad do de ltar na ni grangs can rang gis mtshang gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad do de ltar na ni grangs can rang gis mtshang gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: that is also not tenable. In that case, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya would be revealing his own faults.

original: de lta mod kyi skyon ci yod //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi skyon ci yod //
translated: But what is the fault?

original: rang la grub pa'i rtags kyis ni //
analyzed: rang la grub pa'i rtags kyis ni //
translated: By a reason established for oneself,

original: des 'dis rtogs par byas pa yin ;
analyzed: des 'dis rtogs par byas pa yin ;
translated: one is made to understand by this.

original: / gzhan du ma shes pa tsam gyis //
analyzed: / gzhan du ma shes pa tsam gyis //
translated: But by mere nonunderstanding of the other,

original: kun du mi shes par mi 'os //üîΩgtan tshigs sgrub par nus pa ma yin zhes te /
analyzed: kun du mi shes par mi 'os // gtan tshigs sgrub par nus pa ma yin zhes te /
translated: It is not proper to be completely ignorant.üîΩIt is not that the reason is incapable of establishing the probandum.

original: de bsgrub bya bsgrub par yang mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bsgrub bya bsgrub par yang mi nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the probandum is incapable of being established.

original: de ni re zhig gtan tshig sde las bsgrub bya rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni re zhig gtan tshig sde las bsgrub bya rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: First, the reason is understood from the treatise,

original: rang las grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rang las grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it is a reason established by oneself.

original: @127a * // ci ste 'di ngo bzlog par nus pa'i phyir rgol ba brtan pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @127a * // ci ste 'di ngo bzlog par nus pa'i phyir rgol ba brtan pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the opponent is not firm because this can be refuted,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also unacceptable.

original: bsgrub bya bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs grub pas gzhan gyis ci bya 'di ltar re zhig khyod la de grub ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs grub pas gzhan gyis ci bya 'di ltar re zhig khyod la de grub ste /
translated: What can the opponent do when the reason establishing the probandum is established? In this way, first it is established for you.

original: de grub yon tan ci zhig yod //üîΩthams cad nga yis ci dgos zhes //
analyzed: de grub yon tan ci zhig yod // thams cad nga yis ci dgos zhes //
translated: What good quality is there in establishing that?üîΩWhat is the point of this method of saying,

original: bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin //
analyzed: bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin //
translated: I don't need anything?

original: bsgrub bya bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ngas sgrub dgos so zhes bya ba 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am ci /
analyzed: bsgrub bya bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ngas sgrub dgos so zhes bya ba 'di rgyal po'i bka' 'am ci /
translated: Is this the king's decree, that the reason must also be established by me, just like the probandum?

original: thams cad mi shes pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mi shes pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to understand that which is completely unknown.

original: 'on te rang nyid nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag kyang nges par 'dod pas sgrub byed brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na de ni mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid nges pa bzhin du gzhan dag kyang nges par 'dod pas sgrub byed brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na de ni mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Or do you say that the proof is stated in the manner of the assertion that just as you are certain, so are others certain?

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / 'dir ni gzhan dag nges pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dir ni gzhan dag nges pa ni //
translated: Here, the certainty of others

original: skye ba tsam gyis dgos pa yin //
analyzed: skye ba tsam gyis dgos pa yin //
translated: is the mere purpose of the arising of the words.

original: rang gis nges pa bzhin du zhes //
analyzed: rang gis nges pa bzhin du zhes //
translated: The qualification ‚Äújust as you are certain‚Äù

original: bya ba'i khyad par don med do //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par don med do //
translated: is meaningless.

original: gzhan dag gi nges pa tsam zhig don gyi gnyer gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi nges pa tsam zhig don gyi gnyer gyi /
translated: The mere certainty of others is the purpose,

original: 'dir nye bar mkho ba med pa'i khyad par gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar mkho ba med pa'i khyad par gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but here there is no other qualification that is needed.

original: mkho ba med pa'i khyad par ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa khas len pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mkho ba med pa'i khyad par ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa khas len pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Those who understand do not accept meaningless qualifications.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:üîΩHow can there be

original: gang zhig gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyis rtogs pa ni //
translated: an understanding of this by others

original: bye brag tu ni shes med pa //üîΩde la 'dis rtogs zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni shes med pa // de la 'dis rtogs zhes bya ba'i //
translated: without understanding the particulars?üîΩHow can there be

original: blor ni ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: blor ni ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: the thought ‚ÄúI understand this‚Äù?

original: 'di ni ngas ma bslus te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngas ma bslus te /
translated: This is not deceptive for me.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa nyid do zhes rang gis ma rtogs pas ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa nyid do zhes rang gis ma rtogs pas ji ltar rtogs /
translated: But since you do not realize this yourself, how can you realize it for others?

original: ci ste 'dis ci bya ste rtogs pa tsam ni gzhan la 'gyur ba yin la de tsam zhig gis rgol ba'i tshig gis don byas pa yin pas 'di la nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: ci ste 'dis ci bya ste rtogs pa tsam ni gzhan la 'gyur ba yin la de tsam zhig gis rgol ba'i tshig gis don byas pa yin pas 'di la nyes pa ci yod /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of this? It is just realization, and it is for others. And just that much is the point of the opponent‚Äôs words. So what is the fault here?‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'o na 'di yang lan yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na 'di yang lan yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then this would be a response:

original: nga yis khyod ni bslus nas kyang //
analyzed: nga yis khyod ni bslus nas kyang //
translated: Even though I deceive you,

original: 'ga' zhig rtogs par byas pa yin //üîΩngas rtogs pa yis khyod la 'dir //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtogs par byas pa yin // ngas rtogs pa yis khyod la 'dir //
translated: I cause some to realize.üîΩWhat other purpose do I have here

original: dgos pa gzhan ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan ni ci zhig yod //
translated: than to cause you to realize?

original: gang gi tshe sgrub pa byed par snang ba 'ga' zhig ji ltar rung bar brjod nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgrub pa byed par snang ba 'ga' zhig ji ltar rung bar brjod nas /
translated: When you say, ‚ÄúI will engage in proof,‚Äù and you state something that is suitable for some,

original: ngas khyod rtogs par byas so zhes smra ba de'i tshig de la lan ji skad gdab /
analyzed: ngas khyod rtogs par byas so zhes smra ba de'i tshig de la lan ji skad gdab /
translated: and you say, ‚ÄúI cause you to realize,‚Äù what response can you give to those words?

original: de la sun 'byin ba brjod par bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sun 'byin ba brjod par bya'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI will state a response,‚Äù that is not so.

original: sun 'byin pas ni rgol bas ma rtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: sun 'byin pas ni rgol bas ma rtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If a response is something that is stated by the opponent who does not realize,

original: rgol ba des ni ngas rtogs pas khyed la ci dgos zhes lan 'di btab pa yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba des ni ngas rtogs pas khyed la ci dgos zhes lan 'di btab pa yin no //
translated: The opponent replies, ‚ÄúI have understood it, so what do I need from you?‚Äù

original: ngas kyang de ltar na ma rtogs so zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ngas kyang de ltar na ma rtogs so zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúI have not understood it in that way.‚Äù

original: 'o na gzhan la sun 'byin pa brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la sun 'byin pa brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, it is not proper to state a refutation to another person.

original: 'dir @127b ngas rtogs pa med pas de tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir @127b ngas rtogs pa med pas de tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, since I have not understood it, I will just say that much.‚Äù

original: ma rtogs pa 'thad pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa 'thad pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to show that the non-understanding is itself untenable, you must state a refutation.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, then . . .‚ÄùüîΩIf the refutation that you state

original: gal te gzhan gyis 'thad pa dang / bcas pa'i sun 'byin brjod bya na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis 'thad pa dang / bcas pa'i sun 'byin brjod bya na //
translated: Is one that is tenable for others,üîΩThen the proponent should also state

original: rgol bas kyang ni 'thad pa dang // bcas pa'i sgrub byed brjod par bya //
analyzed: rgol bas kyang ni 'thad pa dang // bcas pa'i sgrub byed brjod par bya //
translated: A proof that is tenable for others.

original: ji ltar ngas 'dir 'di ltar ma rtogs zhes phyir rgol bas 'thad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya ba de bzhin du rgol bas kyang sgrub par byed pa 'thad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya ste de lta ma yin na 'dir ji ltar ngas ma rtogs
analyzed: ji ltar ngas 'dir 'di ltar ma rtogs zhes phyir rgol bas 'thad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya ba de bzhin du rgol bas kyang sgrub par byed pa 'thad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya ste de lta ma yin na 'dir ji ltar ngas ma rtogs
translated: Just as the opponent can state with reason, ‚ÄúI do not understand it in this way,‚Äù the proponent can also state with reason, ‚ÄúI prove it in this way.‚Äù If it were not so, then how could the opponent say, ‚ÄúI do not understand it in this way‚Äù?üîΩ

original: pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang brgyal mi rtogs pa srid do snyam pa'i dogs pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang brgyal mi rtogs pa srid do snyam pa'i dogs pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as I here say, ‚ÄúI do not understand this,‚Äù with a reason, in the same way, the challenger also should state a proof with a reason. Otherwise, one would not be free from the doubt that just as I do not understand this, so it is possible that others also do not understand it.

original: gzhan gyi don grub par nges pa med par tshim pa la brten pa ma yin no //üîΩrgyal bar 'dod pa tsam gyis ni mkhas pa 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don grub par nges pa med par tshim pa la brten pa ma yin no // rgyal bar 'dod pa tsam gyis ni mkhas pa 'jug pa'am /
translated: One should not be satisfied with the mere certainty of establishing the meaning for oneself.

original: de'i don du bstan bcos byed ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don du bstan bcos byed ba ma yin te /
translated: The wise do not engage in something or compose treatises on it merely because they desire victory.

original: de kho na 'jug pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na 'jug pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of engaging in something is to understand reality.

original: de'i phyir rang gis rtogs na 'dis ni 'di rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis rtogs na 'dis ni 'di rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, if one understands it oneself, one should say, ‚ÄúThis person understands this,‚Äù

original: 'di ma rtogs par brjod pa ni brdzun yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ma rtogs par brjod pa ni brdzun yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and to say that one does not understand it is false.

original: rang gis rtogs pa med pa ni //
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa med pa ni //
translated: One who does not understand it oneself

original: gal te gzhan khas mi len na rgol bar ston par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur na bdag nyid nyams par 'dod pa su yod /
analyzed: gal te gzhan khas mi len na rgol bar ston par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur na bdag nyid nyams par 'dod pa su yod /
translated: If one does not accept the opponent‚Äôs position, one is not engaged in debate. Who would want to undermine his own position?

original: 'di nyid tshad mas rtogs na ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid tshad mas rtogs na ni //
translated: If one understands it by means of a valid cognition,

original: khas mi len yang gzhan mi bden par smra ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khas mi len yang gzhan mi bden par smra ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though one does not accept it, one understands that the opponent‚Äôs position is not false.

original: 'on te rang gis rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis rtogs kyang gzhan gyis rtogs so zhes ji ltar shes she na /
translated: But if one understands it oneself, how does one know that the opponent understands it?

original: gal te phyir rgol bas mi rtogs su chug kyang nyan par byed pa dag ni rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bas mi rtogs su chug kyang nyan par byed pa dag ni rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Even though the opponent does not understand it, the audience does understand it.

original: nyan par byed pa dag gis rtogs pas gal te des ma rtogs na de'i tshe de la tshogs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan par byed pa dag gis rtogs pas gal te des ma rtogs na de'i tshe de la tshogs pa med pa yin te /
translated: If the audience understands it, but the opponent does not, then the opponent is not a member of the assembly.

original: rgol ba'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba'i nyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a fault of the debater.

original: 'o ma dmus long la bstan pa //üîΩmed kyang ston byed nyams pa min //
analyzed: 'o ma dmus long la bstan pa // med kyang ston byed nyams pa min //
translated: When one shows a white conch to a person born blind,üîΩthe one who shows it is not at fault

original: rgol ba 'gas kyang phyir rgol la //
analyzed: rgol ba 'gas kyang phyir rgol la //
translated: even though the opponent does not see it.üîΩWhen one gives an eye to an opponent,

original: mig byin pas ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: mig byin pas ni yod ma yin //
translated: it is not that the opponent has it.

original: 'o ma dkar po'i zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'o ma dkar po'i zhes brjod pa na /
translated: When one says ‚Äúwhite milk,‚Äù

original: mig ma tshang bus gal te ma rtogs na yang phyir rgol ba dmus long nyid kyis nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: mig ma tshang bus gal te ma rtogs na yang phyir rgol ba dmus long nyid kyis nyes pa yin te /
translated: Even if the blind man does not understand, the fault is that of the blind opponent.

original: ji ltar der rgol ba'i nyes pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar der rgol ba'i nyes pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be the fault of the one who is speaking?

original: dbang po dag gis rtogs pa de tsam gyis rgol ba'i tshig don byas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩci ste yang /
analyzed: dbang po dag gis rtogs pa de tsam gyis rgol ba'i tshig don byas par 'gyur ba ma yin no // ci ste yang /
translated: The opponent is not satisfied with the mere understanding that comes from the senses.üîΩBut if he is not satisfied with the mere understanding that comes from the senses,

original: gzhan don byed pa snying rje yis //üîΩyid drangs rnams @128a * //üîΩkyi nyan pa pos //
analyzed: gzhan don byed pa snying rje yis // yid drangs rnams @128a * // kyi nyan pa pos //
translated: how can he be satisfied with the mere understanding that comes from the words of another?

original: rtogs pa tsam gyis tshim pa dang // 'brel 'di ji ltar 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam gyis tshim pa dang // 'brel 'di ji ltar 'thad pa yin //
translated: How can he be satisfied with the mere understanding that comes from the words of another?

original: rang yongs su tshim pa tsam ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang yongs su tshim pa tsam ni gzhan gyi don byed pa'i dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere satisfaction of one‚Äôs own mind is not a substitute for the benefit of others.

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The opponent wants to clear up his own confusion.

original: de la phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba'i don du zhugs pa dag nyan pa po tsam rtogs pas yongs su tshim mo zhes bya ba 'di go gang la 'phangs pa gang la 'phos pa yin /
analyzed: de la phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba'i don du zhugs pa dag nyan pa po tsam rtogs pas yongs su tshim mo zhes bya ba 'di go gang la 'phangs pa gang la 'phos pa yin /
translated: But how can he be satisfied with the mere understanding that comes from the words of another?

original: phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni gang la yin la /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ni gang la yin la /
translated: For the sake of understanding the opponent, one should compose a treatise.

original: nyan pa po tsam rtogs pas chog pa ni gang na yin /
analyzed: nyan pa po tsam rtogs pas chog pa ni gang na yin /
translated: But where is there a mere listener who is satisfied with understanding?

original: gzhan yang / de phyogs 'dzin pas nyams pa yis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de phyogs 'dzin pas nyams pa yis //
translated: Moreover,

original: nyan po gang tshe rtsod byed pa //üîΩder yang rgol pas nyan pa po //
analyzed: nyan po gang tshe rtsod byed pa // der yang rgol pas nyan pa po //
translated: When the listener becomes an opponentüîΩThrough taking a side,

original: gzhan yang btsal bar bya ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan yang btsal bar bya ba yin //
translated: Then the proponent must seek another listener.

original: nyan po phyir rgol gyur pa na //
analyzed: nyan po phyir rgol gyur pa na //
translated: When the listener becomes an opponent,

original: nyan po gzhan du spo pas na //
analyzed: nyan po gzhan du spo pas na //
translated: Through shifting to another position,

original: thug med des na rgol ba ni //
analyzed: thug med des na rgol ba ni //
translated: Then, since there is no end to this,

original: su yi ston pa byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: su yi ston pa byed par 'gyur //
translated: Whose teacher will the proponent be?

original: 'on te nyan po'i 'jig rten ni //üîΩrgol ba'i phyogs su gyur na yang //
analyzed: 'on te nyan po'i 'jig rten ni // rgol ba'i phyogs su gyur na yang //
translated: Even if the world of listenersüîΩBecomes the side of the proponent,

original: de lta na yang phyogs ltung phyir //
analyzed: de lta na yang phyogs ltung phyir //
translated: Still, because of falling into a side,

original: nyan po min par gsal ba nyid //
analyzed: nyan po min par gsal ba nyid //
translated: The listener is clearly not impartial.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'di gzhan don byed ces bya ste //
analyzed: 'di gzhan don byed ces bya ste //
translated: This is called ‚Äúworking for the sake of others.‚Äù

original: skal med la yang de lta 'am ci //üîΩnus las 'das nas ma byas pas //
analyzed: skal med la yang de lta 'am ci // nus las 'das nas ma byas pas //
translated: But is it like that even for those who are unfortunate?üîΩSince it is beyond one‚Äôs ability,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid ma yin min //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid ma yin min //
translated: It is not that one does not do it out of a lack of compassion.

original: snying rje ldan yang skal ldan gyis //
analyzed: snying rje ldan yang skal ldan gyis //
translated: Even if you have compassion, you are not a suitable vessel.üîΩ

original: don byed par ni nus pa yin //
analyzed: don byed par ni nus pa yin //
translated: But the compassionate one is able to help the fortunate,

original: skal ldan min la nus pa ni //
analyzed: skal ldan min la nus pa ni //
translated: but not the unfortunate.

original: nyams kyis snying rje nyams ma yin //
analyzed: nyams kyis snying rje nyams ma yin //
translated: The compassionate one does not lose compassionüîΩbecause of the inability to help the unfortunate.

original: de ni snying rje can ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni snying rje can ma yin no zhes rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not understood that the compassionate one is not compassionate.

original: nyan pa po rnams phyogs su lhung na ni //
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams phyogs su lhung na ni //
translated: If the listeners are biased,

original: mi rtogs pa nyid pas gdon mi za bar nyan pa po gzhan btsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtogs pa nyid pas gdon mi za bar nyan pa po gzhan btsal ba yin no //
translated: then they do not understand, and so one must seek other listeners.

original: thams cad rtsod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad rtsod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But not everyone is a disputant,

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no purpose and because they are mutually dependent.

original: ci ste de dag kyang phan tshun rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba nyid yin pa de lta na ni tha snyad mtha' dag chad par 'gyur la mthong ba yang med de /
analyzed: ci ste de dag kyang phan tshun rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba nyid yin pa de lta na ni tha snyad mtha' dag chad par 'gyur la mthong ba yang med de /
translated: If they are disputants and opponents, then all conventions are cut off and there is no seeing.

original: de'i phyir nyan pa po'i rtogs pa tsam nyid kyis smra ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa po'i rtogs pa tsam nyid kyis smra ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the speaker is complete just by the mere understanding of the listener.

original: gang zhig gzung bar mi 'os pa la sogs pa brjod pas gzhan pham par byed pa de ni brtse ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar mi 'os pa la sogs pa brjod pas gzhan pham par byed pa de ni brtse ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The one who defeats others by stating what is not suitable to be grasped and so on is indeed devoid of compassion.

original: de'i phyir rang gis rtogs pa nyan pa po la sogs pa la bstan pas bdag nyid ston pa'i nus pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis rtogs pa nyan pa po la sogs pa la bstan pas bdag nyid ston pa'i nus pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by teaching what one has understood to the listeners and so on, one relies on the ability to teach oneself.

original: des na gzhan la grub @128b pa ni lung las 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gzhan la grub @128b pa ni lung las 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, establishment for others is established from scripture.

original: gal te lung de gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te lung de gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that scripture is accepted by others,

original: de las rab tu grub pa'i phyogs kyi chos las de dag nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de las rab tu grub pa'i phyogs kyi chos las de dag nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then at that time, is the property of the position not established from that?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: phyogs gcig gnod par 'gyur ba can ni de ltar khas len par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gnod par 'gyur ba can ni de ltar khas len par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to accept that which is subject to refutation in one part.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa ;
translated: For that very reason, it is explained:

original: gal te lung de ldan la grub //
analyzed: gal te lung de ldan la grub //
translated: If that scripture is established for both,

original: ce na gang gi lung gang yin //
