analyzed: ce na gang gi lung gang yin //
translated: whose scripture is it?

original: tshad mas gnod par grub pa yin //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod par grub pa yin //
translated: It is established as refuted by valid cognition.

original: lung de ji ltar grub pa yin //
analyzed: lung de ji ltar grub pa yin //
translated: How is that scripture established?

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin zhing gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yang ma yin na gang gi lung gang yin /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin zhing gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yang ma yin na gang gi lung gang yin /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition and it is not accepted by the other party, whose scripture is it?

original: gal te khas ma blangs kyang lung de dang ldan pa yin na grangs can gang yin pas ma yin pa gnyis ka la grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te khas ma blangs kyang lung de dang ldan pa yin na grangs can gang yin pas ma yin pa gnyis ka la grub pa nyid do //
translated: If one possesses a scripture even though one does not accept it, then it would be established for both parties, but it is not.

original: ci ste khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de lta ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not so because it is not accepted,

original: 'ga' yang lung de dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'ga' la yang ma grub po //
analyzed: 'ga' yang lung de dang ldan pa ma yin pas 'ga' la yang ma grub po //
translated: then no one possesses that scripture, and so it is not established for anyone.

original: de ni lung yang yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni lung yang yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be a scripture,

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir de ni lung ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir de ni lung ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: because it is contradicted by valid cognition. It is a pseudo-scripture.

original: tshad ma ltar snang ba las rtogs na ni de rmongs pa nyid yin pas de gzhan gyi rmongs pa ma bzlog pa'i phyir rgol ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang ba las rtogs na ni de rmongs pa nyid yin pas de gzhan gyi rmongs pa ma bzlog pa'i phyir rgol ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: If one understands it from a pseudo-valid cognition, then because that is just delusion, it is not a refutation, since it does not remove the delusion of the other party.

original: tshad ltar snang ba mi shes na gzhan ji ltar rmongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: tshad ltar snang ba mi shes na gzhan ji ltar rmongs pa ma yin /
translated: If one does not know the pseudo-valid cognition, how could the other party be deluded?

original: mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not know it.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de dang 'gal ba khas len pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de dang 'gal ba khas len pa //
translated: One accepts what contradicts it.

original: de nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be so?

original: de dang 'gal ba khas len na //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba khas len na //
translated: If one accepts that which contradicts it,

original: de dor yan lag tshad ma min //üîΩgang gi tshe 'di de dang 'gal ba khas len pa de nyid kyi tshe lung de mi bden par yang rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dor yan lag tshad ma min // gang gi tshe 'di de dang 'gal ba khas len pa de nyid kyi tshe lung de mi bden par yang rtogs pa yin te /
translated: then the scripture is not a valid means of knowledge with regard to that.üîΩWhen one accepts that which contradicts it, then at that time one also understands that the scripture is not true.

original: de dang 'gal ba khas len pa ni //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba khas len pa ni //
translated: For, accepting that which contradicts it

original: de med par mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par mi 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not possible without the nonexistence of that.

original: rmongs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because of confusion,

original: rmongs na ni ston par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //üîΩrmongs pa bskyed nas de bzlog pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rmongs na ni ston par byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bshad zin to // rmongs pa bskyed nas de bzlog pa'i phyir na /
translated: we have already explained that if there is confusion, then there is no teaching.

original: rgol ba'i 'bras bu grub po zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba'i 'bras bu grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the result of the argument is established because confusion is generated and then eliminated,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dug kyang sbyin bar thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsmra ba la bzo ba nyid kyis rmongs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dug kyang sbyin bar thal ba'i phyir ro // smra ba la bzo ba nyid kyis rmongs par byed pa ni /
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that poison should also be given.

original: rgol ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the argument is the confusion of the opponent because of the skill in debate, that is not so.

original: yongs su dag pa'i dngos po gsal par ston pa ni smra ba la bzo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i dngos po gsal par ston pa ni smra ba la bzo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the skill in debate is the clear teaching of the pure thing.

original: 'di ltar / mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yis //
translated: Thus:

original: tshad ma dang ldan dngos po ni //
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan dngos po ni //
translated: The knowers of reality maintain

original: ston byed smra la bzo bar ni //
analyzed: ston byed smra la bzo bar ni //
translated: that the speaker is skilled in teaching

original: de nyid rig pa rnams kyis bzhed //üîΩrnam pa ji ltar yang rung ste //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa rnams kyis bzhed // rnam pa ji ltar yang rung ste //
translated: the entities endowed with valid cognitionüîΩthrough the concise and the extensive.

original: rgyal bar 'dod pas gzhan zlog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyal bar 'dod pas gzhan zlog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the one who wishes to be victorious refutes the other in any way at all,
that is not so.

original: yin te ; rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bas bzlog pas /
analyzed: yin te ; rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bas bzlog pas /
translated: Because the refutation in any way at all

original: gzhan dag / gzhan dag gis gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag / gzhan dag gis gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: would be a basis for others to refute you.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe yongs su dag pa'i dngos po brjod pas kyang gzhan rmongs pa de'i tshe ji ltar rgol ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe yongs su dag pa'i dngos po brjod pas kyang gzhan rmongs pa de'i tshe ji ltar rgol ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWhen the one who is speaking expresses a completely pure entity, at that time how is there a dispute?‚Äù

original: nyan pa po rtogs pas chog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan pa po rtogs pas chog pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because the listener is satisfied with understanding.

original: dmus long gis ma mthong bas ni nyi mas gsal bar byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmus long gis ma mthong bas ni nyi mas gsal bar byed pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The sun is not not illuminating because the blind do not see.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / skal ldan yang ni rtogs min na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skal ldan yang ni rtogs min na //
translated: If the fortunate do not understand,

original: ston par byed pa'i skyon yin gyi //
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i skyon yin gyi //
translated: the fault is in the teacher.

original: gal te mi shes tshig de las //
analyzed: gal te mi shes tshig de las //
translated: If the listener does not understand those words,

original: don rtogs med pas de mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don rtogs med pas de mi 'gyur //
translated: But since the meaning is not understood, it is not so.

original: gal te gsal ba brjod pas mi rtogs na //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba brjod pas mi rtogs na //
translated: If one does not understand through the expression of the manifest,

original: phyir rgol ba la dad pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la dad pas ci zhig bya //
translated: what will one do with the faith of the opponent?

original: de ni yi ge phyi mo 'don pa'i mkhan po'i khang par zhugs par rigs so //
analyzed: de ni yi ge phyi mo 'don pa'i mkhan po'i khang par zhugs par rigs so //
translated: It is proper to enter the house of the teacher who recites the alphabet.

original: 'on te mkhas pa dag la ni de lta bu'i /
analyzed: 'on te mkhas pa dag la ni de lta bu'i /
translated: But for the wise, such

original: sgrub byed nye bar dgod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub byed nye bar dgod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: a proof is not to be set forth,

original: mi mkhas pa la bstan pa'i don du dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa la bstan pa'i don du dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is set forth for the sake of teaching the unwise.

original: gang gi phyir de yang skyon 'brel par med pa nyid 'grel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yang skyon 'brel par med pa nyid 'grel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that also is a connection of faults, it is not so.

original: 'di ltar rin dang rin la de lta bu nyid kyi phur ma 'ching ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rin dang rin la de lta bu nyid kyi phur ma 'ching ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is a binding of the rosary of that kind on the price of the price.

original: 'di ni glen pa'i gtam 'dis nga'i slong phor du chang 'thungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni glen pa'i gtam 'dis nga'i slong phor du chang 'thungs te /
translated: This is the talk of a fool. I drank beer in his begging bowl.

original: ngas 'di'i slong phor du gcin 'thung ngo zhes bya ba de byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ngas 'di'i slong phor du gcin 'thung ngo zhes bya ba de byung ba yin no //
translated: I drank urine in his begging bowl.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / grangs can rang nyid mi rtag pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / grangs can rang nyid mi rtag pa //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself is impermanent,

original: nyid las sems med rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: nyid las sems med rtogs ma yin //
translated: but the mind is not understood from that.

original: des na grangs can rang nyid ni //
analyzed: des na grangs can rang nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself

original: rig la tshad ma gzhan yod 'gyur //
analyzed: rig la tshad ma gzhan yod 'gyur //
translated: would have another means of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i sgrub byed kyis rang nyid kyis bsgrub bya ni rtogs pas rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i sgrub byed kyis rang nyid kyis bsgrub bya ni rtogs pas rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that one should understand what is to be established by oneself through a means of establishment that is well established for another.

original: des na 'di'i don de sgrub bar byed pa rang la rab tu sgrub par byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di'i don de sgrub bar byed pa rang la rab tu sgrub par byed pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the means of establishing that meaning would be established for oneself.

original: de yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does exist,

original: de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na /
translated: then in that case,

original: rang rtogs gang las byung gyur pa'i //
analyzed: rang rtogs gang las byung gyur pa'i //
translated: from what does the understanding of oneself arise?

original: sgrub byed de ni cis mi brjod //
analyzed: sgrub byed de ni cis mi brjod //
translated: Why not state that means of establishment?

original: rang nyid la rab tu grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub par byed pa de nyid ci ste nye bar mi dgod de /
analyzed: rang nyid la rab tu grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub par byed pa de nyid ci ste nye bar mi dgod de /
translated: Why not set forth just that means of establishment that is well established for oneself?

original: nam mkha' bldad pa'i ral pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: nam mkha' bldad pa'i ral pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: What use is a braid of sky-gazing for another?

original: gtan tshigs gsal ba'i ngo bo yod bzhin du dka' ba byed pa'i do bo ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsal ba'i ngo bo yod bzhin du dka' ba byed pa'i do bo ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not good to make something difficult when the nature of the reason exists.

original: grangs can la de lung las grub pa'i phyir rang la grub pa'i sgrub byed nye bar ma bkod do zhe na /
analyzed: grangs can la de lung las grub pa'i phyir rang la grub pa'i sgrub byed nye bar ma bkod do zhe na /
translated: But since this is established for the Samkhya from scripture, he does not adduce a proof that is established for himself.

original: lung de nyid gzhan la yang sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: lung de nyid gzhan la yang sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt that scripture itself a proof for the other?

original: ma yin te gzhan la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te gzhan la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because it is not a valid cognition for the other.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa las rang nyid kyang ji @129b ltar rtogs /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa las rang nyid kyang ji @129b ltar rtogs /
translated: But how can you yourself understand it if it is not a valid cognition?

original: de la tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is a valid cognition for you.

original: gal te tshad ma yin na thams cad la ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na thams cad la ci ste ma yin /
translated: But if it is a valid cognition, why is it not so for everyone?

original: khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not accepted.

original: grangs can yang ci ste 'di las khas len nges brtags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: grangs can yang ci ste 'di las khas len nges brtags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But why is the Samkhya not certain about what is accepted from this?

original: gal te de lta na gzhan la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzhan la yang 'gyur te /
translated: If it is so, then it is also so for the other.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rigs pa gang gis lung 'dzin pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rigs pa gang gis lung 'dzin pa //
translated: By whatever reasoning you accept scripture,

original: de ni 'dis kyang cis mi 'dzin //
analyzed: de ni 'dis kyang cis mi 'dzin //
translated: why don‚Äôt you accept this?

original: rigs pa gang gis yongs su brtags pa'i lung grangs can gyis tshad mar 'dod pa'i rigs pa de sangs rgyas pa la yang ci ste ma yin des khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de lta 'o na mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis yongs su brtags pa'i lung grangs can gyis tshad mar 'dod pa'i rigs pa de sangs rgyas pa la yang ci ste ma yin des khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de lta 'o na mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa yin no
translated: Why is the reasoning that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya accept as valid in their scriptures not valid for Buddhists?

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang ji ltar khas len /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang ji ltar khas len /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause they do not accept it,‚Äù then how do you accept the reasoning that states, ‚ÄúBecause it is impermanent, it is without mind‚Äù?

original: rigs pas thob pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pas thob pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúOne must accept what is obtained through reasoning,‚Äù

original: bstan bcos khas len la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas len la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then it is the same for accepting a treatise.

original: de lta yin dang gnyis ka la grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa srid pa na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gnyis ka la grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa srid pa na /
translated: If that were the case, then when it is possible to establish something that is established for both parties,

original: sgrub par byed pa gzhan nye bar 'god pas bdag nyid ngal bar byed pas ci bya /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gzhan nye bar 'god pas bdag nyid ngal bar byed pas ci bya /
translated: what is the point of exhausting oneself by positing other forms of proof?

original: gal te don 'di ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te don 'di ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis point is to be realized by yogins and yoginƒ´s.

original: des na gzhan la ni sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: des na gzhan la ni sgrub par byed pa /
translated: Therefore it is to be realized by othersüîΩthrough any kind of proof,‚Äù

original: rnam pa ji lta bu yang rung pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bu yang rung pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: we reply:

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang rang gis bsgrub bya la brjod nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis kyang rang gis bsgrub bya la brjod nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: But can't another person also say, This is to be realized by the yogi with regard to what is to be established by oneself?

original: de'i rnal 'byor pa la tshad ma med do zhes kyang ;
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor pa la tshad ma med do zhes kyang ;
translated: And can't it also be said, The yogi has no valid cognition?

original: brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: brjod par mi nus te /
translated: That cannot be said.üîΩBecause:

original: 'di ltar / sngar ni sgrub byed gang dag gi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngar ni sgrub byed gang dag gi //
translated: Those who previously were ordinaryüîΩand realized the means of establishingüîΩthe faculties and elements

original: tha mal par 'gyur rtogs pa dang // dbang po 'byung ba'i sgrub de dag / de'i don nus shes la nus yin //
analyzed: tha mal par 'gyur rtogs pa dang // dbang po 'byung ba'i sgrub de dag / de'i don nus shes la nus yin //
translated: are capable of knowing the capable with regard to that object.

original: rang bzhin grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'ga' yang med de tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'ga' yang med de tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no yogi at all who has naturally established [valid cognition], because there is no valid cognition.

original: de ltar yang mi rtag na yang tshad med nyid ces sngar bshad zin to //üîΩde'i phyir tha mal par gyur pa las phyis thabs rjes su bsgrub pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rtag na yang tshad med nyid ces sngar bshad zin to // de'i phyir tha mal par gyur pa las phyis thabs rjes su bsgrub pas /
translated: Even if it is impermanent, it is still valid cognition, as explained before.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, one who was previously ordinary later becomes a yogi by accomplishing the means,

original: bkra shis kyis sgrub pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bkra shis kyis sgrub pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not by establishing good fortune.üîΩBecause it is like this:

original: de ltar yin dang / sgrub par byed pa gang dag gis //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang / sgrub par byed pa gang dag gis //
translated: Those who establish

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa dang / thabs de rjes su sgrub pa las dbang po 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs rtogs pa dang / thabs de rjes su sgrub pa las dbang po 'byung ba ste /
translated: The means of establishing that is the faculty of understanding, and the faculty that subsequently accomplishes that means is the faculty of practice.

original: don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum gyi dbang pho 'am /
analyzed: don de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum gyi dbang pho 'am /
translated: Or, the faculty of direct perception that has the nature of understanding that object is the faculty of understanding.

original: yang na de 'dra ba'i rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dbang po nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: yang na de 'dra ba'i rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dbang po nyid la brjod do //
translated: Or, the faculty that establishes such understanding is the faculty of understanding.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa de dag ni thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi dbang po de sgrub par byed pa nus pa ste mthu shes pa la nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa de dag ni thabs su gyur pa'i don gyi dbang po de sgrub par byed pa nus pa ste mthu shes pa la nus pa nyid do //
translated: The means of establishing that are the faculty of the object that is the means of establishing that, which is the power of knowing the potential.

original: de'i rnal 'byor @130a * //
analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor @130a * //
translated: The yogi

original: pas rtogs pa'i don khas len na'o //
analyzed: pas rtogs pa'i don khas len na'o //
translated: accepts the object that is understood.

original: des na med pa'i don sgrub par byed par nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na med pa'i don sgrub par byed par nye bar dgod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of positing the establishment of the object of nonexistence?

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pas rnal 'byor ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pas rnal 'byor ba'i sgrub par byed pa brjod pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang brjod par rigs so //
translated: Just as the Sugata described the establishment of the yogi, it is reasonable that others also describe it.

original: 'on te rnal 'byor pa srid pa'i sgo nas kyang de'i sgrub par byed pa nye bar blang bar nus pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rnal 'byor pa srid pa'i sgo nas kyang de'i sgrub par byed pa nye bar blang bar nus pa ma yin na /
translated: But if the yogi cannot even accept the existence of the means of establishing that,

original: de'i tshe 'dir mi smra ba nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir mi smra ba nyid 'thob po //
translated: then at that time, he should remain silent.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgang yang rjes 'gro rnam chad can //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gang yang rjes 'gro rnam chad can //
translated: Because:üîΩThat which is beyond the scope of both

original: spyis kyang spyod yul ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: spyis kyang spyod yul ma yin pa'i //
translated: the universal and the particularüîΩcannot be analyzed in terms of the probandum

original: don de dag la bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed dpyod pa cung zad med //üîΩdon gang zhig spyi nyid dam /
analyzed: don de dag la bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed dpyod pa cung zad med // don gang zhig spyi nyid dam /
translated: and the means of establishing it.

original: spyi'i khyad par gyis sgrub par byed pas rjes su rtogs par nus pa de la bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed la sems par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i khyad par gyis sgrub par byed pas rjes su rtogs par nus pa de la bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed la sems par byed pa yin no //
translated: That object which can be understood through the universal itself or through the particular of the universal is analyzed in terms of the probandum and the means of establishing it.

original: de la spyi sems pa ni /
analyzed: de la spyi sems pa ni /
translated: The thought of the universal is as follows:

original: re zhig nged kyi rnal 'byor pa srid pa dang / des don 'di mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang srid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig nged kyi rnal 'byor pa srid pa dang / des don 'di mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang srid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is possible that our yogi exists and sees this object.‚Äù

original: yang na don 'di nyid yin no zhes khyad par du'o //
analyzed: yang na don 'di nyid yin no zhes khyad par du'o //
translated: Or, ‚ÄúThis is the very object,‚Äù specifically.

original: gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba med pas spyis kyang yul du bya bar mi nus de lta bu'i dngos po dag la ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dbang du byas pa'i dpyod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba med pas spyis kyang yul du bya bar mi nus de lta bu'i dngos po dag la ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dbang du byas pa'i dpyod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But in the case of things that cannot be taken as objects even by a universal because they are not in any way related, there is no analysis at all in terms of what is to be established and the means of establishing it.

original: tshad ma'i dpyad pa lta re zhig zhog ste /
analyzed: tshad ma'i dpyad pa lta re zhig zhog ste /
translated: Let us set aside for the moment the analysis of valid cognition.

original: 'di na 'di lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di na 'di lung gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not understood by scripture alone.

original: des na de la tshad ma 'jug bar byed pa ni bdag nyid tshad ma'i yul mngon par mi shes pa /
analyzed: des na de la tshad ma 'jug bar byed pa ni bdag nyid tshad ma'i yul mngon par mi shes pa /
translated: Therefore, the one who engages valid cognition in this is showing himself to be one who does not understand the object of valid cognition.

original: ma rungs pa'i bdag nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rungs pa'i bdag nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: He is showing himself to be a bad person.

original: 'on te 'di ji srid ma rtogs pa de srid du ni sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba mi shes te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ji srid ma rtogs pa de srid du ni sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba mi shes te /
translated: Or, as long as this is not understood, the apparent proof is not known.

original: des na de'i bsam pas sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de'i bsam pas sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is established by his intention.

original: gang gi tshe 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes shes pa de'i tshe ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur bas 'di la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes shes pa de'i tshe ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur bas 'di la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: But when one knows that it is not a proof, then it is not a proof. So what is wrong with that?

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.üîΩBecause:

original: 'di ltar / skyes bu'i bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skyes bu'i bsam pa'i dbang gis na //
translated: By the power of the person‚Äôs intention,

original: de nyid de nyid mi 'jog na //üîΩgtan tshigs der snang med 'gyur te //
analyzed: de nyid de nyid mi 'jog na // gtan tshigs der snang med 'gyur te //
translated: that itself is not posited as that itself.üîΩThe reason would not appear as a reason,

original: de ni dngos rten min phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni dngos rten min phyir ro ;
translated: because it would not be based on a thing.

original: / skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam ni gtan tshigs kyang gtan tshigs ma yin pa dang / gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang gtan tshigs nyid du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam ni gtan tshigs kyang gtan tshigs ma yin pa dang / gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang gtan tshigs nyid du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mere desire of a person makes what is not a reason a reason and what is not a reason a reason,

original: gtan tshigs dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba 'am yod na ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang der snang ba rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ba 'am yod na ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa sel bar byed do //
translated: the positing of a reason and its appearance would be nonexistent. But if they exist, then the desire of a person is eliminated.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis @130b khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis @130b khas blangs pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is accepted by the other is not a proof.

original: gzhan yang ma brtags pa'i lung las ni shes pa tsam zhig skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma brtags pa'i lung las ni shes pa tsam zhig skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, from a scripture that is not examined, only a mere consciousness arises.

original: dngos po nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But the object is not ascertained.

original: shes pa tsam gyis ni dngos po 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa tsam gyis ni dngos po 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: An object is not established by a mere consciousness.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / don yod shes la ltos bcas yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don yod shes la ltos bcas yin //
translated: The existence of an object depends on consciousness.

original: med pa shes pas sgrub byed min //
analyzed: med pa shes pas sgrub byed min //
translated: A non-existent object is not established by consciousness.

original: yod kyang dngos dang 'brel med pa'i //
analyzed: yod kyang dngos dang 'brel med pa'i //
translated: Even if it exists, if it is not related to an object,

original: rtogs pa rtogs pa med dang mtshungs //
analyzed: rtogs pa rtogs pa med dang mtshungs //
translated: its cognition is like a cognition of non-existence.

original: don yod pa nyid gzhan sgrub par byed pa yin gyi med pa ma yin no //üîΩmed pa la grub pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu med pa can no //
analyzed: don yod pa nyid gzhan sgrub par byed pa yin gyi med pa ma yin no // med pa la grub pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu med pa can no //
translated: The existence of an object is established by another means of knowledge, not by non-existence.

original: med pa shes pa yod pa de las grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa shes pa yod pa de las grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that non-existence is established by the existence of the consciousness of non-existence,üîΩif it does not exist, how can it be known that it is the consciousness of that?

original: de med na de de'i shes pa yin no zhes gang las shes pa nyid dngos su sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de med na de de'i shes pa yin no zhes gang las shes pa nyid dngos su sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: How can it be established that it is a consciousness?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it cannot,

original: mngon sum nyid du thal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du thal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a direct perception.

original: de'i phyir med na shes pa las 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med na shes pa las 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it does not exist, it is not established by consciousness.

original: gal te shes pa tsam las kyang rtogs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa tsam las kyang rtogs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: If there is understanding even from mere consciousness,

original: rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bar sgro btags pa'i don can las so zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar yang rung bar sgro btags pa'i don can las so zhen ma yin te /
translated: it is not from an object that is superimposed in any way.

original: dngos po dang bcas pa'i sgro 'dogs pa ni dngos po'i sgo nyid nas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang bcas pa'i sgro 'dogs pa ni dngos po'i sgo nyid nas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Superimposition that has an entity is understood by way of the entity itself.

original: gal te dngos por gyur pa'i rtags med par ni rtogs kyang de'i tshe de rtogs pa ltar snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gal te dngos por gyur pa'i rtags med par ni rtogs kyang de'i tshe de rtogs pa ltar snang ba nyid de /
translated: If there is understanding without a sign that is an entity, then at that time it is just as if there is understanding of that.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdu ba min las dur rig las //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // du ba min las dur rig las //
translated: It is because it arises from a fallacious reason.

original: me rtogs pa ni bden ma yin //
analyzed: me rtogs pa ni bden ma yin //
translated: The understanding of fire from smoke is not true.

original: phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa //
translated: Superimposition in the opposite way

original: bsgrub bya sgrub par byed ma yin //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub par byed ma yin //
translated: is not the proof of the probandum.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par gtan la phab zin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par gtan la phab zin te /
translated: Moreover, this is already determined as inference for oneself.

original: rtags gsum nyid kyi don grub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags gsum nyid kyi don grub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the proof of the meaning of the three signs themselves, but not anything else.üîΩTherefore,

original: des na / rang bzhin dang ni 'bras bu 'am ;
analyzed: des na / rang bzhin dang ni 'bras bu 'am ;
translated: nature and effect,

original: / snang ba mthong ba med nyid rtags //
analyzed: / snang ba mthong ba med nyid rtags //
translated: The sign is the non-perception of appearance.

original: 'brel de dngos las grub yin na //
analyzed: 'brel de dngos las grub yin na //
translated: If the relation is established from the entity,

original: rang la ci yi phyir ma grub //
analyzed: rang la ci yi phyir ma grub //
translated: why is it not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself?

original: gal te bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du gyur par tshad mas sgrub pa'i phyir dngos po la grub pa yin na de'i tshe ci ste grangs can rang nyid la ma grub /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin du gyur par tshad mas sgrub pa'i phyir dngos po la grub pa yin na de'i tshe ci ste grangs can rang nyid la ma grub /
translated: If it is established in the entity because the valid cognition establishes it as the nature of the probandum, then why is it not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself?

original: tshad mas grub pa ni gnyis ka la grub pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ni gnyis ka la grub pa yin te /
translated: The establishment by valid cognition is established for both,

original: tshad mthun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mthun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the valid cognition is common.

original: 'on te tshad ma med na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang gzhan rtogs par ni mi rigs /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma med na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyis kyang gzhan rtogs par ni mi rigs /
translated: But if there is no valid cognition, then it is not reasonable for one to understand another.

original: ci ltar grangs can mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs khyed la grub pa de las rtogs par gyis shig ces /
analyzed: ci ltar grangs can mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs khyed la grub pa de las rtogs par gyis shig ces /
translated: Just as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya establishes for you the reason of impermanence and so on, understand it from that.

original: sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the proof is like that,

original: gzhan yang 'di ni @131a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni @131a * //
translated: in the same way, this

original: khyod la grub pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod la grub pa yin te /
translated: is established for you.

original: ji ltar tshad mas grub pa'i gtan tshigs las nga la rtogs pa de bzhin du rtogs pa dang ldan pa gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad mas grub pa'i gtan tshigs las nga la rtogs pa de bzhin du rtogs pa dang ldan pa gzhan yang yin no //
translated: Just as I have understood this argument through valid cognition, so too have others who possess understanding.

original: de lta ma yin na grangs can rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grangs can rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya would not have engaged in this analysis in the first place.

original: bdag gcig pu mkhas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu mkhas pa yin gyi /
translated: One would not think, ‚ÄúI alone am wise,

original: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes ni sems pa dang ldan pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no zhes ni sems pa dang ldan pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: but others are not like that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis ni mkhas pa rnams la sgrub par byed pa sbyor bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis ni mkhas pa rnams la sgrub par byed pa sbyor bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not right for the wise to engage in a proof that is based on the mere assertions of others.

original: 'o na ni ji ltar khyod dang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang gzhan la grub pa'i sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: 'o na ni ji ltar khyod dang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang gzhan la grub pa'i sgrub par byed pas /
translated: Well then, how is it that you and the masters of the past have engaged in proofs that are established for others?

original: bsgrub bya grub par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya grub par 'dod ce na /
translated: And how is it that you assert that the probandum is established?

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩgang phyir gzhan gyis brtags pa yis //üîΩthal ba sgrub pa gnyis 'brel phyir //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gang phyir gzhan gyis brtags pa yis // thal ba sgrub pa gnyis 'brel phyir //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause the reductio is related to the proof

original: gcig med na gzhan dgag phyir yin //
analyzed: gcig med na gzhan dgag phyir yin //
translated: through the relation of the absence of one entailing the absence of the other.

original: de ni thal bar bsgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni thal bar bsgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a reductio argument.

original: de las bsgrub bya nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bsgrub bya nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The conclusion is not ascertained from that.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam las ni bsgrub bya nges pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam las ni bsgrub bya nges pa med do //
translated: For, the conclusion is not ascertained from the mere acceptance of the other party.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is it?

original: 'brel pa de gcig med na gzhan med par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa de gcig med na gzhan med par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is in order to demonstrate that if one of the two relata does not exist, the other cannot exist.

original: bsgrub bya med par ni sgrub byed srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med par ni sgrub byed srid pa ma yin no //
translated: For, it is not possible for the proof to exist when the probandum does not exist.

original: thal bar bsgrub pa de ni 'di yin te /üîΩdu ma la sogs pa'i gcig po ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te /üîΩyul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges pa gcig dang 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du cha shas bsgyur bas kyang thams cad bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thal bar bsgrub pa de ni 'di yin te / du ma la sogs pa'i gcig po ni yul la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin te / yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par nges pa gcig dang 'dres pas rnam par ma bcad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du cha shas bsgyur bas kyang thams cad bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the reductio argument:üîΩThe one, such as the many, does not possess another, such as the object, because of being mixed with the one that is ascertained as the particular object, time, and occasion, and because of being empty of another that is not distinguished.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And in the same way, by changing the parts, everything is established, because of being undifferentiated.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i dngos po ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i dngos po ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a thing is incompatible with the connection to different objects, etc.

original: gal te gcig yin yang khyab pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa du ma dang 'brel ba ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig yin yang khyab pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa du ma dang 'brel ba ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: If it is one, then because it pervades, what is the incompatibility with its connection to many objects, etc.?

original: ma yin te dus du ma dang 'brel pa ni mthong ba mi nus pa'i phyir dang ngo //
analyzed: ma yin te dus du ma dang 'brel pa ni mthong ba mi nus pa'i phyir dang ngo //
translated: No, because its connection to many times is not seen.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su khyab pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su khyab pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The pervasion of the past and future is not perceived by direct perception,

original: sngon dang phyir ma'i dngos po ni rtog ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyir ma'i dngos po ni rtog ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past and future are the objects of inference.

original: gang zhig 'das par mthong ba de ni sngon gyi dus yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'das par mthong ba de ni sngon gyi dus yin la /
translated: That which is seen in the past is the prior time.

original: dus gang zhig ma 'ongs par mthong ba ni phyi ma'i dus yin te /
analyzed: dus gang zhig ma 'ongs par mthong ba ni phyi ma'i dus yin te /
translated: That which is seen in the future is the later time.

original: de'i dus su mthong ba'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i dus gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de'i dus su mthong ba'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i dus gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other time apart from the thing seen at that time.

original: gal te @131b dus med pa'i phyir ji ltar snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te @131b dus med pa'i phyir ji ltar snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: If there is no time, how can there be the conventions of prior, etc.?

original: de bzhin du yul yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Likewise, because the object does not exist,

original: dus yod kyang ji ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: dus yod kyang ji ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: how can there be a prior or subsequent designation of time?

original: dus dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ni snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ni snga ma la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that time becomes the object of the prior and subsequent designations merely by being related to them,

original: da ltar byung ba yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present would also be a prior or subsequent designation.

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because time is different.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / gang zhig sngon gyi dus sogs dang // ldan de sngon sogs tha snyad ston //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zhig sngon gyi dus sogs dang // ldan de sngon sogs tha snyad ston //
translated: that which possesses a prior time, etc. is designated as prior, etc.

original: de'i yang sngon dang phyi ma ni //
analyzed: de'i yang sngon dang phyi ma ni //
translated: Its prior and subsequent

original: ngo bo nyid las gzhan min phyir //üîΩsngon gyi dus kyi dngos po dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gzhan min phyir // sngon gyi dus kyi dngos po dang ldan pa ni /
translated: are not different from its intrinsic reality.

original: sngon yin la /
analyzed: sngon yin la /
translated: That which possesses a prior time is prior.

original: phyi ma'i dus kyi dngos po dang ldan pa ni de bzhin du phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus kyi dngos po dang ldan pa ni de bzhin du phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which possesses a subsequent time is subsequent.

original: dus nyid ji ltar sngon yin zhe na /
analyzed: dus nyid ji ltar sngon yin zhe na /
translated: How can time itself be prior?

original: dus kyi sngon nyid la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nas yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi sngon nyid la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nas yin no //
translated: The prior time, etc. of time is just its intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhe na /üîΩ'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yang yin no zhe na / 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The object is also like that.üîΩThis is not so, because

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩde dag rtags dang khyab nyid na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / de dag rtags dang khyab nyid na //
translated: if that is so,üîΩthen how could the sign and the pervasion

original: sngon nyid la sogs ji ltar grub //
analyzed: sngon nyid la sogs ji ltar grub //
translated: be established prior to the object?

original: lhan cig spyod pa de bzhin phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa de bzhin phyir //
translated: If you say that it is because they are coexistent,

original: zhe na phan tshun rten par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhe na phan tshun rten par 'gyur //
translated: then they would mutually rely on each other.

original: yul dang dus khyab pa dang / rtag pa yin yang /
analyzed: yul dang dus khyab pa dang / rtag pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the object and time pervade and are permanent,

original: ra ma na la sogs pa lhan cig spyod pa sngon la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ra ma na la sogs pa lhan cig spyod pa sngon la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the coexistent one is prior, etc.,

original: de ltar 'gyur bas ci 'gal /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bas ci 'gal /
translated: it is like that. What is the contradiction?

original: lhan cig spyod pas 'ga' zhig la yang tha snyad mi byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pas 'ga' zhig la yang tha snyad mi byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that no convention is made with respect to anything by the coexistent one,

original: dper na khri'u 'bod do zhes bya ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na khri'u 'bod do zhes bya ba bzhin no ;
translated: just as, for example, one says ‚ÄúI am called Khri‚Äôu.‚Äù

original: / de bzhin du 'dir yang dus de ni 'das so zhes tha snyad do zhe na des na phan tshun du rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur bar khyod dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //üîΩlhan cig spyod pa'i snga ma nyid //
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'dir yang dus de ni 'das so zhes tha snyad do zhe na des na phan tshun du rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur bar khyod dang 'brel par 'gyur ro // lhan cig spyod pa'i snga ma nyid //
translated: If you say that in the same way here, too, the convention is ‚Äúthat time has passed,‚Äù then you would be related to the error of mutual reliance.üîΩThe prior coexistent one

original: sngar ni dus dang 'brel pa las //
analyzed: sngar ni dus dang 'brel pa las //
translated: is prior because of the relation with time.

original: dus kyi sngon nyid la sogs kyang //
analyzed: dus kyi sngon nyid la sogs kyang //
translated: And the prior time, etc.

original: lhan cig spyod dang 'brel phyir yin //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod dang 'brel phyir yin //
translated: Are related to the co-existent.

original: gcig ni sngon du ma grub na //
analyzed: gcig ni sngon du ma grub na //
translated: If one does not exist prior to the other,

original: gcig kyang gnas par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig kyang gnas par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can one exist at all?

original: gnyis po lhan cig 'byung na ni //
analyzed: gnyis po lhan cig 'byung na ni //
translated: If the two exist simultaneously,

original: sngon nyid phan tshun byas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon nyid phan tshun byas mi 'gyur //
translated: They cannot be prior to each other.

original: ci srid dus snga ma nyid la sogs pa ma yin pa de srid du lhan cig spyod pa rnams mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: ci srid dus snga ma nyid la sogs pa ma yin pa de srid du lhan cig spyod pa rnams mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa mi 'grub po //
translated: As long as the prior time, etc. do not exist, the co-existent does not exist. Therefore, the desired conclusion is not established.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i snga ma'i nyid la sogs pa dus mtshungs pa dang phan tshun byed pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir phan tshun byas pa nyid med pas rang bzhin de rang gi rgyus skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i snga ma'i nyid la sogs pa dus mtshungs pa dang phan tshun byed pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir phan tshun byas pa nyid med pas rang bzhin de rang gi rgyus skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the prior time, etc. are simultaneous with the other, and if the prior time, etc. are not perceived as mutually produced, then they are not mutually produced. Therefore, since that nature is produced by its own cause,

original: snga ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po nyid yin te /
analyzed: snga ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo de ni dngos po nyid yin te /
translated: that nature of the prior time, etc. is a real entity.

original: de'i phyir dus yongs su rtogs pa ni don med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus yongs su rtogs pa ni don med do //
translated: Therefore, the complete understanding of time is pointless.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dngos po @132a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dngos po @132a * //
translated: In this way, a past entity

original: gang yin pa de ni snga ma yin par brjod la /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni snga ma yin par brjod la /
translated: That which is past is said to be that which existed previously.üîΩThat which is not realized is said to be that which will exist in the future.

original: gang rtogs pa ma yin pa de ni phyi ma gang yod pa de ni da ltar bar brjod do //
analyzed: gang rtogs pa ma yin pa de ni phyi ma gang yod pa de ni da ltar bar brjod do //
translated: That which exists is said to be that which exists in the present.

original: gal te dus med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dus med pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that this is not so because time does not exist,

original: 'di nyid ci ltar zhe na dus yod kyang ji ltar zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di nyid ci ltar zhe na dus yod kyang ji ltar zhes bstan zin to //
translated: then we reply that we have already shown that time exists.

original: des na 'di ni lan ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang / rgyu yod pa dang med pa las //
analyzed: des na 'di ni lan ma yin no // gzhan yang / rgyu yod pa dang med pa las //
translated: Therefore, this is not a proper response.üîΩMoreover:üîΩThe effect exists and does not exist

original: 'bras bu yod dang med de'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod dang med de'i phyir //
translated: in relation to the existent and nonexistent cause.

original: snga ma phyi ma rnams gnas pas //
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma rnams gnas pas //
translated: Since the former and latter

original: ma mthong brtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: ma mthong brtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: are established, what is the use of imagining the unseen?

original: sngon dang phyi yi tha snyad ni //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi yi tha snyad ni //
translated: The conventions of former and latter

original: yod pa dang med pa rnam par gnas pas yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa rnam par gnas pas yin no //
translated: are established in relation to existence and nonexistence.

original: de yang rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag las rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu nyid yod pa dang med pa las yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtogs pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu yod pa dang med pa dag las rgyu de yang rang gi rgyu nyid yod pa dang med pa las yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtogs pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the effect exists and does not exist in relation to the existent and nonexistent cause. That cause also exists and does not exist in relation to its own cause. Therefore it is not logical to imagine that the unseen is realized.

original: 'on te yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dus 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dus 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that the cause of the determination of the nature of long and short, etc., is time without beginning or end,

original: de yang cung zad kyang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / gal te yun ring myur sogs blo'i//
analyzed: de yang cung zad kyang ma yin te / 'di ltar / gal te yun ring myur sogs blo'i//
translated: then that is not so in the least.üîΩThus:üîΩIf you assert that the apprehension of long and short, etc.,

original: bzung ba dus su 'dod na ni //üîΩthog ma tha ma med dus las //
analyzed: bzung ba dus su 'dod na ni // thog ma tha ma med dus las //
translated: is in time,üîΩthen how could the cognition of long, etc.,

original: ci ltar myur sogs blo 'gyur yin //
analyzed: ci ltar myur sogs blo 'gyur yin //
translated: occur in time without beginning or end?

original: gal te blo de dag dus kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe thog ma dad tha ma med pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid kyis de nyid 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te blo de dag dus kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe thog ma dad tha ma med pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid kyis de nyid 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If those cognitions apprehend the nature of time, then at that time, since it is without beginning or end, it would be apprehended by pervasion alone,

original: yun ring po la sogs pa gzhan gyis de lta bur 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po la sogs pa gzhan gyis de lta bur 'dzin pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible that another, such as long, etc., could apprehend it.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: That which is the nature of the object

original: de nyid don du rigs par rtogs //üîΩdngos po rnam pa gzhan du ni //
analyzed: de nyid don du rigs par rtogs // dngos po rnam pa gzhan du ni //
translated: is understood as the object by reasoning.üîΩIt is not asserted that things

original: gnas par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: remain in another aspect.

original: yun ring myur sogs dbye ba rnams //
analyzed: yun ring myur sogs dbye ba rnams //
translated: The divisions of long, short, etc.,

original: phan tshun du ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni tha dad phyir //
translated: Because they are different from each other.

original: de ni dus la thal 'gyur bas //
analyzed: de ni dus la thal 'gyur bas //
translated: That is the consequence of your theory of time.

original: khyab dang gcig nyid ci ltar yin ;
analyzed: khyab dang gcig nyid ci ltar yin ;
translated: How can there be pervasion and identity?

original: /'on te / don 'di dus ni yun ring zhes //
analyzed: /'on te / don 'di dus ni yun ring zhes //
translated: But if you say that this object is time because it endures for a long time,

original: gnas lugs rnam par dbye ba las //
analyzed: gnas lugs rnam par dbye ba las //
translated: then the divisions of the mode of being

original: yun ring mi ring sogs dbye rnams //
analyzed: yun ring mi ring sogs dbye rnams //
translated: of long and short, etc.,

original: dus kyi rang bzhin rjes 'gro nyid //
analyzed: dus kyi rang bzhin rjes 'gro nyid //
translated: are just the nature of time.

original: yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa ni dus kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro bar gtogs kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nang du gtogs pa ni ma yin pas na khyab pa'i dus rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa ni dus kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro bar gtogs kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nang du gtogs pa ni ma yin pas na khyab pa'i dus rnam par gnas so //
translated: Long and short, etc., are just the nature of time, not the nature of things. Therefore, pervasive time is established.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'brel par rtogs pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang dang rjes su 'brel par rtogs pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is understood to be related to something possesses that,

original: dper na khra bo ba lang gi rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel par rtogs pa de dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin pas dus kyang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: dper na khra bo ba lang gi rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel par rtogs pa de dang ldan pa yin pa bzhin pas dus kyang de bzhin du rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: just as a multicolored cow is understood to be related to the nature of a cow and possesses that. Therefore, time is established in the same way.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then

original: yun @132b ring myur sogs dbye ba ni //
analyzed: yun @132b ring myur sogs dbye ba ni //
translated: The divisions of time are long, short, etc.

original: dus kyi rang bzhin rjes 'grol //
analyzed: dus kyi rang bzhin rjes 'grol //
translated: Time is the nature of that which follows.

original: dus zhes bya ba spyi yin pa //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba spyi yin pa //
translated: Time is a universal.

original: de'i phyir dus ni 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus ni 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, time is not established.

original: dus kyi rdzas kyi tshig don gyi nang du 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dus kyi rdzas kyi tshig don gyi nang du 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Time is asserted to be the meaning of the word substance.

original: spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a universal.

original: de ni tshig gis don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshig gis don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is a different meaning of the word.

original: yun ring ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dus su ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yun ring ba la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dus su ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Time does not exist apart from long, etc.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni de dag la ming tsam zhig 'ga' zhig gis zor yang bar bya ba'i don du bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni de dag la ming tsam zhig 'ga' zhig gis zor yang bar bya ba'i don du bkod pa yin no //
translated: Time is a mere name that someone has designated for the sake of ease of expression.

original: yun ring la sogs de dag kyang //
analyzed: yun ring la sogs de dag kyang //
translated: Long, etc.,

original: byed pa las ni gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: byed pa las ni gzhan ma yin //
translated: are not different from activity.

original: yun ring bya zhes de lta bur //
analyzed: yun ring bya zhes de lta bur //
translated: Long is activity.

original: bya ba'i rang bzhin la 'jug phyir //
analyzed: bya ba'i rang bzhin la 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it is engaged in the nature of activity.

original: yun ring po nas byas so zhes byed pa dang gzhi mthun par rtogs pas yun ring po la sogs pa'i de nyid ni /
analyzed: yun ring po nas byas so zhes byed pa dang gzhi mthun par rtogs pas yun ring po la sogs pa'i de nyid ni /
translated: Since long, etc., are understood to be common to activity and substance, the reality of long, etc.,

original: bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi nang du chud pa nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi nang du chud pa nyid do //
translated: It is included in the nature of action.

original: bya ba yang las dang byed pa po'i dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba yang las dang byed pa po'i dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: And action is not different from the entity of the object and the agent.

original: 'di ltar / lha sbyin byed ces byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lha sbyin byed ces byed pa ni //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúDevadatta acts.‚ÄùüîΩThe action is not understood

original: byed pa po las tha dad du //üîΩrtogs min de ni tshad ma yis //
analyzed: byed pa po las tha dad du // rtogs min de ni tshad ma yis //
translated: as different from the agent.üîΩIt is not understood as one,

original: gcig nyid du ni rtogs phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni rtogs phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood by valid cognition.

original: las byed bum pa byed do zhes bya ba la bum pa dang las byed kyi khyad par las tha dad pa'i bya ba ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las byed bum pa byed do zhes bya ba la bum pa dang las byed kyi khyad par las tha dad pa'i bya ba ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the statement ‚ÄúThe pot is the object of the action of making,‚Äù the action that is different from the pot and the object of the action of making is not perceived by direct perception.

original: de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin pas bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin pas bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is not perceived by inference either. Therefore action does not exist.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / chad gyur las gzhan bcad pa med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chad gyur las gzhan bcad pa med //
translated: There is no cutting apart that is different from the object of cutting.

original: 'gro bo las gzhan 'gro ba med //üîΩthog med bag chags khyad par las //
analyzed: 'gro bo las gzhan 'gro ba med // thog med bag chags khyad par las //
translated: There is no going that is different from the goer.üîΩImagination is only different

original: rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tha dad yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tha dad yin //
translated: from the special predispositions of beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags dang rgyud 'brel par byas pa dang / don gyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags dang rgyud 'brel par byas pa dang / don gyi de kho na nyid la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: It is the object of the conceptual consciousness that is associated with beginningless latent potentialities and that is attached to the reality of the object.

original: nyams par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tha dad par nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tha dad par nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: The individual who has this fault is posited as distinct from the object of the conceptual consciousness.

original: tha dad pa las bzlog pa la yang tha dad par shes par byed de /
analyzed: tha dad pa las bzlog pa la yang tha dad par shes par byed de /
translated: And the object of the conceptual consciousness is understood to be distinct from the object of the nonconceptual consciousness.

original: des na bya ba tha dad par zhen pa 'di ni phyin ci log pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: des na bya ba tha dad par zhen pa 'di ni phyin ci log pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this attachment to the difference of action is nothing but a mistake.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te bya ba lhas byin las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te bya ba lhas byin las //
translated: If the action were not different from Devadatta,

original: tha dad med na gzhan dag der //
analyzed: tha dad med na gzhan dag der //
translated: others would not have that action.üîΩAlso, because of having the action, the action is imagined to be different.

original: mi 'gyur gzhan yang bya ba dang // ldan phyir bya ba gzhan zhes brtag /'di yang sngar bstan zin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi 'gyur gzhan yang bya ba dang // ldan phyir bya ba gzhan zhes brtag /'di yang sngar bstan zin pa nyid de /
translated: This has already been explained earlier.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa'i yid kyis rtogs pa las ma rtogs par mngon sum gyi ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par rtogs pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po dang po //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa'i yid kyis rtogs pa las ma rtogs par mngon sum gyi ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par rtogs pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po dang po //
translated: The conceptual consciousness that arises from beginningless latent potentialities does not understand the object of the nonconceptual consciousness as it is. It does not understand the object of the nonconceptual consciousness as it is.

original: 'on te bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'on te bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: But if this so-called action

original: yod pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin pas /
translated: does not exist,

original: mngon sum gyis tha dad par dmigs @133a * //üîΩpa ma yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis tha dad par dmigs @133a * // pa ma yin na /
translated: then it is not perceived as different by direct perception.

original: gal te yod pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin du chug pa da ltar na yang rtags la sogs pa dang ldan par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te yod pa nyid du gyur pa ma yin du chug pa da ltar na yang rtags la sogs pa dang ldan par ma gyur mod /
translated: If it does not exist, then it is not endowed with signs and so on.üîΩBut if it is different from things, what contradiction is there in perceiving it by direct perception?

original: dngos po las tha dad pa yin na mngon sum gyis dmigs pa la 'gal ba ci yod des na yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i rtag pa'i bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad pa yin na mngon sum gyis dmigs pa la 'gal ba ci yod des na yun ring ba dang myur ba la sogs pa'i rtag pa'i bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin gyi de kho na nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only the particular action of permanence, such as being long or short, but not reality.

original: ci ltar 'di ltar de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di ltar de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bzhin no //
translated: It is like the meaning of ‚Äújust like this‚Äù and so on.üîΩJust like this, these

original: 'di ltar de bzhin zhes 'di dag / dngos po las ni tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin zhes 'di dag / dngos po las ni tha dad 'gyur //
translated: would be different from things.

original: gal te rnam rtog tha dad kyi //
analyzed: gal te rnam rtog tha dad kyi //
translated: If they are different concepts,

original: sgrub byed yin na ji ltar dang // gal te gang zhig rnam par rtog pa gang dang ldan pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don de nyid don dam pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: sgrub byed yin na ji ltar dang // gal te gang zhig rnam par rtog pa gang dang ldan pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don de nyid don dam pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If the ultimate is the very object of the conceptual thought that possesses the conceptual thought, and it is the nature that is in accordance with that, then

original: de ltar la sogs pa yid tshig gi don du 'gyur bas de dag gang gi nang du bsdu /
analyzed: de ltar la sogs pa yid tshig gi don du 'gyur bas de dag gang gi nang du bsdu /
translated: in that case, since such things as long and short would be the object of the word, in which of them are they included?

original: dus la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod la ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod la ma rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that time and so on are the reason for that, nor are they not realized.

original: 'on te de dag ni bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag ni bya ba'i khyad par nyid yin na /
translated: But if they are the distinction of action,

original: de lta yin na yun ring ba la sogs pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: de lta yin na yun ring ba la sogs pa yang yin pas /
translated: in that case, since they are also long and so on,

original: dus la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngal ba ni don med do //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngal ba ni don med do //
translated: the effort to realize time and so on is pointless.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dus su gyur pa'i tshig gi don 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis ni khyab pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dus su gyur pa'i tshig gi don 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis ni khyab pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no apprehension of the object of the word that occurs at an earlier or later time, perception does not apprehend the pervasion.

original: 'on te dus khyab pa med kyang yul khyab par 'dzin pa ni 'gal ba med par 'dod na ma yin te de la yang de'i rten las tha dad par spyi la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te dus khyab pa med kyang yul khyab par 'dzin pa ni 'gal ba med par 'dod na ma yin te de la yang de'i rten las tha dad par spyi la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you maintain that there is no contradiction in apprehending a universal as pervading its object even though it does not pervade time, then that is not so, because a universal, etc. is not perceived as separate from its basis.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang 'brel par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni yul la sogs pa tha dad pa dang 'brel par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a nature is incompatible with being related to different objects, etc.

original: der zhugs pa ni gzhan du yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni gzhan du yang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: And if it does enter there, it would not be so elsewhere,

original: tha dad pa med pas thams cad zhugs pa na gong bu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas thams cad zhugs pa na gong bu gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would not be different. If it entered everywhere, it would be a single mass.

original: rten der ma zhugs par ni der zhugs pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten der ma zhugs par ni der zhugs pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And if it did not enter that basis, it would not enter there.

original: 'on te 'di gnyis mtshungs so snyam pa'i blo skyes pa yin te des na spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di gnyis mtshungs so snyam pa'i blo skyes pa yin te des na spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that these two are similar, and therefore a universal is both different and not different,

original: 'di la brjod pa /üîΩblo rnams mtshungs pa nyid yin na //üîΩci ltar don ni mtshungs pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa / blo rnams mtshungs pa nyid yin na // ci ltar don ni mtshungs pa nyid //
translated: we reply:üîΩIf the cognitions are the same,üîΩhow are the objects the same?

original: gzhan du mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan du mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: If they are the same due to similarity,

original: mtshungs de gzhan la 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: mtshungs de gzhan la 'gyur ma yin //
translated: It is not the other, nor is it similar.

original: mtshungs rnams don la yod na ni //
analyzed: mtshungs rnams don la yod na ni //
translated: If the similarity were in the object,

original: don las tha dad par rig 'gyur //
analyzed: don las tha dad par rig 'gyur //
translated: it would be known as separate from the object.

original: don la mthong ba med pa ni //
analyzed: don la mthong ba med pa ni //
translated: But since it is not seen in the object,

original: ci ltar don la yod par brtags //
analyzed: ci ltar don la yod par brtags //
translated: how can it be imagined to be in the object?

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i rnams pa can gyi blo skye ba zhes brjod pa 'di'i don gang yin /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i rnams pa can gyi blo skye ba zhes brjod pa 'di'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúthe arising of a cognition having the aspect of a universal‚Äù?

original: don ma rtogs par @133b rnam pa ci ltar rung bar rtogs pa'i don can gyi tshig gis ni don bden pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don ma rtogs par @133b rnam pa ci ltar rung bar rtogs pa'i don can gyi tshig gis ni don bden pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Without understanding the meaning, how can the expression be understood? A statement having a meaning that is not understood does not prove the truth of the meaning.

original: rnam par dpyad na ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /üîΩbrgya zhig la rang gi ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te / brgya zhig la rang gi ngo bo mtshungs pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i rnam pa'am /
translated: When analyzed, the meaning of the expression ‚Äúa cognition having the aspect of a universal‚Äù is twofold.üîΩIn some cases, it is an aspect that is similar because of the similarity of its own nature.

original: yang na don gyi rnam pa mtshungs pa'i phyir yin /
analyzed: yang na don gyi rnam pa mtshungs pa'i phyir yin /
translated: Or, in some cases, it is because the aspect of the object is similar.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another aspect is impossible.

original: rang gi ngo bo mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the form is the same as its own nature, then it would be its own nature.

original: don rnam pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rnam pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would not be the same as the object, because it does not possess the same form as the object.

original: blo'i rnam pa de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa de yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: And that form of cognition is just its own characteristic,

original: de'i spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: not its universal,

original: de'i blo gzhan la med pa'i phyir dang / don la brten pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te don gyi rnam pa nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i blo gzhan la med pa'i phyir dang / don la brten pa yang med pa'i phyir ro // 'on te don gyi rnam pa nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no cognition of that in another, and because it does not depend on an object.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo zhes brjod do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo zhes brjod do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
translated: But if it is said that it is called a cognition having that form because the form of the object is the same, that is not correct,

original: rnam pa gnyis snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that two forms would appear.

original: rnam pa gnyis po de ni snang ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po de ni snang ba nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that those two forms are just the appearance, that is not so,

original: 'di ltar / rang lta'i phyogs su lhung bas na //üîΩtshig tsam gyis ni rtogs pa las //üîΩdon grub ma lus grub 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang lta'i phyogs su lhung bas na // tshig tsam gyis ni rtogs pa las // don grub ma lus grub 'gyur te //
translated: because in that case,üîΩone would understand the meaningüîΩmerely by the words,

original: sgra ni kun la 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni kun la 'jug phyir ro //
translated: because the words would be the same as the meaning.üîΩBut that is not so, because the words are not the same as the meaning.

original: des na rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: des na rnam pa mtshungs pa can gyi blo zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this so-called ‚Äúcognition that has similar aspects‚Äù

original: blo med kyi blo 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: blo med kyi blo 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: is a non-cognition, a confused cognition.

original: des na spyi yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal does not exist.

original: 'on te lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid de dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ni yul dang dus la sogs par nges pa'i gsal ba gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid de dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ni yul dang dus la sogs par nges pa'i gsal ba gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the universal is not different from the cow itself, which is characterized by having a dewlap and so on, and that the universal is the object that is ascertained in terms of place, time, and so on, then the error does not arise because the universal is possessed by other instances.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / de ltar mngon sum gyis bzung ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ltar mngon sum gyis bzung ba //
translated: Since that which is apprehended by direct perception

original: med phyir rnam pa'ang gcig ma yin ;
analyzed: med phyir rnam pa'ang gcig ma yin ;
translated: does not exist, the aspects are not one.

original: / gcig phyir gcig ni shes pas na //
analyzed: / gcig phyir gcig ni shes pas na //
translated: Since they are one, a single cognition

original: gsal ba thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: would apprehend all instances.

original: rnam pa gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the aspects are one,

original: rnam pa gcig bzung na yang rnam pa dang ldan pa'i don thams cad gzung bar thal lo /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig bzung na yang rnam pa dang ldan pa'i don thams cad gzung bar thal lo /
translated: if one aspect is apprehended, it follows that all objects that possess aspects would be apprehended.

original: 'on te rnam pa ni gzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa ni gzung ba nyid do //
translated: But if you say that the aspects are apprehended,

original: rnam pa dang ldan pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang ldan pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition would not apprehend the form,

original: de las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different from it.

original: tha dad par ni 'dzin par nus pa ma yin gyi /
